Headline: Samsung Galaxy S25 series launch next week: India price, specs and all we knowSamsung is scheduled to launch the new Galaxy S25 series next week on January 22. The series is expected to include four smartphones: the Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, Galaxy S25 Ultra, and the Galaxy S25 Slim.
Content:
Samsung is set to host its annual Galaxy Unpacked event on January 22, where it will launch four new smartphones: the Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, Galaxy 25 Ultra, and the Galaxy S25 Slim. From what the rumours suggest so far, at the time of the event, Samsung will only be launching its usual suspects, the standard variant, the plus variant, and the Ultra variant. The Galaxy S25 Slim, however, is expected to only be unveiled at the event next week, with the launch believed to happen some time later. The timeline for the S25 Slim’s launch and sale is yet to be revealed.  While Samsung has been keeping mum about the details about its 2025 flagship smartphones, nothing has been able to stop the rumour mill from churning out constant speculation about what the Galaxy S25 phones could be like. And thanks to the myriad of reports ahead of the launch event next week, we already know what to expect from the design, chipset, camera, and pricing of the new phones. Samsung Galaxy S25 series: Expected price in India  Pricing for the Galaxy S25 series has surfaced through leaks, giving us a glimpse of how much it would cost in India. And from what the reports suggest, the smartphones are going to be more expensive than last year’s Galaxy S24 series. Galaxy S25: The base 128GB variant is expected to start at 964 euros (approximately Rs 85,000), with 256GB and 512GB models priced at 1,026 euros (Rs 91,000) and 1,151 euros (Rs 1,01,000), respectively.   Galaxy S25+: Starting at 1,235 euros (Rs 1,09,000) for 256GB, while the 512GB variant could cost 1,359 euros (Rs 1,20,000).   Galaxy S25 Ultra: The most premium model starts at 1,557 euros (Rs 1,38,000) for the base variant and goes up to 1,930 euros (Rs 1,70,000) for the 1TB configuration.   For comparison, last year’s Galaxy S24 series launched at slightly lower prices than the anticipated Galaxy S25 lineup. The Galaxy S24 was available at a starting price of Rs 79,999 for the 8GB + 256GB variant, while the 8GB + 512GB model was priced at Rs 89,999.   The Galaxy S24+ had a starting price of Rs 99,999 for the 12GB + 256GB option, increasing to Rs 1,09,999 for the 12GB + 512GB version. The Galaxy S24 Ultra started at Rs 1,29,999 for the 12GB + 256GB configuration, with the 12GB + 512GB variant priced at Rs 1,39,999 and the 12GB + 1TB model costing Rs 1,59,999.  Samsung Galaxy S25 series: Specifications and features Design and build  The Galaxy S25 and S25+ retain a familiar aesthetic with three distinct rear cameras, sleek frames, and ultra-thin bezels. Meanwhile, the Galaxy S25 Ultra is rumoured to adopt a rounded design, deviating from the boxy look of its predecessors. Notable tweaks include thinner bezels and camera lens rings that match the frame colour, giving it a more refined appearance.   The standout device, the Galaxy S25 Slim, is rumoured to be just 6.4mm thick without the camera bump, making it Samsung’s thinnest phone yet. Despite its slim profile, the smartphone will reportedly offer a 6.7 to 6.8-inch display.  Cameras The Galaxy S25 and S25+ are believed to share a triple-camera setup:  
- 50-megapixel primary sensor  
- 10-megapixel telephoto lens (3x zoom)  
- 12-megapixel ultra-wide camera   The Ultra model features a quad-camera setup, including a 200-megapixel main sensor, a 50-megapixel ultra-wide lens, and a 50-megapixel telephoto lens with 3.5x optical zoom. Selfies across the series will be handled by a 12-megapixel front camera.   Performance and battery All models are believed to be powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite chip. This was also hinted at in a tweet posted by Snapdragon, which was a reply to Samsung’s announcement of the Galaxy Unpacked event. The post read: “See you there”.
 


 The Galaxy S25 phones are also expected to be paired with up to 12GB RAM. The Ultra model is said to feature a 5,000mAh battery with up to 31 hours of video playback. The S25+ will likely retain its predecessor’s 4,900mAh capacity. AI-driven features The Galaxy S25 series will debut Gemini AI, Google’s rebranded assistant. The new “Hey Gemini” wake word replaces “Hey Google,” and Gemini will integrate with Samsung apps like Notes and YouTube. Additionally, AI features such as “Brief” deliver daily summaries, commute assistance, and photo collages for end-of-day highlights.  Samsung Galaxy S25 series: Pre-reservation   Ahead of the launch event on January 22, pre-reservations for the Galaxy S25 series in India are open. You can pre-order a Galaxy S25 device for Rs 1,999, which will not exactly reserve a phone for you –– you can’t even pick and reserve a particular model right now –– but it will provide early access and benefits valued up to Rs 5,000 to customers who reserve the device right now. The payment is fully refundable in case of cancellation. Customers who pre-order through Samsung’s website can select exclusive colour options, customise RAM and storage configurations, and enjoy premium trade-in offers for their existing devices.

Headline: Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim leaks: Design, battery, display, and everything else to knowSamsung is rumoured to introduce the Galaxy S25 Slim alongside the usual S25, S25+, and S25 Ultra, at Galaxy Unpacked on January 22. Here's everything you need to know about the upcoming high-end smartphone.
Content:
Samsung's Galaxy S25 series is rumoured to get a new addition this year, with the company set to release the Galaxy S25 Slim alongside the usual S25, S25+, and S25 Ultra. The S25 Slim, as its name suggests, promises to be the thinnest model in the series, and recent leaks are offering a closer look at what to expect. The Galaxy S25 Slim is expected to be remarkably thin. A recent leak suggests the phone will measure just 6.4mm in thickness. For comparison, the Galaxy S24+ is slightly thicker at 7.7mm. This should make the new model an appealing choice for those who prefer a sleeker, more compact design without sacrificing too much on performance. However, that slim profile may come with trade-offs, particularly when it comes to battery life and heat management. The Galaxy S25 Slim is rumoured to feature a 6.7-inch to 6.8-inch display, placing it in the same size range as the Galaxy S25+ model. The slim design, however, may impact the overall battery capacity, which is expected to be between 3,000 mAh and 4,000 mAh. This is disappointing for a flagship, especially considering that mid-range Chinese phones such as the Poco X7 Pro already have a 6,550mAh silicon carbon battery under the hood. Samsung and Apple have yet to adopt the new silicon carbon technology to boost battery density, and it’s likely the S25 Slim will struggle to keep up in this area.

Image credit: Onleaks / Smartprix
 On the performance front, the Galaxy S25 Slim is expected to pack Qualcomm’s Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, paired with 12GB of RAM. It will run Android 15 with One UI 7 from day one. Early benchmark results from a prototype show a single-core score of 3,005 and a multi-core score of 6,945. While these scores may seem low, it’s important to remember that prototypes often deliver lower results. The slim design of the phone could be playing a role here, possibly affecting the device’s heat dissipation capabilities, which could impact performance. The Galaxy S25 Slim is rumoured to feature a triple-camera setup, including a 200-megapixel primary camera, a 50-megapixel ultra-wide camera, and a 50-megapixel telephoto camera with 3.5x optical zoom. This camera array is likely to compete with other flagship phones in terms of photography and video quality, despite the S25 Slim’s more compact form.

Image credit: Onleaks / Smartprix
 While the design and specs are certainly exciting, some questions remain regarding whether the trade-offs for the slimness will be worth it. With battery life likely to be a concern, and the phone’s performance potentially hindered by its thin frame, it will be interesting to see how the Galaxy S25 Slim holds up once it launches later in 2025. Samsung is expected to reveal more about the S25 Slim during its Unpacked event on January 22. Rumours suggest the phone itself won’t hit the market until later in the year.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  Poco M7 Pro 5G review: Strong on the fundamentalsAlso read |  OnePlus 13R at Rs 42,999: Top 4 reasons to buy, 1 to skip

Headline: Infosys is said to offer 6-8 per cent salary hike to employeesInfosys is reportedly gearing up to offer a salary hike of 6-8 per cent to its employees, with the increments set to be rolled out in two phases, starting from January 1, 2025, and April 1, 2025. According to a report, the IT giant is resuming its salary revision process after previous delays.
Content: Infosys is reportedly gearing up to offer a salary hike of 6-8 per cent to its employees, with the increments set to be rolled out in two phases, starting from January 1, 2025, and April 1, 2025. According to a report from CNBC, the IT giant is resuming its salary revision process after previous delays. Jayesh Sanghrajka, the Chief Financial Officer of Infosys, indicated that these salary hikes are likely to impact the company’s margins in the last quarter of FY25 and the first quarter of FY26. The raises are tied to the performance appraisal cycle, which covered the period from September 2022 to October 2023.  Eligible employees received their performance ratings in December 2023, though the increments, which usually take effect from July, were delayed last year. The previous round of salary revisions was implemented in November 2023. It is worth noting that this isn’t the first time Infosys has adjusted its salary hike timelines. In FY22, Infosys had put a hold on salary hikes to conserve cash, but it resumed its appraisal process in October 2023. Employees received their salary revision letters by December 2023, restoring the company’s standard review and compensation procedure. Meanwhile, the Bengaluru-based company saw its workforce grow, with a net addition of 5,591 employees during the October-December 2024 quarter, raising its total headcount to 323,379 by the end of September 2024. Infosys also recorded a net profit of Rs 6,806 crore for the December quarter of FY25, reflecting a 4.6 per cent increase, showing resilience despite industry challenges. Besides, it was recently reported that Infosys plans to hire more than 20,000 freshers in FY26, as the company is trying to fulfill demand and a revival in discretionary spending across industries, according to Chief Financial Officer Jayesh Sanghrajka. Speaking on January 16, Sanghrajka mentioned that the company is on track to meet its target of recruiting around 15,000 freshers by the end of FY25. This hiring strategy contrasts with HCLTech, a major competitor, which recently cut its fresher hiring goal from 10,000 to 7,000 due to efforts to boost efficiency through measures like Project Ascend.  Infosys recently added 5,591 employees in the third quarter ending December 31, marking the second quarter in a row of positive headcount growth.  "We have had strong hiring in Q3, with expansion of over 5,000 employees. We see (hiring) based on some our discretionary (spending), this will continue. But this will have seasonality as we see in our revenue," Salil Parekh, CEO and MD, Infosys said.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 17, 2025

Headline: Kerala man loses Rs 71 lakh after downloading an app to invest money in online trading A 60-year-old man from Kerala lost Rs 71.75 lakh in an online trading scam after downloading an app, believing in the fraudsters' promises of high returns.
Content: In yet another case of an online trading scam, a 60-year-old man from Menamkulam, Kerala, lost Rs 71.75 lakh after downloading an app to learn and invest in online trading. The fraudsters reached out to him through WhatsApp messages and promised him tips to make big profits in trading. However as soon as the victim fell for their lucrative promises, the scammers made him invest large sums, which the victim was never able to recover. According to the case reported by The Times of India, the victim, who was already an experienced trader, was first contacted by the fraudsters on WhatsApp in December last year. The fraudsters shared detailed information and tips about online trading and emphasized on how they can offer him better opportunities to earn significant profits. Impressed by their tips and information, the victim decided to explore the offer further. As the victim followed the instructions of the scammers, he was directed to invest a small amount in the scheme, through which he received timely returns. These initial returns made the victim think the opportunity was real, and he went ahead, trusting the scammers. As the victim showed more interest, he was then instructed by the scammers to download a mobile application that allowed him to track his investments and view the profits earned. The app’s seamless interface and the continuous display of increasing profits further motivated the victim to increase his investments. According to the report, over a period, the victim made 12 transactions, investing various amounts up until January 10 of this year. However, when the victim tried to withdraw his investments and profits displayed on the app, the fraudsters cited "technical issues" and urged him to invest more to unlock his earnings. The victim followed the instructions. However, his suspicions arose when his repeated withdrawal attempts failed, and the victim finally realized he had been duped. He lodged a complaint with the city cyber police, who revealed that the funds had been transferred to seven different bank accounts. A case was registered against eight unidentified persons, including the one who initially contacted the victim on WhatsApp. Notably, this is not the first case where we have seen scammers reaching out to individuals on WhatsApp or other platforms and offering tips on online trading. In the past few months, many individuals have lost lakhs to these scammers and their lucrative offers of earning easy money with guaranteed profits in trading. However, it is important to note that online trading never promises guaranteed profits, especially not like 500 per cent. If someone is promising returns that are too good to be true, it is likely a scam. If you get such messages, do not respond. And if you are planning to invest through any app, always download it from official channels like Google Play Store or Apple Store. Always check the legitimacy of any trading platform before investing. Look for reviews, ratings, and registrations with regulatory authorities. Additionally, be cautious of unsolicited messages or calls on WhatsApp or social media platforms. Never share personal or financial information without verification. If you suspect fraud, contact the cybercrime cell or lodge a complaint at www.cybercrime.gov.in.Published By: Divya BhatiPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Also Read |  Apple releases iOS 18.3 beta 3 for developers, includes updates in Notification Summaries, Camera Controls and moreAlso Read |  First DMs from Brad Pitt, then Rs 7 crore loss and divorce: Here is how a woman fell prey to online scamAlso Read |  Dreame AirStyle review: Smart hair-styler that is high on features and low on price

Headline: What is the Everything app for which Elon Musk is looking to hire software engineersElon Musk is actively looking for talented software engineers to help develop his ambitious "everything app." In a recent social media post, Musk called for passionate coders to join his team, stressing that traditional qualifications are not essential. But, what exactly is the Everything app? Here is everything you need to know.
Content: Elon Musk is actively looking for talented software engineers to help develop his ambitious "everything app." In a recent social media post, Musk called for passionate coders to join his team, stressing that traditional qualifications are not essential. But, what exactly is the Everything app? Here is everything you need to know. What is Elon Musk's Everything app? The "Everything app" is at the core of Musk’s plans to revolutionise X into a one-stop solution for all users' needs. Confused? Well, Musk wants to create the X app similar to China’s WeChat. This app will integrate a wide range of services, including payments, messaging, streaming, and e-commerce, making it a multi-purpose tool for users.  During an internal meeting in October 2023, Musk explained that X is being rapidly transformed from "Twitter 1.0" into a platform that will include a variety of services. This shift aims to make X more than just a social network, providing a solution where users can access multiple services through a single app. Additionally, X CEO Linda Yaccarino recently announced that financial services and streaming options, under X Money and X TV, will be introduced in 2025. Additionally, improvements to X's AI chatbot Grok are also planned, adding further functionality to the platform.Job offer and requirements for software engineers In a unique approach to hiring, Musk has called for software engineers who are passionate about coding, regardless of their educational background or previous employers. In his post, Musk asserted that traditional qualifications are not needed and asked interested candidates to send their best coding work directly to X.  "If you’re a hardcore software engineer and want to build the everything app, please join us by sending your best work to code@x.com," Musk wrote. He added that it doesn't matter where candidates went to school or worked previously, as long as they have the coding skills and dedication required for the job. This hiring philosophy aligns with Musk’s views on education, where he has advocated for a problem-solving-based system over the current model that relies heavily on memorisation and standardised tests. He has consistently promoted skill-based learning, prioritising real-world coding ability over traditional degrees.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 17, 2025

Headline: Realme 14 Pro+ review in 5 points: A mid-budget phone with flagship-like featuresRealme 14 Pro+ has launched in India at a starting price of Rs 29,999. At this price, the phone offers several premium features including a quad-curve display, a triple-camera flash, and a colour-changing design. Here is a review recap in 5 points.
Content: Realme has recently released its next-gen smartphones under the Realme 14 Pro series. Following the tradition, the series debuts with two variants, namely, the Realme 14 Pro and the Realme 14 Pro+. We have been using the Pro+ variant for two weeks and it impresses. The phone excels in several areas including the unique design language, massive battery, lovely camera and an excellent viewing experience. We have covered all of it in a detailed review, but if you want to save time, here is the review of the Realme 14 Pro+ in quick 5 points. advertisementRealme 14 Pro+ review in 5 pointsDesign: The Realme 14 Pro+ comes with a unique design pattern, especially the Pearl White variant. As the name suggests, this variant features a pearl-like texture and a temperature-sensitive, colour-changing rear panel. The panel shifts colour when exposed to cold temperatures, particularly below 16 degrees. Blue waves emerge across the surface, creating a pearl-like effect reminiscent of the ocean. Luckily, the phone was launched during Delhi's winter, providing the perfect opportunity for me to try out this feature. Read more about the design pattern in our detailed review. Along with its colour-changing back, the Realme 14 Pro+ introduces several practical design improvements. The phone features a compact form factor and a sleek profile, measuring only 7.99mm in thickness, making it fit comfortably in the hand. Design: The Realme 14 Pro+ comes with a unique design pattern, especially the Pearl White variant. As the name suggests, this variant features a pearl-like texture and a temperature-sensitive, colour-changing rear panel. The panel shifts colour when exposed to cold temperatures, particularly below 16 degrees. Blue waves emerge across the surface, creating a pearl-like effect reminiscent of the ocean. Luckily, the phone was launched during Delhi's winter, providing the perfect opportunity for me to try out this feature. Read more about the design pattern in our detailed review.  Along with its colour-changing back, the Realme 14 Pro+ introduces several practical design improvements. The phone features a compact form factor and a sleek profile, measuring only 7.99mm in thickness, making it fit comfortably in the hand. Display: The Realme 14 Pro+ boasts a stunning 6.83-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. Its impressive brightness ensures easy readability, even under direct sunlight. The quad-curved design adds a subtle curve to the edges, making the bezels seem thinner and the screen appear larger. The 1.5K resolution is a cherry on top as it enhances activities like binge-watching Netflix, scrolling through Instagram, and playing graphics-intensive games. Performance and battery: The Realme 14 Pro+ delivers a smooth performance, powered by the Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 chipset. It runs on Realme UI 6.0, which is based on Android 15. While it might not be the top performer in its price range, it still stands out with its capabilities. It easily handles tasks typically expected from higher-end devices with ease. We also ran a few benchmark tests on the phone— read here to find out the results. Supporting this performance is a huge 6,000mAh battery, which easily lasts me an entire day. During testing, I extensively used the phone for high-graphic gaming, binge-watching Netflix, and hours of social media scrolling. Thanks to its 80W fast charging, the Realme 14 Pro+ takes just one hour to fully charge the phone, from 0 per cent to a full 100 per cent.  Camera: The Realme 14 Pro+ stands out for its camera. It comes equipped with a triple-camera setup, including a 50-megapixel main sensor, a 50-megapixel periscope lens, and an 8-megapixel ultra-wide shooter. The rear camera produces sharp and vivid images, delivering impressive photo quality for its sub-Rs 30,000 price range. In daylight, it captures shots with lifelike colours, excellent sharpness, and fine detail. Even in low-light conditions, the phone performs well, delivering striking pictures with vibrant colours and clear edges. For selfies, it boasts a 32-megapixel front camera. Take a look at the Realme 14 Pro+’s camera sample.  Verdict: The Realme 14 Pro+ is priced at Rs 29,999 for the 8GB RAM and 128GB storage variant, offering several premium features at this cost. It boasts a quad-curved display, a 50-megapixel primary camera, a robust 6,000mAh battery, and the powerful Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 chipset. Additionally, the unique colour-changing rear panel is a rare sight. Overall, the Realme 14 Pro+ is a compelling option worth considering in the price range. Headline: Vivo T3 Pro and Vivo T3 Ultra get official price cut in India: Check new pricingVivo has announced an official price cut for two of its smartphones: the Vivo T3 Pro and the Vivo T3 Ultra, both of which were launched just a few months ago.
Content: Vivo has announced an official price cut for two of its T-series smartphones: the Vivo T3 Pro and the Vivo T3 Ultra. Both the phones were launched just a few months ago. The Vivo T3 Pro was launched in August, while the Vivo T3 Ultra was launched in October last year. At the time of launch, the Vivo T3 Pro was priced starting at Rs 24,999, whereas the Vivo T3 Ultra was priced at Rs 33,999 for the lowest variant. However, on Friday, Vivo India announced a price cut for both the models. advertisementVivo T3 Pro and Vivo T3 Ultra revised pricingThe Vivo T3 Pro has seen a price reduction of Rs 2,000 across all its variants. This means that the 8GB RAM + 128GB storage model of the smartphone, which was launched at Rs 24,999, will now be available for Rs 22,999. The 8GB RAM + 256GB storage variant, on the other hand, costs Rs 24,999, down from Rs 26,999. Additionally, at the time of writing this story, there were also bank discounts on the phone that can get you an instant discount of Rs 1,500 on purchases made via HDFC and ICICI Bank debit or credit cards. As for the Vivo T3 Ultra, the phone’s top variant has got a price revision to Rs 29,999, from its launch price of Rs 33,999. Similar to the Vivo T3 Pro, the T3 Ultra also has some listed bank offers that can get you around Rs 2,000 off on payments made via a select bank card. Vivo T3 Pro: Specifications The Vivo T3 Pro has seen a price reduction of Rs 2,000 across all its variants. This means that the 8GB RAM + 128GB storage model of the smartphone, which was launched at Rs 24,999, will now be available for Rs 22,999. The 8GB RAM + 256GB storage variant, on the other hand, costs Rs 24,999, down from Rs 26,999. Additionally, at the time of writing this story, there were also bank discounts on the phone that can get you an instant discount of Rs 1,500 on purchases made via HDFC and ICICI Bank debit or credit cards.  As for the Vivo T3 Ultra, the phone’s top variant has got a price revision to Rs 29,999, from its launch price of Rs 33,999. Similar to the Vivo T3 Pro, the T3 Ultra also has some listed bank offers that can get you around Rs 2,000 off on payments made via a select bank card. Vivo T3 Pro: Specifications The Vivo T3 Pro 5G boasts a 6.67-inch curved AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate, 4,500 nits peak brightness, and Schott Xensation glass protection. It also includes Wet Touch Technology for improved touch accuracy. Powered by the Snapdragon 7 Gen 3 chipset and paired with 8GB of RAM, the device runs on FunTouch OS 14, based on Android 14. It houses a 5,500mAh battery with 80W fast charging support. For photography, the smartphone features a dual-camera setup with a 50-megapixel primary sensor and an 8-megapixel ultrawide lens, while a 16-megapixel front camera handles selfies and video calls.Vivo T3 Ultra: Specifications The Vivo T3 Ultra 5G comes equipped with a 6.78-inch 3D curved AMOLED display offering a 1.5K resolution and a 120Hz refresh rate. Running on Funtouch OS 14 based on Android 14, it is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 9200+ processor, coupled with 12GB of RAM and 256GB of internal storage. Vivo claims the device has achieved an impressive Antutu benchmark score of over 16,00,000, which will be put to the test in reviews. Backed by a 5,500mAh battery with 80W fast charging, the phone also excels in photography with its dual rear camera setup, featuring a 50-megapixel Sony IMX921 main sensor with OIS and an 8-megapixel ultrawide lens. The 50-megapixel front camera is perfect for selfies, and AI-powered tools like AI Eraser and AI Photo Enhance add convenience for photo editing directly on the device.Published By: Nandini YadavPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Also read |  Vivo T3 Pro 5G review: A well-rounded daily driverAlso read |  Vivo T3 Ultra review: Powerful and reliable mid-range phone

Headline: OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?With the OnePlus 13, the brand aims to uphold its legacy of delivering a smooth user experience and polished software along with raw performance. But who should actually buy it?
Content: The OnePlus 13 price in India starts at Rs 69,999, but you can effectively purchase the phone at a starting price of Rs 64,999. As noted in our review of the phone, the OnePlus 13 is a solid flagship smartphone for smart buyers as it brings a compelling package of top hardware and a good price. With this phone, the brand aims to uphold its legacy of delivering a smooth user experience and polished software along with raw performance. But who should actually buy it? OnePlus 13: Who should buy it? The OnePlus 13 is available in three RAM and storage variants — 12GB + 256GB, 16GB + 512GB, and 24GB + 1TB, priced at Rs 69,999, Rs 76,999, and Rs 89,999 respectively. ICICI Bank card users can get an instant bank discount of Rs 5,000, bringing the prices down to Rs 64,999, Rs 71,999, and Rs 84,999 respectively. Additionally, there are exchange offers available of up to Rs 39,500, which can further reduce the effective price. If you are coming from a year-old device, such as the OnePlus 12, Galaxy S24, or iPhone 15, we suggest using your current phone for at least another year, as these devices still have good mileage. These last-generation flagships can hold their own, even in 2025. However, if you are coming from a two-year-old or older smartphone, you will notice significant gains in user experience by upgrading to the OnePlus 13. Now, let’s assume you are in the market for a brand-new smartphone that should be an Android flagship device, and your budget is around Rs 80,000, plus or minus. If you don’t plan to exchange an old phone, simply go ahead and purchase the OnePlus 13. It won’t disappoint. To learn about our experience with the device, you can read our full review. If you wish to exchange an old smartphone for the OnePlus 13, things get interesting. For instance, if you exchange the base 8GB RAM + 128GB storage variant of the OnePlus 11 in good condition, you can get up to Rs 20,000 off, bringing the effective prices of the OnePlus 13 down to Rs 44,999, Rs 51,999, and Rs 64,999 for the 12GB, 16GB, and 24GB RAM variants respectively. Similarly, if you have the base 8GB RAM + 128GB variant of the Samsung Galaxy S22+, the exchange offer goes up to Rs 22,400, reducing the effective prices of the OnePlus 13 to Rs 42,599, Rs 49,599, and Rs 62,599 for the respective RAM variants. For those switching from iOS to Android, the exchange value can be even better. For example, exchanging an iPhone 14 can yield up to Rs 32,300, bringing the effective prices of the OnePlus 13 to Rs 32,699, Rs 39,699, and Rs 52,699 for the 12GB, 16GB, and 24GB RAM variants respectively. This makes the OnePlus 13 the most affordable Snapdragon 8 Elite-powered phone. Even the top-end 24GB RAM variant is priced lower than the base variant of the iQOO 13. Once again, please note — the exact exchange value depends on the condition and market value of your current device. To check your device’s eligibility, the best way is to simply head over to Amazon, as it provides a no-frills experience, select your desired OnePlus 13 variant, and explore the exchange offer for your device to see the estimated value.  The OnePlus 13 is a top-tier Android flagship that delivers speed, fluidity, and performance, courtesy of OxygenOS 15 and the Snapdragon 8 Elite chip. Its 6,000mAh battery offers solid endurance, while the 120Hz AMOLED display, now flat, is bright and vibrant, featuring Aqua Touch technology and Glove mode. Additionally, the type-C port and optical fingerprint sensor from the OnePlus 12 have been upgraded to a USB type-C 3.2 port and an ultrasonic fingerprint reader. Overall, the OnePlus 13 offers excellent value for money and is a great flagship smartphone to buy in 2025.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Also read |  OnePlus 13 review: Solid flagship phone for smart buyersAlso read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13R at Rs 42,999: Top 4 reasons to buy, 1 to skip

Headline: iPhone 17 Air launching in 2025? A19 chip, 120Hz refresh, slim design and everything we expectApple's upcoming iPhone 17 Air, rumoured to launch in 2025, is expected to introduce a range of exciting features, including a high refresh rate, improved cameras, and a sleek design.
Content: As soon as Apple launched its latest iPhone 16 series, speculations about the next generation started swirling. The iPhone 17 series, anticipated to arrive in fall 2025, is rumored to bring several much-awaited upgrades, including a higher refresh rate across the lineup, improved cameras, the A19 chipset, and more. However, more than the hardware, the buzz around a new iPhone model is drawing significant attention. According to several reports including some from Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman, the iPhone 17 series might ditch the iPhone Plus model, replacing it with a new iPhone 17 Air model featuring a slimmer form factor. The iPhone 17 Air aligns with Apple’s effort to offer users slim yet powerful devices across its ecosystem. With products like the iPad Air and MacBook Air already established, Apple’s plans to introduce an iPhone Air seems like a logical addition. But what will the iPhone Air look like, and how much will Apple compromise to achieve its slim design? Historically, we have seen Apple making trade-offs in its Air models to prioritise a lightweight, slim profile. So the iPhone 17 Air will likely follow the same line.  Let's take a detailed look at everything we know so far about the iPhone 17 Air, expected to debut alongside the iPhone 17 series.iPhone 17 design expectations The rumoured iPhone 17 Air is expected to be just 5.5mm thick at its slimmest point, potentially making it the thinnest iPhone ever—surpassing even the iPhone 6’s 6.9mm frame. To achieve this sleek design, Apple may use a titanium-aluminum alloy, combining lightweight durability with a premium finish.iPhone 17 display expectations The iPhone 17 Air is rumoured to feature a 6.6-inch OLED display, placing it between the iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max in size. This display is expected to include Apple’s ProMotion technology, offering higher refresh rates of up to 120Hz for smoother scrolling and responsiveness. In fact, even the standard iPhone 17 is rumoured to adopt ProMotion, allowing Apple to introduce high-refresh-rate screens across the lineup. Additionally, the iPhone 17 Air is likely to include Face ID, Dynamic Island, and an anti-reflective coating for improved visibility and durability.iPhone 17 performance rumours The iPhone 17 Air is likely to be powered by the A19 chip, built on an enhanced 3nm process. While it may not match the A19 Pro chip slated for the Pro models, it’s expected to deliver significant improvements in speed and efficiency compared to the current A18 chip. The device is also rumoured to feature 8GB of RAM, ensuring smooth multitasking and support for Apple Intelligence features. Another significant update is Apple’s in-house 5G modem, marking a shift from third-party solutions. Apple is rumoured to debut this modem with the iPhone SE4, and subsequently in all the upcoming new generation of  devices, including the iPhone 17 Air, are expected to adopt it.iPhone 17 Air camera expectations In line with its minimalist design, the iPhone 17 Air is rumoured to feature a single 48-megapixel rear camera, a notable downgrade from the multi-camera setups on other iPhone models. The front will likely house a 24-megapixel camera with a six-element lens. To maintain its slim profile, the device may include only a single earpiece speaker, removing the bottom speaker for a cleaner aesthetic.iPhone 17 Air and eSIM adoption Apple is also expected to double down on its eSIM strategy, with the iPhone 17 Air potentially eliminating the physical SIM card slot entirely. This change could help free up internal space, contributing to the model’s slim design.iPhone 17 Air battery expectations A smaller chassis naturally limits battery capacity, and the iPhone 17 Air will be no exception. While exact battery specifications are unknown, it’s expected to have a smaller capacity than other iPhone 17 models. Apple is likely to rely on the efficient A19 chip and LTPO display technology to optimise battery life.iPhone 17 Air pricing expectations The price of the iPhone 17 Air remains a topic of speculation. Some rumours suggest it could be positioned as a high-end device, priced above the iPhone 17 Pro Max. Others believe it will occupy a mid-tier spot, with Apple limiting certain hardware to keep the device sleek and lightweight.Published By: Divya BhatiPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Also Read |  Kerala man loses Rs 71 lakh after downloading an app to invest money in online tradingAlso Read |  Apple releases iOS 18.3 beta 3 for developers, includes updates in Notification Summaries, Camera Controls and moreAlso Read |  First DMs from Brad Pitt, then Rs 7 crore loss and divorce: Here is how a woman fell prey to online scam

Headline: Samsung teases true AI companion: Could this be the return of Bixby?Samsung's Galaxy Unpacked 2025 is around the corner, with teasers hinting at AI upgrades. The event might also see the return of an improved Bixby assistant, promising smarter smartphone interactions.
Content: Samsung’s upcoming Galaxy Unpacked event, set for January 22, 2025, is right around the corner, with the company sharing numerous teasers on social media hinting at major new features. The South Korean tech giant appears ready to showcase advancements that could transform how users interact with their smartphones. This time, the spotlight is on the potential return of the familiar Bixby voice assistant, which may take on a far more advanced role in the Galaxy S25 series. For those who may not remember, Bixby has been Samsung’s native voice assistant since 2017. It initially debuted with the launch of the Galaxy S8 series. However, it didn’t make much of a splash compared to competitors like Google Assistant, Siri, and Alexa. Over the years, the assistant seemed to fall behind, and Samsung eventually stepped back from promoting it. But it appears the company isn’t ready to give up on Bixby just yet.  A recent teaser video for the Galaxy Unpacked event shows a lady asking a virtual assistant to find a pet-friendly Italian restaurant with outdoor seating, then book a reservation and share the details with a friend. This type of seamless interaction is a far cry from the Bixby we’re used to, which has always struggled with complex requests. Interestingly, Samsung has already been testing an upgraded version of Bixby in China on the Galaxy W25 and W25 Flip. Powered by a large language model (LLM), similar to Gemini and ChatGPT, the new Bixby is capable of understanding more nuanced commands, responding in context, and even providing results in text and video formats. It can translate web pages, and even work with Microsoft Office files like Word and PowerPoint. In terms of design, the upgraded Bixby now offers a cleaner, modern interface with the ability to multitask, allowing users to pull up Bixby on top of other apps for quick interactions. While these enhancements have been available to Chinese users for a while, the Galaxy Unpacked event will likely mark the global launch of this upgraded Bixby. If it comes to the Galaxy S25, it could make a real difference in how people use their phones. Unlike the previous, more basic version of Bixby, this new iteration should be able to handle complex commands that combine several tasks at once. For example, asking it to find a restaurant, make a reservation, and send the details to someone — all in one go — was previously out of reach for the assistant. The new Bixby will also reportedly have on-screen awareness, which means users can ask it about things currently displayed on their phone. This is particularly exciting because it’s not just the latest Samsung devices that will benefit. Since the AI upgrade doesn’t require the latest hardware of the Galaxy S25 series, existing Samsung smartphones could get the update as well, bringing the new features to a wider audience. Whether this updated Bixby can compete with Gemini and Siri, remains to be seen, but it’s clear that Samsung is definitely up to something here. We’ll find it soon.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13R at Rs 42,999: Top 4 reasons to buy, 1 to skip

Headline: Black Panther 2.0: Meet the robotic dog that can sprint past human athletes Black Panther 2 has been developed by Zhejiang University and a startup called Mirror me. It is just a prototype right now and it can already sprint up to 100 meters in under 10 seconds.
Content:
A Chinese team has unleashed a speed demon in the form of a robotic dog, Black Panther 2.0, which has sprinted into the elite "10-second club" of the 100-meter dash. Developed by Zhejiang University and the Hangzhou-based startup Mirror Me, this 38-kg, 0.63-meter tall quadruped robot is redefining what machines can achieve. With a peak stride frequency of five strides per second, it has clocked a 100-meter sprint in under 10 seconds, outpacing even many human sprinters.   This feat places Black Panther 2.0 leagues ahead of its predecessor, the Hound robot from Korea’s Advanced Institute of Science and Technology, which completed the same dash in 19.87 seconds. While it’s still no match for the fastest land animals like cheetahs or ostriches, this robotic marvel is closing the gap between biological and machine mobility.   Inspired by nature, Black Panther 2.0 features a biomimetic design that borrows heavily from the animal kingdom. Its carbon-fibre shins, modelled after the jerboa desert rodent, offer 135 per cent more stiffness with only a 16 per cent weight increase, while spring-loaded knee joints act as shock absorbers, mimicking the flexibility of black panthers. Even its "running shoes," inspired by cheetahs' claws, enhance grip performance by an impressive 200 per cent.

— Collin Rugg (@CollinRugg) January 15, 2025 Powered by AI-driven gait optimisation, advanced high-power-density motor drivers, and real-time adjustments, Black Panther 2.0 moves with unprecedented precision and fluidity. According to Jin Yongbin, a researcher from the institute, the robot uses the Huygens’ coupled pendulum principle for synchronised gait movements, a breakthrough enabling it to move with the coordination of a seasoned sprinter.   The robotic dog is no slouch when unloaded, reaching a top speed of 12.43 mph, a pace that would give some professional athletes a run for their money. However, even at its peak, Black Panther 2.0 falls just short of the legendary Usain Bolt, who still holds the world record for the 100-meter sprint at 9.58 seconds — a record unchallenged since 2009. Despite this, the robotic sprinter represents a significant step forward in robotics, with potential applications ranging from industrial tasks to disaster response. As Wang Hongtao, the chief of the institute, explains, this project came together in just three months, showcasing the rapid strides being made in integrating cutting-edge hardware with advanced software.   With future developments in sight, the team aims to bridge the gap between robotic and natural mobility further — maybe one day, Black Panther 2.0 will not only rival Usain Bolt but also outrun the fastest animals on Earth.Published By: Nandini YadavPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Also read |  What is the Everything app for which Elon Musk is looking to hire software engineersAlso read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  Kerala man loses Rs 71 lakh after downloading an app to invest money in online trading

Headline: TikTok ban in US? Instagram and YouTube hope to scoop TikTok users, tell employees to standbyIt is possible TikTok may become inaccessible to American users this Sunday because of a tussle between the US government and TikTok. Now, tech giants like Instagram and YouTube are hoping to scoop these users if the app stops working in the US.
Content:
There is a possibility that TikTok may become inaccessible in the US this Sunday, similar to how it happened in India in 2020, because of a tussle between the US government and the Chinese company. There are reports that the US government asked TikTok to either sell itself to a US-based entity or risk a ban. TikTok, meanwhile, seems to have decided that it would rather cut off access to the US users instead of choosing a poison pill. And the day cut-off is likely to be the coming Sunday.  However, as the end-game for TikTok comes closer, other tech giants like Instagram and YouTube are hoping to scoop the users who are currently on TikTok and offer them similar service — the short video platform. A New York Times report suggests that the US tech giants have already aligned employees to swing into action as soon as TikTok stops working in the US. These employees have been told to be on standby. The idea seems to be similar to what happened in India in 2020. When India banned the Chinese social media app TikTok in 2020 over security concerns, all TikTok users were left with no choice but to look for alternatives. At that time, apps like Instagram and YouTube grabbed the opportunity, offering features like Reels and Shorts, mimicking the short video format TikTok users were familiar with.

When the ban on TikTok in India was enforced, the app had around 200 million users here. After the ban, most of these users restarted their short video journeys on Instagram and YouTube. Now, the NYT says that a similar situation is unfolding in the US. Tech giants Meta and Google, the companies behind Instagram and YouTube respectively, are refining their strategies to attract TikTok's 170 million monthly US users. Sharing insights from a recent Q&A session, the NYT notes that Meta’s Chief Marketing Officer Alex Schultz revealed the company’s active preparations to capitalise on TikTok’s uncertain future. According to employees present at the meeting, Meta is not only monitoring the fate of TikTok but has also allocated resources to prepare for an influx of TikTok creators and users. The report reveals that behind the scenes both Instagram and YouTube have already deployed their employees and have asked them to get ready to handle the potential migration of TikTok users. Additionally Meta has also asked its employees to modify Instagram features to better accommodate TikTok creators and explore ways to help them transition their existing content to the platform. Meanwhile, YouTube is also reportedly making a push to appeal to TikTok creators through its Shorts feature. The platform recently increased the maximum length of shorts videos from one minute to three, catering to creators accustomed to TikTok’s 10-minute video option. YouTube has also launched initiatives like a “boot camp” for content creators, aiming to familiarise them with the platform’s shopping features and monetisation tools. While Meta and Google have not commented publicly, their behind-the-scenes efforts clearly show that they are eagerly eyeing TikTok users in the US.  After all, when the ban on TikTok took place in India, one of the biggest beneficiaries of it turned out to be reels. Before the ban, TikTok was the de facto short video app in India, with the app hosting a vibrant community of Indian creators and users. At that time, Instagram Reels were hardly on anyone’s radar. But since then Reels have now become arguably the most used feature on Instagram, so much so that they are part of the cultural and lifestyle conversation in India nowadays. YouTube Shorts, although not as popular as Reels yet, also saw its usage increase rapidly in India after TikTok was banned here. Headline: MacBook Air M3 price drops by a big margin, but should you buy or wait for M4 model?The MacBook Air M3 is now available at its lowest price in India, raising the question of whether you should buy the current model or wait for the next-generation MacBook Air with the M4 chip as it is expected to launch in early 2025. But, before we talk about that, let's first have a look at the deal price of the MacBook Air M3 model.
Content: The MacBook Air M3 is now available at its lowest price in India, raising the question of whether you should buy the current model or wait for the next-generation MacBook Air with the M4 chip as it is expected to launch in early 2025. But, before we talk about that, let's first have a look at the deal price of the MacBook Air M3 model.advertisementMacBook Air M3 price drops, deal explainedThe 8GB RAM model of the MacBook Air M3 is listed at its lowest-ever price on Reliance Digital's online store. It seems that the platform is clearing stock of the 8GB RAM variant, as Apple has phased out this version and made 16GB the new standard for future models. Currently, you can purchase the 8GB RAM model with 256GB SSD for Rs 98,606, down from its original launch price of Rs 1,14,900, giving you a flat discount of Rs 16,294. There’s also an additional Rs 1,000 discount available when using select bank cards, including BOB and OneCard credit cards. However, this offer is only valid for the Space Grey colour variant.  The 8GB RAM model of the MacBook Air M3 is listed at its lowest-ever price on Reliance Digital's online store. It seems that the platform is clearing stock of the 8GB RAM variant, as Apple has phased out this version and made 16GB the new standard for future models.  Currently, you can purchase the 8GB RAM model with 256GB SSD for Rs 98,606, down from its original launch price of Rs 1,14,900, giving you a flat discount of Rs 16,294. There’s also an additional Rs 1,000 discount available when using select bank cards, including BOB and OneCard credit cards. However, this offer is only valid for the Space Grey colour variant.  For those looking to buy the 16GB RAM model, it’s priced at Rs 105,990, which is lower than its original retail price.Is it worth buying MacBook Air M3 or should you wait for M4 model? If you are currently using a MacBook Air M1, upgrading to the MacBook Air M3 would be a smart choice, as you will experience a noticeable boost in performance. However, for those using the M2 model, it might be worth waiting for the upcoming M4 model, especially if you don't urgently need a new Apple laptop and want to experience the latest tech. The M4 model is expected to have AI capabilities and offer faster speeds. Apple typically compares new devices with models from two generations ago, not their immediate predecessors. For example, Apple compared the iPhone 16 Pro with the iPhone 14 Pro in terms of performance boost. The same approach applies to MacBooks. So, if you are using a one-year-old model like the MacBook Air M2, it is better to wait for the next upgrade, such as the M4. However, for those with older devices like the M1, the latest M3 model offers enough improvements to justify upgrading. While the MacBook Air M2 is also on sale at a discounted price, the M3 model is a more attractive option, particularly for those upgrading from the M1. The M3 chip provides a big performance upgrade, making it ideal for those looking for faster speeds and more advanced features. It is worth noting that MacBooks have always been dependable as they are known for their durability, long-term stability and long battery life. And the M3 model is no different. It also offers excellent photo editing capabilities, smooth performance, a vibrant display, and a sleek, lightweight design. Additionally, it can handle basic 4K video editing and promises long-term software support. You can consider buying a MacBook Pro model if you need a machine that can handle intensive tasks, including 3D rendering, advanced 4K video editing, graphics creation and more. With close to 10-11 hours of screen-on-time, it is a great option for office workers and students who need a laptop that can last a full day without constant recharging. One of the standout features of the M3 is its support for dual external displays, which is particularly useful for multitaskers, though this feature requires the laptop's lid to be closed. Despite this, the M3 retains Apple's iconic lightweight and portable design, making it easy to carry without compromising on performance. For those unaware, the MacBook Air M3 also comes with support for up to 24GB of RAM and Wi-Fi 6E, so that it remains relevant and functional for years to come. With smooth performance and reliable software support for at least six years, the MacBook Air M3 is a solid investment for those looking for a laptop that will last long-term.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 17, 2025

Headline: Samsung Galaxy S25 series prices leak ahead of January 22 launch eventAccording to the latest leak, the Galaxy S25 series could see a noticeable price hike compared to last year's Galaxy S24 lineup.
Content: With Samsung’s Galaxy Unpacked event just a few days away, there’s plenty of buzz around the launch of the Galaxy S25 series. The event, scheduled for January 22, is expected to showcase the latest Galaxy S25 lineup, including the Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, and Galaxy S25 Ultra. While official details are still under wraps, leaks and rumours have given us a good idea of what to expect, including the pricing of the upcoming flagship series in India. A recent leak by Tarun Vats on X (formerly Twitter) suggests that the Galaxy S25 series could see a noticeable price hike compared to last year’s Galaxy S24 lineup.  The standard Galaxy S25 is said to start at Rs 84,999 for the base model, which comes with 12GB RAM and 256GB storage. While the top-end storage option with 12GB RAM and 512GB is tipped to cost Rs 94,999. To put this in context, the Galaxy S24 had a relatively affordable starting price of Rs 74,999 for its base 8GB RAM +128GB storage variant. Moving on, the Galaxy S25+ is rumoured to begin at Rs 1,04,999 for its base 12GB RAM + 256GB storage model, up from the Galaxy S24+'s Rs 99,999 starting price. The higher storage option of 12GB RAM + 512GB storage could cost buyers Rs 1,14,999, according to the leak. As for the top-of-the-line, Galaxy S25 Ultra, the leaked pricing may come as a shock. The base variant with 12GB RAM + 256GB storage could be priced at Rs 1,34,999, compared to last year’s Galaxy S24 Ultra, which started at Rs 1,29,999. The 16GB RAM +512GB storage variant is expected to cost Rs 1,44,999, while the top-tier 16GB RAM + 1TB storage model might come with a mind-boggling price tag of Rs 1,64,999. The rumoured price hike could be linked to Samsung’s adoption of the new Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, which is expected to power the Galaxy S25 series. The latest chip comes with a higher production cost, which could explain the bump in pricing. Whether this performance boost justifies the price increase remains to be seen. Samsung has already begun accepting reservations for the Galaxy S25 series in India. Customers can pre-book the smartphones through the company’s website, Samsung Exclusive Stores, and various online and offline retail outlets. As the launch date approaches, it’s clear that the Galaxy S25 series could push premium pricing to a new level. Only time will tell if the features live up to the hefty price tag.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 18, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  OnePlus 13R at Rs 42,999: Top 4 reasons to buy, 1 to skip

Headline: Apple removes all apps by TikTok from US store, says just following the lawAs the TikTok ban in the US goes into effect Apple has commented on it. On its support page, the company says that it has removed TikTok as well as other apps by ByteDance from its App Store in the US.
Content: TikTok has stopped working in the US. Deemed a security risk, the app has been lawfully barred from operating within the US. The Chinese short video platform has been in a tussle with the US government for a while and was given time to either sell the platform to a US-based firm or face a ban. While the permanent ban is yet to take place, Google and Apple have removed the app from their respective app stores.  Apple has also issued a clarification about the removal of TikTok and several other apps from ByteDance, stating that the company is following the “laws in the jurisdictions where it operates.” Clarifying the removal of TikTok and other apps from the App Store, Apple in its support page notes, “TikTok and ByteDance Ltd apps are no longer available in the United States, and visitors to the United States might have limited access to features.”  The company emphasised that the removal aligns with US law and the "Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act," which affects apps developed by ByteDance Ltd. and its subsidiaries. According to Apple, apps from ByteDance, including TikTok, TikTok Studio, TikTok Shop Seller Center, CapCut, Lemon8, Hypic, Lark - Team Collaboration, Lark - Rooms Display, Lark - Rooms Controller, Gauth: AI Study Companion, and MARVEL SNAP, are no longer available for users in the US on the App Store for download or updates starting January 19, 2025.  However, if users already have these apps downloaded on their iPhones, they won’t be able to redownload the apps if they are deleted or if they switch to a new iPhone, and the apps will not be restored. Additionally, some apps will not work or will have limited functionality, and any in-app purchases or new subscriptions will no longer be available for US users. For travellers visiting the US, Apple clarifies that the apps from ByteDance will be available and functional in regions where the apps are permitted. Apple says that when in the US these users won’t be able to download, update, or make in-app purchases or new subscriptions in any of ByteDance Ltd apps until they leave US boundaries. The apps will function normally once they leave the US borders.  For TikTok in particular, the app stopped working last Saturday in the US, showing a message indicating that the ban has been enacted in the country. However, the company is holding onto hope with President Trump, assuring users that it is actively in talks with him to bring a solution to restart the app once he assumes office. Now, all eyes are on Trump to see what fate his government decides for these Chinese apps. For now, Trump told NBC, “The 90-day extension is something that will most likely be done, because it's appropriate.” However, the final announcement will likely be made on Monday.Published By: Divya BhatiPublished On: Jan 19, 2025Also Read |  TikTok ban in US? Content:
After launching Android 15 in October last year, Google is now working on its next project. In just 3 months, the company might get started with the beta version of Android 16. The speculation is that Google will release the first beta version of Android 16 this month. That said, a new leak reveals launch dates for the upcoming beta version. It looks like Google will launch the second and third beta versions in February and March, respectively. While the stable version release is still under wraps, after this leak we can assume that it might launch earlier than the Android 15. advertisementAndroid 16 beta version launch dates As per the latest leak, spotted by the Android Authority, Google is ready to push out beta versions of Android 16, before it can launch a stable one. The information comes from a comment on the Android Gerrit, where a Google employee, most likely, shares tentative release dates for the Android 16 betas. According to the comment, Beta 3 is expected to be released on March 12. 

 



Credit: Android Authority
 While the leak specifies that the Android 16’s first beta version is scheduled for January 22, there is no official notification so far. Similarly, the Beta 2 is expected to arrive on February 19. Headline: OnePlus Open 2 design leak tipped to be world's thinnest foldable smartphoneThe OnePlus Open 2 will reportedly measure around 4mm in its unfolded state. For context, the current thinnest foldable smartphone, the Honor Magic V3, measures 4.35mm when unfolded and 9.2mm when folded.
Content: The OnePlus Open 2, expected to launch internationally as a rebranded Oppo Find N5, has been in the rumour mill regarding its design and features. If the recent leaks are true, the OnePlus Open 2 could become the thinnest foldable smartphone in the world — even thinner than the current record-holder for being the thinnest foldable smartphone, the Honor Magic V3. Oppo has recently announced that their new foldable smartphone, the Find N5, will be released in China in February. Based on past launches, the Find N5 will likely be marketed globally as the OnePlus Open 2. The leaked information, shared by popular leakers Digital Chat Station and Smart Pikachu, is quite exciting for fans who have long-awaited the sequel to the OnePlus Open. When it comes to the design, Oppo’s Senior Vice President Liu Zuohu has described the Find N5 as the world’s thinnest foldable. For context, the Honor Magic V3 measures 4.35mm when unfolded and 9.2mm when folded. According to leaks, the Oppo Find N5 — and by extension, the OnePlus Open 2 — could go even slimmer, reportedly measuring around 4mm in its unfolded state. The camera layout has also grabbed attention. A circular camera module is expected, positioned in the centre, much like the Oppo Find X8 Pro and the original OnePlus Open. The setup is expected to feature a periscope telephoto lens, a Hasselblad branding at the centre, and a flash in the lower right corner. Additionally, the leakers have hinted at a minimal crease on the foldable display, adding to the phone’s premium feel. Another potential upgrade is the use of a titanium frame, which would make the phone lightweight without compromising durability. With foldable phones often criticised for their fragility, this is an interesting move from OnePlus and Oppo.  On the hardware front, the OnePlus Open 2 is expected to come with a triple-lens Hasselblad camera, satellite communication support, a 6,000mAh battery, and wireless charging. At its core, it will likely be powered by Qualcomm’s Snapdragon 8 Elite chip. Rumoured colour options include black, white, and possibly additional finishes. A leaked image of the inner display shows a hole-punch cutout for the selfie camera in the top right corner, maintaining a sleek and modern design. While the Chinese launch is slated for February, the international release of the OnePlus Open 2 is expected to follow soon after. It could give the phone a significant head start over competitors like the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7, which will likely launch later in the summer.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 20, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  OnePlus 13R at Rs 42,999: Top 4 reasons to buy, 1 to skip

Headline: Meta's new app Edit resembles a video editor by TikTok-owner ByteDanceMeta is launching a new video editing app called Edit that will be available on both Android and iOS. Interestingly, the app has a lot of resemblance to CapCut, a video editor by ByteDance.
Content:
Instagram CEO Adam Mosseri on Sunday night announced that Meta is soon going to launch a new video editing app called Edit, which will be available to both Android and iOS users. “Edits is more than a video editing app, it’s a full suite of creative tools”, Mosseri said in a video post on Threads. He also revealed that the app will feature “a dedicated tab for inspiration, another to keep track of any early ideas you might have”. The Instagram CEO also mentioned that the Edit app will use “a much higher quality camera,” though it’s unclear what he is comparing the camera quality to. Additionally, he says that the app will feature “all the editing tools you’d expect, the ability to share drafts with friends and other creators, and, if you decide to share your videos on Instagram, powerful insights on how those videos too”.

 
View on Threads

 As for availability, Mosseri has announced that the Edit app is already available to pre-order on the Apple App Store and it will be available on Google Play store for Android smartphones soon. “You can preorder the app today in the iOS App Store, and it’s coming to Android soon”, he wrote in the Threads post. Notably, the Instagram CEO has said that the Edit app will be only available some time in the month of March. “The app won’t be available to download till next month, and in the meantime we’re going to work with a handful of video creators to get their feedback and improve the experience. More to come soon”, Mosseri said. Interestingly, the announcement about the Edit app has a timing that seems deliberate. Mosseri announced the video editor just as TikTok was facing the deadline for a US ban on January 19. The Edit app also seems to have an uncanny resemblance to CapCut, an app owned by TikTok-maker ByteDance. On Sunday, all ByteDance apps were briefly removed from the Apple App Store and Google Play Store. But this isn’t the first time Meta’s timelines have been found suspicious. Meta has tried to take advantage of the gap in the markets several times before. For instance, when TikTok was banned in India in 2020, Instagram rushed to launch Reels in the country just a month after the ban. Similarly, in 2023, Meta launched Threads, just after Twitter was purchased by Elon Musk and the platform was going through a revamp.Published By: Nandini YadavPublished On: Jan 20, 2025Also read |  TikTok ban comes into effect in US, users can no longer access video-sharing appAlso read |  Good morning, America: Why India banned TikTok 5 years backAlso read |  'Something needs to change': Musk opposes TikTok ban, wants X services in China

Headline: Nothing Phone 3 rumour round-up: Price, specs and all we know so farNothing Phone 3 is expected to launch in the first quarter of 2025, and the phone will reportedly come with big upgrades, especially with the introduction of AI-driven technology.
Content: Nothing’s CEO, Carl Pei, recently confirmed that the company’s next flagship smartphone, the Nothing Phone 3, will launch in the first quarter of 2025. The news was shared by popular tipster Evan Blass, who put up an email from Pei on his X (formerly Twitter). The email reportedly revealed that 2025 would be Nothing’s biggest year yet, thanks to the launch of its new device, which is expected to showcase the company’s first steps into AI-powered technology. The two-year gap between the Nothing Phone 2 and the upcoming Phone 3 breaks from the typical annual refresh cycle followed by most smartphone brands. This extended timeline suggests big upgrades, especially with the introduction of AI-driven features. Nothing has been relatively quiet since the launch of the Phone 2 in July 2023, but Pei’s confirmation has reignited excitement for the brand.  According to earlier leaks and a video shared by Pei, the Nothing Phone 3 will be a central hub for a personalised, AI-driven experience. AI will be deeply embedded into the operating system, aka, Nothing OS — potentially reimagining how users interact with their home screens and daily tasks. One of the standout features rumoured for the Nothing Phone 3 is an Action Button, similar to the one found on iPhones. This button is expected to offer customisable shortcuts, letting users personalise their experience further. The device will also reportedly feature a 6.5-inch display.  As for the pricing, with the previous Nothing Phone 1 and Phone 2 priced at Rs 32,999 and Rs 44,999 respectively, it remains to be seen how the Phone 3 will fit into this pricing spectrum. Leaks suggest that the upcoming model could feature an upper mid-range chipset, such as the Snapdragon 8s Gen 3 or MediaTek Dimensity 9200+, which might place it closer to the more affordable end of the market.  When the Nothing Phone 2 hit the market, it faced criticism over its pricing. Not because of its hardware, which was quite competitive and on par with its peers, but largely due to the perception surrounding the brand itself. At the time, Nothing was still relatively new, having launched its first phone just a year prior. The Rs 12,000 jump in price from the first-generation Phone 1 to the second-generation Phone 2 left many questioning whether the increase was justified. Granted, the Phone 2 offered premium specifications and features, but some consumers felt that the steep hike didn't align with the brand’s early-stage positioning in the market. While the Nothing Phone 3 is said to focus on accessibility, a Pro variant with better specifications, including a larger 6.7-inch display, is also expected to launch alongside, likely targeting premium buyers. That said, details around this Pro variant are scarce at this moment, and we suggest you take this information with a big pinch of salt.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 20, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  OnePlus 13R at Rs 42,999: Top 4 reasons to buy, 1 to skip

Headline: OpenAI to unveil AI super agents with PhD-level intelligence this month: ReportOpenAI is working on an AI super-agent that will have PhD-level intelligence. It is expected to launch by the end of this month.
Content: OpenAI executives have on several occasions spoken about the next-generation AI, and often its intelligence has been compared to that of a graduate or a PhD-level human being. Earlier it was speculated that OpenAI’s GPT5 would be announced next. However, reports now suggest that the company is working on an AI super-agent, and it may release as early as January 30. There is also a new report by Axios that claims that OpenAI is meeting with the US government officials regarding the launch.  But what does it mean for an AI agent to have PhD-level intelligence? And what is an AI agent? An AI agent is a sophisticated software system that can perform complex tasks on its own, with minimal human supervision. It can make decisions on your behalf, adapt and react to different situations, analyse large amounts of data and multiple options. It is basically able to mimic human intelligence when you give it a goal-oriented task. And from what the reports suggest, the said AI super agent that OpenAI is working on will be capable of addressing complex problems with the proficiency of a doctoral graduate.  In the rumoured meeting with US government officials, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman is also expected to talk about the impact of AI on economic growth. This is in line with a blueprint that OpenAI had recently shared which talks about integrating artificial intelligence software systems into the US economy.  Meanwhile, Axios report also claims that with the speedy development in the AI systems, some OpenAI employees are concerned about the issues that may come with the progress in AI that the company is making. While the timeline for the launch of the AI super agent is new, this is not the first time we have heard about it. There has been speculation about an agent called the “Operator” that OpenAI may be working on. Reports suggest that the AI tool will be able to perform several tasks on a user’s behalf like writing code or booking a flight or researching a topic, or any other complex task that requires multiple actions.  The timing of the said OpenAI AI super agent or the Operator is interesting as it comes at the heels of a private blog post by the company’s CEO Sam Altman where he spoke at length about humanity stepping into the “Intelligence Age”. In another more recent post, Altman has also written about AI agents joining the workforce in 2025. “We believe that in 2025 we may see the first AI agents join the workforce and materially change the output of companies,” Altman wrote.Published By: Nandini YadavPublished On: Jan 20, 2025Also read |  After Google, OpenAI plans to launch its new tool that automates tasks in JanuaryAlso read |  Job crisis and layoffs? Headline: Bengaluru man receives free phone to avail credit card benefits, loses Rs 2.8 croreIn a recent case of online scam, fraudsters duped a 60-year-old man from Bengaluru out of Rs 2.8 crore by sending him a free smartphone. The phone likely contained malware, allowing scammers to access and empty his bank account.
Content:
A new case of cyber fraud has been reported from Bengaluru, where scammers siphoned off Rs 2.8 crore from a victim after sending him a free smartphone and a SIM card. The fraudsters reached out to the victim on the social media platform WhatsApp, where they offered him a package containing the smartphone and asked him to change his SIM card. However, as soon as the victim used the phone, the scammers managed to empty his bank account. As per the case reported by Deccan Herald, the scam began when the 60-year-old victim received a WhatsApp call from an unknown individual in November 2024. The individual introduced himself as a representative of Citibank. The caller informed the victim that the bank had issued a credit card in his name, and to use the credit card, he would need to change his phone number to one authorised by the telecom operator Airtel. The scammers further explained that they would send him a new SIM and a phone to set up for the process. Thinking it was a legitimate offer—given that banks often call users about new credit card schemes—the victim agreed to accept the card, the new phone, and the SIM card. Following his approval, on December 1, the scammers sent a Redmi mobile phone worth Rs 10,000 to the victim’s address. After the delivery of the phone, the scammers asked the victim to switch his SIM to the mobile phone they had sent. However, as soon as the victim set up the new phone and SIM card, he received a notification about an unauthorized transaction. When he checked with his bank, he was informed that Rs 2.8 crore had been debited from his account. Upon noticing the unauthorized transaction, the victim filed a complaint with the police, and a case has been registered. "I switched my SIM card to the mobile phone they had sent on the same day. After that, I didn’t receive any notifications from my bank,” the victim reportedly informed the police. But how did this scam happen? This case is likely linked to the use of a malicious smartphone. Since the scammers sent the victim a new phone, it is suspected that the phone was pre-installed with malware. As soon as the victim set up the device, added sensitive information such as banking details, and changed his number, the scammers were able to clone his information. This enabled them to access his bank account and empty it.How to stay safe This appears to be one of the first few cases of a cyber scam involving a new trick where scammers send a targeted victim a new phone and SIM card. To stay safe, it is highly advisable not to trust any unknown caller. Bank representatives typically contact users through their registered mobile numbers and not via social messaging platforms like WhatsApp. Even when banks call, they usually inform users about new schemes but never ask for sensitive details. If you receive such calls, hang up immediately. Avoid opening any links sent via social media by unknown users. If you suspect your sensitive data has been compromised, file a report with the police and the cyber cell. Remember, scammers are constantly devising new tricks to deceive people. Staying vigilant online is your best defense.

Apple is highly anticipated to launch its next-generation iPhone SE this year. The brand has remained silent for nearly three years since the launch of the iPhone SE3 in 2022. However, in 2025, Apple is finally expected to break the hiatus and introduce its new affordable offering. While the launch of the iPhone SE4 has been rumoured for early 2025, a new report from Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman further adds to these claims, hinting that the release is almost confirmed and closer than expected.  In his latest newsletter, Gurman reveals that Apple is clearing out the inventory of its current iPhone SE making way for the new gen model. Sharing insights from various Apple employees working in retail operations, the report highlights that U.S. stores have nearly cleared their stock of the iPhone SE3 to make way for the new iPhone SE4. Although the iPhone SE3 is still available for purchase online and is being shipped within a few days, it is becoming harder to buy the device from the  offline stores as inventory clears out. Notably, Apple has also stopped selling the 2022-launched iPhone SE in the European Union following the latest directives mandating Type-C USB ports. The current iPhone SE features the older Lightning port, which no longer aligns with the regulations. Additionally, Gurman notes that with shrinking inventory and significant upgrades expected for the iPhone SE4, Apple is likely to stop selling the iPhone SE3 even at a discount once the new model arrives.Expected specifications for iPhone SE4 According to Gurman, the upcoming iPhone SE– codenamed V59–  will be Apple’s first device to feature its in-house cellular modem chips, moving away from Qualcomm. Taking design inspiration from the iPhone 14, the device is also expected to feature a 6.1-inch OLED display, slim bezels, and Face ID. This will allow Apple to ditch the  traditional Touch ID and the home button from devices, which previously served dual purposes. Although the Dynamic Island is expected to remain exclusive to flagship models, Gurman suggests the SE4 might adopt the Action Button introduced with the iPhone 15 Pro series. Under the hood, the iPhone SE4 is rumoured to be powered by the A18 series chip, aligning with the flagship iPhone 16 series. Along with the new gen chipset, the new iPhone SE is also likely to come with up to 8GB of RAM and storage options reaching 512GB, which will further allow Apple to offer users its  Apple Intelligence features in the budget iPhone. In fact, the iPhone SE4 is said to be the most affordable iPhone to offer Apple Intelligence features. The device could also pack a 3,279mAh battery with USB-C charging, complying with EU regulations. All in all, reports suggest that the iPhone SE4 will focus on a sleeker and lighter build. The new iPhone SE is likely to arrive in Apple’s spring launch with colour options including Midnight, Starlight, and Product (RED). iPhone SE4 expected pricing in India  Pricing will be a key factor for the iPhone SE4. While the significant upgrades are expected to make the device slightly pricier than its predecessor, the iPhone SE4 is still anticipated to remain under Rs 50,000 in India. For context, Apple launched the iPhone SE3 in India at Rs 43,900 for the base 64GB storage model. The upcoming SE4 is expected to compete in a similar range, and Apple is likely to price it competitively.
