Headline: Whole Foods founder uses Apple Watch to get rid of his drinking habit, says it changed his lifeWhole Foods founder John Mackey revealed that his Apple Watch helped him quit drinking years ago. He used the watch to track his lifestyle and identified how unhealthy habits were impacting his sleep.
Content: We have seen many reports about how the Apple Watch saved the lives of individuals from fatal accidents. Time and again, Apple’s smartwatch has been praised for its ability to protect users during emergencies. However, it seems like the Apple Watch is not just guarding users from emergency situations but is also proving to be a powerful tool for promoting healthier lifestyles. In fact for Whole Foods Founder John Mackey his Apple Watch even helped him get rid of his alcohol addiction.  Mackey, in his recent conversation with Business Insider, revealed that three years ago, he started his alcohol-free journey, and thanks to insights from the Apple Watch, he was able to overcome his addiction. He shared that he had been tracking his sleep using the Apple Watch, which showed him that on some days, he was getting good sleep, while on others, he was not. In fact, his deep sleep was the most affected. "So, I started to ask the question, 'Well, what did I do differently when I didn't sleep well?’" he told Business Insider. Using these sleep insights, Mackey shares that he happened to track his lifestyle and was finally able to identify three factors affecting his sleep: alcohol, irregular eating habits, and exercise. "One was how much exercise I did—more exercise led to better sleep. Second was if I ate a big meal late, I didn't sleep very well. And third was if I drank any alcohol at all, my deep sleep went to zero. I didn't get any deep sleep," he said. He even tracked his sleep whenever he had a drink, and his Apple Watch helped him figure out that whenever he consumed alcohol, his deep sleep was highly impacted. "Total sleep would drop, on average, about an hour (when drunk)...," he revealed. Thanks to all this data, Mackey shared that he started leaning toward a healthier lifestyle and ultimately decided to quit alcohol altogether. According to the Sleep Foundation, a study based on approximately 160,000 participants found that nearly 90 per cent of respondents who regularly consumed alcohol in the evening reported at least one sleep-related problem. While Apple does offer sleep tracking in its iPhone and Watch, Mackey also noted that he used an app on the Apple Watch—AutoSleep—to track his sleep. The app is a paid one, available on iOS. But it’s not just sleep; the Whole Foods founder also mentioned that he has been using other health features like heart rate, blood pressure, and other trackers on the Watch to monitor his lifestyle and make conscious decisions accordingly. "We can create plans for people and monitor them to help people be the healthiest versions of themselves," he said. Notably, during the launch of the Apple Watch 10, Apple introduced a new sleep apnoea detection feature for users. This feature aims to help users track their sleep and specifically assist in detecting and tracking sleep apnoea, a condition often left undiagnosed in millions. Apple explained that this new feature uses the Watch's accelerometer to monitor breathing disturbances during sleep. The feature can detect signs of moderate to severe sleep apnoea. “The Sleep Apnoea Notifications feature can look for breathing disturbances while you're sleeping and notify you if they show consistent signs.”Published By: Divya BhatiPublished On: Jan 24, 2025Also Read |  Retired bank manager from Pune loses Rs 2.22 crore after buying multiple insurance policiesAlso Read |  ChatGPT down: Both web and app versions not opening for many usersAlso Read |  Google is making Circle to Search feature smarter, new update coming first to Galaxy S25 series

Headline: Samsung Wallet is getting two big features: Tap to Transfer and Instant InstallmentSamsung Wallet is adding Tap to Transfer and Instant Installments, two new features to simplify peer-to-peer payments and buy-now-pay-later options. The launch of these features is expected in the coming months.
Content: Samsung Wallet — Samsung’s digital wallet app for its Galaxy devices will be getting two big features, set to arrive later this year. The first one is peer to peer payments, known as Tap to Transfer. While the second one is a buy now pay later service called Instant Installments. Of course, the company’s goal here is to make Samsung Wallet more versatile and popular, so that more people — especially those who use Galaxy smartphones — use it for their online and offline transactions. The first feature — Tap to Transfer — allows users to send money by simply tapping two NFC-enabled devices together. Think of it as Apple's Tap to Pay feature. However, Samsung does it one better here in comparison to Apple, as you get third-party digital wallet support on Samsung Wallet. This way, Samsung’s service becomes more inclusive and useful for a wider range of users. Rather than tying the transaction directly to Samsung Wallet, Tap to Transfer works with the debit card or credit card linked to your account. Payments will be processed through Visa and Mastercard, which means you don’t need to be exclusively tied within the Samsung ecosystem to use it. The second feature — Instant Installments — takes a different approach to the growing trend of buy now pay later schemes. Do note, that, unlike other platforms, Samsung isn’t offering credit directly. Instead, it’s simplifying the process for users to turn their purchases into instalments at checkout. Samsung has described it as the first offline payment plan experience, meaning it will work both in physical stores and online. Payments will rely on Visa and Mastercard credit cards, so the feature isn't limited to Samsung Wallet users. While Instant Installments won't transform Samsung into a lender, it will help users keep track of their installment payments through the Wallet app. This could be particularly useful for managing finances more easily, as you’ll be able to see all your payments in one place. Exact details are still unknown, and how exactly the system will work remains unclear. It’s possible Samsung is focusing more on giving users better tools for payment management rather than competing head-on with established players in the credit market. Samsung has confirmed these features are not tied to the launch of the Galaxy S25 but will roll out later, possibly around March or in the second quarter of the year. They will also be available on older Galaxy devices, making them accessible to a wide user base.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 24, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  Best flagship mobile phones in January 2025: OnePlus 13, Vivo X200 Pro and more

Headline: Google is rolling out Identity Check feature for select phones running Android 15Google's latest Identity Check feature adds extra security to Android phones, requiring biometric authentication to access sensitive settings when away from trusted locations.
Content: Google has officially rolled out a new feature called Identity Check for select devices globally, aimed at adding an extra layer of security to Android devices. This feature is designed to tackle scenarios where someone might gain access to your device even if they know your passcode, PIN, or password. With Identity Check, users will now have to authenticate themselves using biometrics like fingerprints or facial recognition when trying to access sensitive account or device settings. This follows the company's broader efforts to protect user data in case of theft, including tools like Theft Detection Lock and Offline Device Lock. This added security measure activates only when your device is outside trusted locations, such as your home. Google hopes Identity Check will make it harder for thieves to disable anti-theft features or change your security settings. However, the feature won’t be very helpful if the person accessing your phone is already in one of these trusted locations. The concept behind Identity Check isn’t entirely new. Rumours about it began circulating last year itself hinting at its development. Now, with the feature officially available, we have a clearer picture of how it works. When you’re away from your trusted locations, any attempt to access critical settings — like changing your device's PIN, disabling theft protection, or even accessing Google’s Passkeys — will trigger a biometric authentication request. This ensures that only the rightful owner can make such changes, even if someone else has access to their password. Google detailed how the feature integrates with the Theft Protection toolset, which already includes useful safeguards. Theft Detection Lock, for example, locks your device automatically if it detects that someone has snatched it from your hand. Similarly, Offline Device Lock ensures that your phone locks shortly after it goes offline. These features, introduced in late 2024, are now globally available on Android 10 and newer devices. The rollout of Identity Check begins with Pixel phones running Android 15 QPR1 stable and eligible Samsung Galaxy devices on One UI 7. Users can access the feature by heading over to Settings > Google services and preferences > select your primary Google account > All services > Theft protection. The update is likely rolling out through the Find My Device app or Play Services. For now, it is expected that other Android device manufacturers will bring the Identity Check feature to their phones later this year.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 24, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  Best flagship mobile phones in January 2025: OnePlus 13, Vivo X200 Pro and more

Headline: iPhone 17 Air vs iPhone SE 4: Design, camera and everything we knowThe iPhone 17 Air and iPhone SE 4 are expected to share a handful of specs and features. While the iPhone SE 4 is rumoured to launch in April, the iPhone SE 4 might come in September. Is it possible that the upcoming SE model is a preview for the iPhone 17 Air? Let's find out.
Content:
The upcoming iPhone 17 Air and iPhone SE 4 are speculated to feature a similar design pattern. A leak has recently spurred confusion over the new iPhone design. The leak shared an image of a rear panel, claiming it to be iPhone 17. It sported a pill-shaped module, housing a single camera lens, which is anticipated to come in both. The phones are scheduled to launch this year. While the iPhone SE 4 is expected to launch in April, the iPhone 17 might be released in September with the rest of the iPhone 17 series. We have already covered the leak, but the question still remains: is it iPhone 17 Air or iPhone SE 4?  advertisementiPhone 17 Air vs iPhone SE 4First, let's talk about the leak and why we think it is the iPhone 17 Air. The tipster, Majin Bu, took to X and posted an image of two rear panels. He captioned the images as "iPhone 17", but it is pretty clear that these images belong to either iPhone 17 Air or iPhone SE 4. The image shows that this upcoming phone will have a single camera lens with a rectangular camera panel on the top. The right side appears to house an LED flash and a small microphone opening. Now, the internet has been divided.

This minimalist approach could enhance the device’s slim profile while optimizing internal space. Under the hood, it might pack Apple’s A19 chipset coupled with 8GB. With these improvements, it was thought the iPhone 17 Air might pierce the pockets, but it might not be the case. One major improvement is the transition to a 6.06-inch OLED display, replacing the 4.7-inch LCD of the previous model. This upgrade promises a more vibrant and high-quality viewing experience.

Headline: iQOO Neo 10R set to launch in India soon as company drops a teaseriQOO is gearing up for the launch of its Neo 10R smartphone in India. Nipun Marya, CEO of iQOO India, hinted at the device's imminent launch with a cryptic post on his X (formerly Twitter) handle. Here is everything we know, including leaked price range and specs.
Content: iQOO is gearing up for the launch of its Neo 10R smartphone in India. Nipun Marya, CEO of iQOO India, hinted at the device’s imminent launch with a cryptic post on his X (formerly Twitter) handle. The post includes the letter 'R' repeated about 10 times, strongly suggesting that the upcoming phone is indeed the iQOO Neo 10R, which has been in the rumour mill for weeks. Here is everything we know. The upcoming iQOO Neo 10R will be the first R-series device from the brand in India, following last year’s launch of the iQOO Neo 9 Pro. This model was priced at Rs 34,999, and with the Neo 10R being part of the more affordable R series, it’s expected to carry a lower price tag. Tipster Paras Guglani suggests the Neo 10R will be priced under Rs 30,000, targeting users looking for a mid-range device with premium features. The more premium iQOO Neo 10 version could launch later and it is likely to compete with higher-end devices like the OnePlus 13R in the Rs 40,000 price segment. Although official specifications are yet to be confirmed, leaks have already provided insights into what the Neo 10R might offer. The smartphone is rumoured to come equipped with Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8s Gen 3 chipset. It is also expected to feature a 6,400mAh battery with 80W fast charging support, and the company is likely to include a charger in the box, a move that continues iQOO’s customer-friendly approach. The iQOO Neo 10R could be offered in two configurations — 8GB RAM + 256GB storage and 12GB RAM + 256GB storage. The device is tipped to sport a 6.78-inch AMOLED display with a 144Hz refresh rate. On the camera front, the Neo 10R may come with a dual-camera setup at the back, featuring a 50-megapixel Sony LYT-600 main sensor and an 8-megapixel ultra-wide sensor. While it lacks a third camera, which is often found in this price range, the exclusion of a macro lens might not be missed, as such sensors typically offer limited value. The front camera is rumoured to be a 16-megapixel sensor for selfies and video calls. While all this information is based on leaks, the rest of the features are currently under wraps. But, official details about the iQOO Neo 10R, including the official launch date, is expected to be announced soon. Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 24, 2025

Headline: iPhone inside your Mac? Yes, iPhone mirroring gives 2-in-1 access and can change how you work One of the coolest features that Apple has introduced in the last few years is iPhone Mirroring. It arrived with the beta versions of the latest macOS and iOS last year, and is now available to users. It can also, at least for some, be a life-changing feature.
Content:
This is not a new feature. Not new in a sense because we first saw it in the middle of the last year when Apple announced it at the WWDC. I am talking about the iPhone Mirroring, a feature that allows people to pair their iPhone with a MacBook laptop. But it is only now I have discovered and have realised just how useful and powerful it is. But why now?  Well, an office colleague nudged me. You see, I like memes – or absolutely love some if they are purrfect. It's like a daily dose of happiness. However it is also becoming an addicting dose. In fact, every time I unlock my iPhone my muscle memory somehow makes me check all my notifications, messages, WhatsApp chats, and in no time I end up spending minutes scrolling through Instagram or Twitter where there are always funny and furry animals waiting to distract us.  While this looks and does no harm, or so I feel, the constant itch of checking the phone and FOMO is real. One moment I am working on my laptop and then there is a tiny TING! Next moment, after checking the source of that TING, I am on Instagram, scrolling through reels. I have tried dealing with this by turning the silent mode on the phone, but then that brings anxiety. What if I miss an important ping from a friend or family member. What if there is an urgent message from my bank that requires immediate attention.  The iPhone Mirroring supposedly solves this problem. And potentially a few others. As I use the iPhone Mirroring, I believe I have found a way to solve my FOMO.So, what is iPhone Mirroring Well, I started using the iPhone Mirroring feature a few weeks ago after updating my iPhone and the MacBook to the latest software. The feature was launched in September 2024 with the release of macOS Sequoia and right now it is available for users with an iPhone running iOS 18 and a Mac running Sequoia.  As its name suggests, this new feature allows Apple users to mirror their iPhone display on the screen of the MacBook. And not just screen. Once turned on, the feature also allows you to control your iPhone using the trackpad and keyboard through the Mac. Essentially you can use almost all iPhone apps that you have installed on your phone through the paired MacBook. It allows you to use these apps — for example you can open an Ola or Uber app on your MacBook and book the cab without picking up your phone. Or can use an app like Splitwise, which is mostly used by people on their phone.  Most significantly, though, you can even drag and drop files or photos between the iPhone and the MacBook. It’s kind of awesome!Setting up iPhone Mirroring Now, Mirroring is not a new concept or feature and some Android phones too offer something similar. But after using the feature regularly for days, I can assure you that no one has done better than Apple. Now, before you can use the iPhone Mirroring, you need to start with it. Here is how you go about it.  – To start the iPhone Mirroring feature, update your MacBook to macOS Sequoia and iPhone to iOS18. Once updated, your MacBook will automatically show the mirroring app feature in the doc. If not, you can also find it in the Applications folder.

 



Photo: Apple
 — The feature requires you to have the Bluetooth and WiFi turned on. It doesn’t matter that you are not connected to the WiFi but you need to have it turned on.  — It is important that you are using the same Apple account on both the iPhone and the Mac.  – Follow on-screen instructions. You will need to put in Phone PIN and Apple account passwords.  – Once the mirroring is done, you will see your iPhone screen on your MacBook. Now you can also adjust the screen by tapping on View and adjust the size.  – Once everything is set to your liking, you can start using your iPhone through your Mac. You can either open it as one of the screens in a multi-screen window or just keep it minimised.  – Note that the iPhone Mirroring works only if your phone is locked. As soon as you unlock the phone, the Mirroring will pause. 

 



iPhone Mirroring app pauses when you use your iPhone
iPhone Mirroring pros and cons Having said that, chances are you won’t need to pick the iPhone frequently. As noted earlier, this feature not just allows you to use the iPhone on Mac, but it also shows phone notifications directly in the Mac notification panel and when you click on a notification, it opens in the mirrored window. There is absolutely no need to go to the phone to take action on a notification.  Like noted earlier, this is one feature that is actually letting me curb my excessive phone use. I pick my phone less every day now. When I am working and have to respond to something on the phone, I can now do it directly through the Mac.  This seamless integration of notifications also helps me when I have kept the phone away during meetings or while charging. I can do so and not have FOMO.  Another thing that helps — basically has helped me — with my phone addiction is the necessary friction that the iPhone Mirroring brings to my usage. Using the phone through mirroring requires a little bit more effort, and that I believe is a good thing.   The mirrored iPhone screen allows you to access your phone, but you navigate it using a trackpad and keyboard. The scrolling doesn’t get the benefit of the mighty thumb and a super-smooth screen. Instead, you scroll through the trackpad and that means even if you force yourself to binge on reels, your fingers get tired soon. In other words, the experience of using the phone through the Mac is slightly cumbersome and that is less addictive. Hence, you do use the iPhone Mirroring to access your phone, but it naturally forces you to limit yourself to important stuff and not doom scroll all the time. Now, this doesn't mean that at work I am just working slavishly on the Mac — something that my boss would definitely prefer me to do. I mean a little break is always a good idea. And since the big screen allows multitasking, I often use the mirroring app to quickly glance through my social media apps and check on messages, or any funny reels from friends – sometimes the memes and reels can be urgent you know. But as I noted,  scrolling needs effort on a trackpad and it is not as easy as on a phone so I no longer end up scrolling for tens of minutes. 

 



Photo: Apple
 What’s the catch? There are some limitations. The camera app, for example, cannot be accessed or used in the mirroring mode. Netflix is another app that didn’t work as I tried using it in mirroring mode. At the same time, there is the UPI app for which I always needed to use the phone.  My sense is that the best use case for most people with the iPhone Mirroring is going to be its potential to cut down on phone use, FOMO and screen addiction. It is also a convenient way to access the phone in situations where you might otherwise not. For example, you can keep the phone on charging in a different room in your house and still access it through a MacBook. While travelling too, if you are working on your Mac you can keep your iPhone in your pocket or a bag while you work on your laptop in the airport waiting area.  At the same time, I believe, the usability and versatility of this feature means different people might even find different sorts of usage for it. I am using the iPhone Mirroring to deal with my social media issues. Someone else might find it the best way to move files between two devices. Someone else might find some other use for it. But irrespective of how you use it, you will likely find it the best implementation of device mirroring that we have seen so far in the world of consumer technology. Headline: Starlink satellite-to-cell phone service testing starts on January 27, Elon Musk confirmsElon Musk, CEO of SpaceX, has announced on X (formerly Twitter) that Starlink's Direct-to-Cell satellite service will begin its beta testing phase on January 27. This marks a big step toward global mobile connectivity without relying on traditional ground-based cell towers.
Content: Elon Musk, CEO of SpaceX, has announced on X (formerly Twitter) that Starlink’s Direct-to-Cell satellite service will begin its beta testing phase on January 27. This marks a big step toward global mobile connectivity without relying on traditional ground-based cell towers. Musk confirmed the news in a reply to a similar Starlink post published by Mario Nawfal, founder of IBC Group, on X. "Starlink direct from satellite to cell phone Internet connection starts beta test in 3 days," Musk wrote on X. But, what exactly is Direct-to-Cell satellite service? It will allow mobile phones to connect directly to satellites, effectively bypassing traditional cellular infrastructure. This could revolutionise communication, enabling people to text, call, and browse the internet from any location, even in remote or isolated regions with no access to regular cell towers.  Nawfal described this as "cell towers in space," with the potential to eliminate dead zones and improve mobile communication. Notably, users won’t need new phones or additional hardware for this service, as it works with existing devices. The beta phase is expected to be a key milestone for SpaceX as it expands Starlink’s offerings. If successful, this new service could greatly benefit those living in or travelling through areas with poor or no cellular coverage. In times of emergency, the service could be crucial when traditional networks fail. With this development, Starlink aims to address the long-standing issue of limited connectivity in rural and hard-to-reach locations. The introduction of next-generation Starlink satellites is expected to further boost speeds, potentially exceeding 2Gbps, making this a promising evolution in global telecommunications. SpaceX leveraged its experience in manufacturing and launched the world's most advanced rockets and spacecraft to deploy Starlink satellites with the Direct to Cell capability at scale. Direct to Cell satellites were reported to first launch on SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket and then on Starship. On orbit, the satellites immediately connect over laser backhaul to the Starlink constellation to provide global connectivity. Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 24, 2025

Headline: Optoma OMA-S ML 1080ST projector review: Compact, convenient, and capableThe Optoma OMA-S ML 1080ST projector is a great example of tech enabling so much power being squeezed into such a compact device.
Content:
The Optoma OMA-S ML 1080ST projector is a great example of how good tech can enable rolling in power and portability together. Even though, while testing the projector, I only used it as a home entertainment setup, it can easily and very well work as a portable solution for work presentations. I used it as a replacement to the television in my bedroom. I was projecting onto a 100-inch retractable projector screen, and every bit of the two-month review period was a delight.  
 


advertisementOptoma OMA-S 1080ST specifications  Before I dive into the details of the review, let’s take a quick look at the projector’s specifications. It offers a native resolution of 1080p (1920 x 1080) with an aspect ratio of 16:9. It offers 1,500 lumens of brightness, and 3,000,000:1 contrast ratio. It weighs 0.95 kg. It is HDR compatible and has 105 per cent BT.2020 colour support. Its laser light source is rated for up to 30,000 hours of life.The Optoma OMA-S 1080ST projector has connectivity options including HDMI, USB Type-C, and a USB reader that works with formats like MP4, AVI, and JPG. It also supports auto keystone and focus for screens up to 100 inches. It has a throw ratio of 0.78:1, which means you can project a 100-inch screen from just 1.7 meters away.When it comes to visuals, the projector delivers in spadesadvertisement Before I dive into the details of the review, let’s take a quick look at the projector’s specifications. It offers a native resolution of 1080p (1920 x 1080) with an aspect ratio of 16:9. It offers 1,500 lumens of brightness, and 3,000,000:1 contrast ratio. It weighs 0.95 kg. It is HDR compatible and has 105 per cent BT.2020 colour support. Its laser light source is rated for up to 30,000 hours of life. The Optoma OMA-S 1080ST projector has connectivity options including HDMI, USB Type-C, and a USB reader that works with formats like MP4, AVI, and JPG. It also supports auto keystone and focus for screens up to 100 inches. It has a throw ratio of 0.78:1, which means you can project a 100-inch screen from just 1.7 meters away.When it comes to visuals, the projector delivers in spades At the very beginning of the testing, my attention was first caught by the image quality that the projector offers. The Optoma OMA-S projects sharp, full-HD visuals. The colours are vibrant that truly pop. During the test period, I watched a lot –– and I mean A LOT –– of content using the projector. Whether watching 1994’s Il Postino or watching a Wes Anderson movie, the experience was deeply immersive. Even when I watched 1966’s Teesri Kasam, the details in the visual were well visible. That is thanks to its 1080p resolution and a brightness of 1,500 lumens. It also helps that the projector offers a contrast ratio of 3,000,000:1. 
 


Setting up the projector is a breeze  The Optoma OMA-S 1080ST offers ports for USB Type-C, HDMI, and USB Type-A that allow you to power devices like a Chromecast or an Amazon Fire TV Stick.I connected a 4K Fire TV stick via the projector’s HDMI port –– it was seamless. I also tested the projector by pairing it with an old Windows laptop. The setup was easy and worked very well. The projector also supports Mac –– I connected it with an M1 MacBook Air. I love the flexibility the projector offers in terms of connectivity and setup. What makes it even better is that it powers dongles through its USB Type-A port, instead of you needing an extra power socket –– which is always a hassle. 
 


Compact and portable One of the standout features of the Optoma OMA-S 1080ST is its portability. It weighs under 1 kg. And if you have a medium to large sized back-pack or a medium-sized tote, you can even easily fit into a bag.  One of the standout features of the Optoma OMA-S 1080ST is its portability. It weighs under 1 kg. And if you have a medium to large sized back-pack or a medium-sized tote, you can even easily fit into a bag.  Also, the majority of projectors that are made to be portable come with built-in batteries, but Optoma has taken a different approach and I think it’s smarter. The OMA-S 1080ST comes with a USB Type-C power input, which lets you power the device with even a power bank –– just make sure that it offers a speed that is 65W or higher. I used it with my Xiaomi’s 20,000mAh power bank, and I was about to use the projector with it for a couple of hours –– closer to two. And it made me think that it’s such a great device to carry with you in case you want to do an impromptu movie date outdoors. 
 


advertisementWho doesn’t love remotes?Remotes don’t feel like an exciting addition anymore, but the convenience of a basic remote control support is always appreciated by users. The OMA-S comes with a remote control that makes navigating through the controls and the general interface quite simple. The remote uses dual IR receivers on the front and back, which means you don’t need to point it at the projector –– which feels very unintuitive, especially in a home entertainment setup –– you can use it from any angle. Auto keystone correction is another thing that makes using the projector so easy. A quick setup with it makes the screen look so good without needing to struggle with manual adjustments. Auto Keystone is especially a blessing if you want to project at an angle. Like me, if you too had the “would love to have the TV on my roof” dreams, make them come true with a device like this one. advertisementWhile there is a lot to love about the Optoma OMA-S 1080ST projector, I do have one issue with it. It uses a built-in 3W speaker, which is decent for casual viewing or for presentations, but if you're planning to use the projector as a TV replacement like me, then you may feel slightly disappointed by the audio output –– especially in larger rooms or during action-heavy scenes. But I love the Optoma OMA-S despite that flaw because of the sheer convenience it offers to connect external speakers or soundbars via Bluetooth or the 3.5mm audio jack. Should you buy the Optoma OMA-S 1080ST projector?  The Optoma OMA-S ML 1080ST is priced at Rs 1,75,000. Yes, that seems expensive. And it probably is, but the power that this tiny projector packs, makes it really worth the money. It packs some impressive features, it is portable, and easy to use.advertisementIts features like power bank compatibility and the myriad of connectivity options, make it stand out in the crowded projector market. While the built-in speaker could be better, the option to connect external audio devices makes it a non-issue. On the whole, the Optoma OMA-S ML 1080ST projector strikes a fine balance between performance and portability. In spite of the price tag, I think it is an excellent investment if you are looking for a projection for some high quality visuals, whether for work or entertainment. Headline: Oracle, Microsoft reportedly planning to take over TikTok: Story in 5 pointsOracle and Microsoft are reportedly in advanced discussions to take over TikTok's global operations.  Here is the full story in five points.
Content: Oracle and Microsoft are reportedly in advanced discussions to take over TikTok’s global operations. The potential deal, which is said to include high-level negotiations, could change the app’s ownership and governance. While ByteDance, TikTok’s parent company, may still retain some involvement, the talks hint at major changes in how the app might operate. The move is seen as a response to growing data security concerns and regulatory pressures in the US. According to The Verge, citing an NPR report, the deal would allow ByteDance, TikTok’s Chinese parent company, to retain a minority stake. Headline: Perplexity AI proposes US stake in TikTok merger: ReportPerplexity AI revises its TikTok U.S. merger plan, offering a bold proposal that includes U.S. government ownership, to balance investor interests and address national security concerns.
Content: Perplexity AI has made some big changes to its merger proposal for TikTok’s parent company, ByteDance. In its updated plan, Perplexity AI has suggested a deal where the U.S. government could end up owning 50 per cent of the new company, combining Perplexity AI and TikTok U.S. As reported by CNBC, this ownership would only happen after the new company goes public. The new entity, which is being called NewCo, would bring TikTok U.S. and Perplexity AI together. However, TikTok’s famous recommendation algorithm wouldn’t be part of the deal. Instead, ByteDance would let its investors trade their stakes in TikTok U.S. for shares in the new company. Perplexity AI would do the same with its investors. The money to fund this deal would come from outside investors, who would also provide extra cash to pay a one-time dividend to ByteDance’s investors and help the new company grow. Perplexity AI has had a massive rise over the past year. At the start of 2024, the company was valued at around $500 million. By the end of the year, that number had jumped to $9 billion. The generative AI boom played a big role in this growth, as more investors saw the potential of AI search tools as a serious challenge to Google. That said, Perplexity hasn’t had a smooth ride. The company has faced some criticism over claims of plagiarism, which has put it under the spotlight for the wrong reasons at times. The idea behind the merger is to create a stronger, combined entity that benefits both sides. ByteDance would still hold on to a stake in TikTok U.S. without fully selling it, and Perplexity AI would gain access to TikTok’s massive video platform. This would be a big boost to Perplexity’s ambitions. What makes this deal stand out is the part where the U.S. government could own half of NewCo after it goes public. Perplexity believes this could help address national security concerns that have surrounded TikTok for years. ByteDance has always made it clear it doesn’t want to sell TikTok U.S., but Perplexity’s pitch is different because it’s framed as a merger rather than a sale. This could make the idea more appealing to ByteDance. Meanwhile, President Donald Trump’s administration has been heavily involved in TikTok’s uncertain future. TikTok has temporarily avoided being banned in the U.S., but Trump has hinted at plans to bring in American stakeholders and possibly give the government a stake in the company. With other players like Microsoft, Oracle, and Elon Musk reportedly interested in TikTok, the next few weeks could be critical. A final decision on the matter is expected soon.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 27, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  Best flagship mobile phones in January 2025: OnePlus 13, Vivo X200 Pro and more

Headline: Sam Altman compares Operator launch to ChatGPT: Here is how they are differentOpenAI has recently released its first AI agent, Operator. But how is it different from the ChatGPT platform? Let's find out.
Content:
OpenAI is climbing up the ladder in AI-verse with every passing day. The company started with the ChatGPT launch in 2022, and now it has reached a mark where AI can perform tasks for you. While OpenAI's ChatGPT is the ultimate AI chatbot, the Operator is the company's first super AI agent. The Operator can independently perform tasks and can search the web for you. With this, you only need to instruct the agent, for example, share a list of groceries and the agent will order it on your behalf. This is for sure a win for OpenAI and a significant invention in the AI world. Even though the users are reporting issues, CEO Sam Altman has praised the AI agent. He posted on X (formerly Twitter) that the Operator is getting as much attention as ChatGPT. He stated, "Fun watching people react to Operator, Reminds me of the ChatGPT launch." 
 


 It is true that the Operator is one of the first steps to what we thought AI would be like. Personally, whenever I thought about AI in the early years, I always thought of it as a machine that could perform tasks for me. And now the Operator is finally here. While it is only available for US users for now, the company plans to expand the agent to other regions as well. How is the Operator different from ChatGPT?  The main difference between the two platforms is: ChatGPT is a chatbot and the Operator is an AI agent. ChatGPT requires you to chat with the bot, and it helps you find answers to the queries. On the other hand, the Operator helps you perform tasks on your behalf on the web. The company explains, “using its own browser, it can look at a webpage and interact with it by typing, clicking, and scrolling.”
 advertisement


 The Operator is capable of handling a variety of repetitive browser tasks, from completing forms and ordering groceries to crafting memes. By utilising the same interfaces and tools people interact with daily, AI enhances its practical applications. This not only helps individuals save time on routine activities but also opens new avenues for businesses to connect with their customers effectively.  Overall, we can say that ChatGPT helps you with productivity, whereas the Operator helps you save time on routine tasks. That said, the Operator uses a few ChatGPT capabilities to pull off the tasks assigned. In the blog, OpenAI states, "Operator is powered by a new model called Computer-Using Agent (CUA). Combining GPT-4o's vision capabilities with advanced reasoning through reinforcement learning, CUA is trained to interact with graphical user interfaces (GUIs)—the buttons, menus, and text fields people see on a screen." Coming to the part where AI has been struggling for a while, hallucinations. Previous reports have stated that the ChatGPT, at times, hallucinates and provides false instances. But with the Operator, OpenAI explains that if the Operator faces challenges or errors, it can use its reasoning abilities to correct itself. If it reaches an impasse and requires help, it seamlessly hands control back to the user, ensuring a fluid and cooperative experience. But issues have also been surfacing recently. Operator faces issues and challenges Early users of the tool have shared critiques, citing slower responsiveness compared to demo performances and instances of hallucinations similar to those seen in the standard ChatGPT chatbot, as reported by Quartz.
 


 In a related account reported by Bezingza, user complaints on X caught the attention of OpenAI CEO Sam Altman. One user described issues with the Operator’s interactions on a news website, prompting Altman to respond with a promise to address the problem quickly. However, it remains unclear whether the incident was a genuine error or another example of the Operator’s hallucination tendencies.
 


 But as these teething issues rise, it looks like Sam Altman is making sure that all of them should be fixed as early as possible. Headline: Chinese chatbot DeepSeek ends ChatGPT supremacy on Apple App StoreChinese startup DeepSeek's AI Assistant has surged in popularity among US users since it was released on Jan. 10, according to app data research firm Sensor Tower.
Content: Chinese startup DeepSeek's AI Assistant on Monday overtook rival ChatGPT to become the top-rated free application available on Apple's App Store in the United States. Powered by the DeepSeek-V3 model, which its creators say "tops the leaderboard among open-source models and rivals the most advanced closed-source models globally", the artificial intelligence application has surged in popularity among US users since it was released on Jan. 10, according to app data research firm Sensor Tower. The milestone highlights how DeepSeek has left a deep impression on Silicon Valley, upending widely held views about US primacy in AI and the effectiveness of Washington's export controls targeting China's advanced chip and AI capabilities. AI models from ChatGPT to DeepSeek require advanced chips to power their training. The Biden administration has since 2021 widened the scope of bans designed to stop these chips from being exported to China and used to train Chinese firms' AI models. However, DeepSeek researchers wrote in a paper last month that the DeepSeek-V3 used Nvidia's H800 chips for training, spending less than $6 million. Although this detail has since been disputed, the claim that the chips used were less powerful than the most advanced Nvidia products Washington has sought to keep out of China, as well as the relatively cheap training costs, has prompted US tech executives to question the effectiveness of tech export controls. Little is known about the company behind DeepSeek, a small Hangzhou-based startup founded in 2023, when search engine giant Baidu released the first Chinese AI large-language model. Since then, dozens of Chinese tech companies large and small have released their own AI models, but DeepSeek is the first to be praised by the US tech industry as matching or even surpassing the performance of cutting-edge US models.Published By: Devika BhattacharyaPublished On: Jan 27, 2025

Headline: New Airtel, Jio and Vi call and SMS-only mobile recharge plans launchedAirtel, Jio, and Vi have launched voice and SMS-only recharge plans, offering affordable options for users who don't need data services, following TRAI's new regulations to make telecom services consumer-friendly.
Content: Telecom operators Airtel, Jio, and Vi have introduced new voice and SMS-only recharge plans, following the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India’s (TRAI) directive to provide affordable plans for users who don't require data services. This move comes as a big relief for millions of Indians, particularly those using basic mobile services or maintaining secondary SIM cards solely for calls and messages. The new plans cater to a long-standing demand from users who were previously forced to purchase expensive bundled packs with unwanted data benefits. TRAI’s mandate, part of its Telecom Consumers Protection (Twelfth Amendment) Regulations, aims to address this issue and ensure consumers only pay for what they use. Airtel's new recharge plans include a Rs 1,849 annual pack offering unlimited voice calls and 3,600 SMS for 365 days, with an effective daily cost of Rs 5.06. For shorter durations, Airtel has a Rs 469 plan that provides 84 days of validity, unlimited calls, and 900 SMS, costing Rs 5.58 per day. Jio, known for its competitive pricing, offers a Rs 1,748 plan with a validity of 336 days. Like Airtel, it includes unlimited calls and 3,600 SMS but at a slightly lower effective daily cost of Rs 5.20. Jio also provides a Rs 448 plan for 84 days with unlimited calls, 1,000 SMS, and access to JioCinema and JioTV services. This plan costs Rs 5 per day, making it one of the most affordable options in this segment. Vi's approach is slightly different. Its Rs 1,460 plan offers a validity of 270 days, unlimited calls, and 100 SMS per day, with additional messages priced at Rs 1 for local and Rs 1.5 for STD. The daily effective cost of this plan is Rs 5.41. These changes are part of a broader regulatory effort by TRAI to make mobile services more consumer-friendly. The regulator’s survey revealed that many users, especially in rural areas, rely on basic voice and SMS services and find data-inclusive plans unnecessarily expensive. The new rules also extend the validity of Special Tariff Vouchers (STVs) up to 365 days, compared to the previous limit of 90 days. This means users can enjoy longer periods of uninterrupted service without frequent recharges. Additionally, telecom operators have been directed to make top-up vouchers available in smaller denominations starting from Rs 10, ensuring more accessible options for users on tight budgets.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 27, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  Best flagship mobile phones in January 2025: OnePlus 13, Vivo X200 Pro and more

Headline: Latest WhatsApp update brings new icon design to AndroidWhatsApp's latest update introduces redesigned attachment icons. This change reflects Meta's push for a unified design across platforms, with Android finally catching up.
Content: The latest update for WhatsApp on Android brings a visual change that users may not notice immediately, but it signals a larger shift towards a unified design language across Meta’s apps. If you’ve updated to WhatsApp version 2.25.1.75, available via the Google Play Store in India, or 2.25.1.76 in some other regions like Canada, you might spot new icons in the attachment sheet. This feature pops up whenever you tap the paperclip icon in a chat. While the attachment options — Document, Location, Gallery, and Contact — remain the same, the icons have ditched their old round design for squircles or, say, squared-off icons with rounded edges. The revamped WhatsApp icons feature colourful art inside and look more polished compared to the earlier design that used solid colours with white line art. It's not just a cosmetic tweak. This update aligns WhatsApp more closely with Meta’s other platforms like Instagram and Messenger, which already feature similar design elements. Interestingly, these design changes were first spotted way back in early 2023 during WhatsApp's development phase. Beta testers got a glimpse of the updated icons in iOS apps before Android users did. However, it took nearly two years of testing, feedback, and tweaking before the new icons started showing up in stable builds for Android. If your app hasn't been updated yet, you might want to check the Play Store or manually sideload the APK and install it. While this update might seem small in the grand scheme of things, it reflects WhatsApp's larger push toward better integration and consistency across its apps. This attachment sheet redesign, along with previous changes like the tabbed bottom sheet for the Gallery menu, shows how Meta is polishing WhatsApp to keep it relevant in today’s fast-paced tech world. The rollout appears to be global, with multiple reports of the update reaching Android users in various countries. Whether you’re in India or Canada, chances are the change is already available. And if not, it’s just a matter of time. For those eager to test this out, joining WhatsApp’s beta program on the Play Store could give you early access to new features. Alternatively, APK sites like APKMirror and APKPure also host beta builds, though caution is advised when sideloading apps.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 27, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  Best flagship mobile phones in January 2025: OnePlus 13, Vivo X200 Pro and more

Headline: iOS 18.4 may bring Apple Intelligence to India in April: Here are 5 expected features iOS 18.4, the next big wave of Apple Intelligence, is expected to come in April. With this update, Apple's AI-powered features might expand to other regions, like India.
Content:
Apple is most likely to launch the next wave of Apple Intelligence, iOS 18.4 in April. This update is expected to introduce major updates on the AI front. The company has been rolling out the Apple Intelligence features since October 2024. However, a few big ones that made it to the WWDC 2024, are yet to come out. For instance, the Siri overhaul, new languages and more. iOS 18.3 is also expected to expand the Apple Intelligence features to more languages. Let's look at it in detail. advertisementApple Intelligence could be in India as soon as AprilCurrently, users in India are exploring Apple Intelligence by changing the default language to US English or Canadian English. Other than this, Apple Intelligence is available in Australia, Ireland, New Zealand, South Africa, and UK regions. However, Indian English is yet to arrive. But what does it mean? It means that when these features support Indian English, users need not change their default settings. It also means that if you are planning to buy a new iPhone, which is eligible for Apple Intelligence (iPhone 15 Pro models or iPhone 16 series), Apple Intelligence will be ready to use. Apple previously confirmed, "In April, a software update will deliver expanded language support, with more coming throughout the year. Chinese, English (India), English (Singapore), French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Spanish, Vietnamese, and other languages will be supported." iOS 18.4 new featuresadvertisement Currently, users in India are exploring Apple Intelligence by changing the default language to US English or Canadian English. Other than this, Apple Intelligence is available in Australia, Ireland, New Zealand, South Africa, and UK regions. However, Indian English is yet to arrive. But what does it mean? It means that when these features support Indian English, users need not change their default settings.  It also means that if you are planning to buy a new iPhone, which is eligible for Apple Intelligence (iPhone 15 Pro models or iPhone 16 series), Apple Intelligence will be ready to use. Apple previously confirmed, "In April, a software update will deliver expanded language support, with more coming throughout the year. Chinese, English (India), English (Singapore), French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Spanish, Vietnamese, and other languages will be supported." iOS 18.4 new features New Siri features: iOS 18.4 is set to deliver some of Apple’s most anticipated enhancements to Apple Intelligence and Siri, promising to make the virtual assistant truly smarter—provided Apple meets its ambitious goals.  This update introduces three major Siri upgrades: Personal Context, On-Screen Awareness, and the ability to take action in apps.  
-- Personal Context: Siri will now leverage a deeper understanding of your personal data to offer tailored assistance. Misplaced a recipe shared by a friend and can’t recall if it’s in a note, text, or email? Need your passport number while booking a flight? Siri can search through relevant information on your device to help you quickly find what you need—all while maintaining Apple’s commitment to privacy. -- On-Screen Awareness: With Apple Intelligence, Siri gains the ability to act based on what’s on your screen. For example, if a friend sends you their new address via text, you can simply say, “Add this address to their contact card,” and Siri will handle the rest.   -- Taking Action in Apps: Siri will also enable seamless interactions within and across apps. You can ask it to send a draft email to specific recipients, saying, “Send the email I drafted to April and Lilly,” and Siri will know which email and app you’re referencing. It can also perform multi-app tasks, such as enhancing a photo by saying, “Make this photo pop,” and then asking Siri to save it to a specific note in the Notes app—all without requiring you to lift a finger.   New emojis: In recent years, Apple has consistently introduced new emoji with its spring iOS updates, a trend that is expected to continue. The Unicode Consortium has already revealed the latest batch of emoji, and it’s now up to Apple to bring them to iOS. This year’s additions include a fingerprint, face with bags under eyes, harp, root vegetable, leafless tree, splatter, and shovel, offering users even more ways to express themselves visually.  Improved news summaries: Apple had paused its News Summary feature, as it was reported to be generating fake headlines. However, iOS 18.4 could bring it back with required improvements. Headline: Meta to start showing ads in Threads as it now has 300 million usersMeta Platforms will begin test-launching ads on its social media platform Threads with a few brands in the US and Japan, it said on Friday, as the app hits over 300 million monthly active users.
Content: Meta Platforms will begin test-launching ads on its social media platform Threads with a few brands in the US and Japan, it said on Friday, as the app hits over 300 million monthly active users. During early testing starting Friday, image ads will appear in the Threads home feed, placed between content posts for a small percentage of users, Meta said in a blog. The social media giant said it will monitor the test closely before scaling it broadly, adding that businesses will be able to extend their existing Meta ad campaigns to Threads. Meta will also begin testing an inventory filter for ads in Threads, which enabled through AI, allows advertisers to control the sensitivity level of the organic content their ads appear next to. "The launch of Threads ads just weeks after Meta's content moderation makeover will raise advertiser eyebrows. But the volatility at TikTok is spurring brands to seek alternatives, and Meta isn't going to pass up an opportunity to throw Threads into the mix," said Jasmine Enberg, principal analyst at Emarketer. Meta earlier this month scrapped its US fact-checking program on Facebook, Instagram and Threads, three of the world's biggest social media platforms with more than 3 billion users globally. Threads was launched in July 2023 as a challenger to X, formerly Twitter, in a bid to win users from the de facto micro-blogging site during its chaotic takeover by billionaire Elon Musk. Meta does not expect Threads to be "a meaningful driver of 2025 revenue," CFO Susan Li had said in a post-earnings call in October. The company plans to spend as much as $65 billion this year to expand its AI infrastructure, CEO Mark Zuckerberg said earlier on Friday, aiming to bolster the company's position against rivals OpenAI and Google in the race to dominate the technology.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 27, 2025

Headline: 25-year old woman loses Rs 10 lakh in a courier scam, here is what happenedOff late, courier scams are being more than ever and a fresh case has now been reported. A 25-year-old woman from Coimbatore lost Rs 10 lakh in a courier scam, prompting the Coimbatore rural cybercrime police to take swift action. Here is what happened.
Content: Off late, courier scams are being more than ever and a fresh case has now been reported. A 25-year-old woman from Coimbatore lost Rs 10 lakh in a courier scam, prompting the Coimbatore rural cybercrime police to take swift action. The victim, Rithika from Selakarichal, received a call on September 20, 2024, from an individual pretending to be a representative from FedEx in Mumbai. The caller falsely claimed that a suspicious package, using her identity proof, had been intercepted, allegedly containing drugs and illegal items.  The scammers further coerced Rithika into joining a Skype video call with people posing as cybercrime officials from Mumbai. They managed to obtain her bank details and other credentials, threatening her with a digital arrest if she didn’t cooperate. Under pressure, Rithika was forced to transfer Rs 10 lakh to various accounts, believing that the money was needed for verification and would be returned afterward. When the promised retransfer of funds never occurred, Rithika realised she had been scammed and immediately filed a complaint through the national cybercrime reporting portal. Acting on the complaint, the cybercrime police registered a case under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita Act and the Information Technology Act. A police team, led by sub-inspector Ananth, tracked the suspects’ bank accounts and froze them. These accounts were also linked to similar fraud cases across Delhi, Kerala, Karnataka, Gujarat, and Maharashtra. Based on this, a special team, under sub-inspector Marimuthu, travelled to South Delhi and arrested one of the key suspects, Gopi Kumar, aged 42. He was later brought to Coimbatore on a transit warrant. The police seized several items from Gopi, including mobile phones, debit cards, SIM cards, laptops, and other digital devices. Authorities believe that Gopi’s associates, who orchestrated the scam, are still at large, and a team is currently stationed in Delhi to apprehend them. For the same matter, investigations are ongoing, and the authorities are expected to bring the entire group responsible for this scam to justice.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 27, 2025

Headline: OpenAI to face legal action from big Indian companies, here is whyDigital news units of Indian billionaires Gautam Adani and Mukesh Ambani, and other outlets, have mounted a legal challenge against OpenAI alleging it improperly used copyright content, legal papers show.
Content:
Digital news units of Indian billionaires Gautam Adani and Mukesh Ambani, and other outlets like the Indian Express and the Hindustan Times, have mounted a legal challenge against OpenAI alleging it improperly used copyright content, legal papers show. The media outlets including Adani's NDTV and Ambani's Network18 have told a New Delhi court they want to join an ongoing lawsuit against the ChatGPT creator, as they are worried their news websites are being scraped to store and reproduce their work to users of the powerful AI tool. Reuters is first to report the case filing by the digital news publishers, which escalates an ongoing legal battle against ChatGPT in India. In the most high-profile battle, local news agency ANI was first to file a lawsuit against OpenAI last year. Global and Indian book publishers have also now joined in. The 135-page case filing in the New Delhi court, which is not public but was reviewed by Reuters, argues OpenAI's conduct constitutes "a clear and present danger to the valuable copyrights" of Digital News Publishers Association (DNPA) members and other outlets. It refers to OpenAI's "wilful scraping ... and adaptation of content". Courts across the world are hearing claims by authors, news outlets and musicians who accuse technology firms of using their copyright work to train AI services and who are seeking to have content used to train the chatbot deleted. The filing was made by the Indian Express, Hindustan Times, Adani's NDTV and the DNPA, which represents roughly 20 companies including Mukesh Ambani Network18 and players like Hindi daily Dainik Bhaskar, Zee News, India Today Group and the Hindu. Many of these outlets have a flourishing newspaper and television news business too. The Times of India is not taking part in the legal challenge despite being member of the DNPA. OpenAI did not respond to a request for comment on the new allegations. It has repeatedly denied such allegations, saying its AI systems make fair use of publicly available data.
None of the Indian media companies immediately responded to Reuters request for comment. The new intervention by Indian outlets will add firepower to ANI's lawsuit against the Microsoft-backed OpenAI, which is the most high-profile legal proceeding in the nation on this subject. A hearing in ANI's lawsuit against OpenAI is scheduled for Tuesday. Responding to the ANI case, OpenAI said in comments reported by Reuters last week that any order to delete training data would result in a violation of its U.S. legal obligations, and Indian judges have no jurisdiction to hear a copyright case against the company as its servers are located abroad. Reuters, which holds a 26 per cent interest in ANI, has said in a statement it is not involved in ANI's business practices or operations. In recent months, OpenAI has signed deals with Time magazine, the Financial Times, Business Insider-owner Axel Springer, France's Le Monde and Spain's Prisa Media to display content.
The Indian publishers in their new filing argue OpenAI has entered into partnership agreements with media outlets abroad, but has not entered into similar deals in India, hurting the media companies. Such conduct by OpenAI "in India betrays an inexplicable defiance of the law," the Indian media outlets' filing said. The publishers also said OpenAI was set to become a profit-driven business benefiting from the creative works of the media industry. This would result in a "weakened press" and would not be in the best interests of a vibrant democracy, their filing said. OpenAI kicked off an investment, consumer and corporate frenzy in generative AI after the Nov. 2022 launch of ChatGPT. It wants to be ahead in the AI race after raising $6.6 billion last year. It made its first India hire last year when it tapped a former WhatsApp executive, Pragya Misra, to handle public policy and partnerships in the country of 1.4 billion people, where millions of new users are going online, thanks to cheap mobile data prices.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 27, 2025

Headline: iQOO Neo 10R launching soon in India, Snapdragon 8s Gen 3 chip teasediQOO Neo 10R India launch confirmed: iQOO Neo 10R is expected to be launched soon in India. With multiple teasers available on the internet, we have a fair idea of what to expect, including details about the processor and design of the phone.
Content: iQOO is all set for its first smartphone launch in India this year with the iQOO Neo 10R. Adding an ‘R’ variant to its popular Neo series for the first time, the company seems to be sticking to its formula of delivering performance-focused devices at competitive prices. The teasers shared by iQOO give us a good idea of what to expect, including details about the processor and design of the phone. Going by the Amazon teaser for the iQOO Neo 10R, the phone will be powered by the Snapdragon 8s Gen 3 processor. Launched in March last year, this 4nm chipset from TSMC features a Cortex-X4 prime core clocked at 3GHz. It’s the same processor that also powered the likes of Realme GT 6 and Xiaomi 14 Civi from last year — smartphones that cost in the realm of Rs 35,000 to Rs 40,000.  The design of the iQOO Neo 10R takes inspiration from the Z9 Turbo Endurance Edition (from the Chinese market), featuring a squircle-shaped camera island on the back. However, the Neo 10R adds its own flair with a dual-tone design. The blue variant teased by iQOO has a white pattern on the left side of the rear panel, with the words “NEO POWER TO WIN” etched onto it. The flat sides with chamfered edges give the phone a premium, modern look. The iQOO Neo 10R is expected to launch in February, as hinted by a tweet from iQOO India’s CEO, Nipun Marya. Teasers also suggest the phone will fall under the Rs 30,000 price bracket, making it a competitive option in the midrange market. In terms of specifications, the phone is rumoured to feature a 1.5K AMOLED display with a 144Hz refresh rate. It’s also said to house a massive 6,400mAh battery, which should easily last through a day of heavy usage. The phone could run Android 15 based Funtouch OS out of the box and come in configurations of up to 12GB RAM and 256GB internal storage. iQOO Neo 10R set to launch in India soon as company drops a teaser The iQOO Neo 10R’s camera setup on the back may include a 50-megapixel Sony LYT-600 primary sensor capable of 4K 60fps video recording, paired with an 8-megapixel ultra-wide lens. For selfies, a 16-megapixel front camera is expected. The iQOO Neo 10R will likely be available on Amazon and possibly other online platforms. With the launch of the iQOO 13, the company announced its foray into the offline smartphone market. Stay tuned for more updates as the launch date approaches.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 27, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  Poco M7 Pro 5G review: Strong on the fundamentals

Headline: What is DeepSeek R1 AI and why is everyone talking about it: Story in 5 pointsIf you are keeping an eye on AI stuff, you must have come across DeepSeek. This is a new AI model, but unlike the ones that we have seen so far, this one comes from China, and it has set the world of AI abuzz. But what is DeepSeek, and why is everyone talking about it? We explain.
Content:
If you go to X, aka Twitter, today and look at the conversation people are having around AI, or if you look at the AI news and developments, you will come across this word: DeepSeek. In particular, you will come across DeepSeek R1. Since this AI system became available last week, it has set the world of AI on fire. There are two specific reasons for that, and we will come to it. But the question that you might have is this: What is DeepSeek R1, and why is everyone talking about it?  The first part of the question is easy and straight to answer. DeepSeek is a Hangzhou-based AI research lab and the R1 is its latest AI model. The company was founded in 2023 by Liang Wenfeng, an engineer and entrepreneur with a background in AI and quantitative finance. Before creating DeepSeek, Liang led High-Flyer, a hedge fund known for using AI to analyse financial data. Liang’s team at DeepSeek mostly consists of fresh graduates from top Chinese universities like Tsinghua and Peking University. For the second part of the question, let’s have a closer look at all the buzz. And boy, is the buzz. If you look at the conversation, almost everyone has something or other to say about DeepSeek R1, including Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, who used the moment to take a veiled potshot at OpenAI and its CEO Sam Altman. Here is what Nadella tweeted, “Jevons paradox strikes again! As AI gets more efficient and accessible, we will see its use skyrocket, turning it into a commodity we just can't get enough of.”1 - What is DeepSeek R1? DeepSeek has two current models: The R1 and the R1 Zero. For now, only the R1 is available for users, although the differences between the two AI models aren’t all that clear-cut. On paper, though, we know that the R1 is a general-purpose AI system, whereas the R1 Zero uses only Reinforcement Learning, which means it is entirely self-taught. Anyway, those are technical bits and aren’t exactly relevant to users like us.  What is relevant for us to know is that the DeepSeek R1 is an AI model that has been created by a China-based company and that it is as good as the latest — and competent — available AI systems like the OpenAI o1 and the Anthropic Claude. 2 - DeepSeek R1 is free and (probably) unlimited One of the key reasons why DeepSeek has managed to create a buzz is its cost to end users: it is free. In a way, this is the first extremely advanced AI system that is available for free to users. Other systems, like the OpenAI o1 and Claude Sonnet, require a paid subscription. And even with subscriptions, there are limits to how much users can utilise them. Google Gemini, too, is available for free, but it is also limited to older models for free versions and does have usage limits. DeepSeek doesn’t seem to have limits. It is free to use, as in totally free. 3 - DeepSeek R1 is said to be extremely cost-effective One reason why DeepSeek is likely free is because it is said to have some key technology breakthroughs. One of DeepSeek R1’s biggest selling points is its cost-efficiency. While models like OpenAI’s o1 cost around $15 per million input tokens, the same tasks can cost as little as $0.55 for DeepSeek. The low cost is likely the reason why the R1 is free for end users. And DeepSeek has apparently figured out a way to bring the cost down of an AI system by optimising it so well that it doesn’t require huge computing or a gazillion graphics cards to run.  In fact, efficiency is the one point that has forced people to sit up and take note of DeepSeek, particularly in the US. This sort of efficiency was thought to be impossible until a few weeks ago, but now that DeepSeek has shown what is possible with just a few million dollars, AI companies like OpenAI and Google that are spending billions of dollars are looking like losers. advertisement4 - DeepSeek R1 is open sourceThis is another key point that has excited people. Unlike the OpenAI or Google systems, DeepSeek R1 is open source. What this essentially means is that not only DeepSeek is making big US tech companies look extravagant and irresponsible in the way they are spending money, but it also takes away their ability to price their products higher. After all, what DeepSeek is essentially telling people here is that you don’t have to spend 1000s of dollars to get access to OpenAI or Anthropic systems. Instead, you can just take this open-source model, tune it to your needs and use it in whatever way you want. At the same time, the implications are not just business-related. They are also geopolitical in nature. Instead of AI becoming another coveted and closely guarded system owned by certain countries like the US, an open-source model like DeepSeek frees up technology that can be used by any country in the world to create its own AI systems. This is probably why Marc Andreessen, an influential venture capitalist based in Silicon Valley, recently tweeted, “DeepSeek R1 is one of the most amazing and impressive breakthroughs I’ve ever seen — and as open source, a profound gift to the world.”advertisement5 - DeepSeek R1 is fun to useIf, after hearing about it so much, you go to DeepSeek and use the R1, you will find that another reason why everyone is talking about it is the way it works. The R1 comes with a feature that “shows” how the AI model thinks. It is incredible to see it reason itself and then do an analysis of the question or problem it is trying to address. Sure, models by OpenAI and others, too, do the same. But they don’t show this to users. DeepSeek R1, by default, shows it. Headline: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra first India sale next week: List of 6 upgradesSamsung just recently announced its Galaxy S25 series and the new devices are all set to go on sale for the first time in India next week, that is on February 7.  Here is a list of 5 upgrades that you should know about the Galaxy S25 Ultra.
Content:
Samsung just recently announced its Galaxy S25 series and the new devices are all set to go on sale for the first time in India next week, that is on February 7. While the standard and Plus models in the lineup have received minor updates compared to their upgrades, the new Galaxy S25 Ultra has made its debut with several upgrades. If you are confused about whether you should consider buying the Ultra version or not, here is a list of 5 upgrades that you should know about.  Also, for those who are not aware of its pricing, the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra will cost you Rs 1,29,999 for the 256GB base model. This is the same price as the Galaxy S24 Ultra, meaning Samsung hasn't increased the retail cost of the new version, something which one should keep in mind, given Samsung has refined the experience with some upgrades without increasing the selling price.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra first India sale next week: List of 5 upgradesNew Chipset The new Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is using Qualcomm's latest Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, which is one of the biggest upgrades. Popular smartphones like OnePlus 13 and iQOO 13 have been launched with the same chip. And you can expect a powerful performance out of the box. The company is claiming that users will get 37 per cent better performance, 30 per cent improved GPU performance and 40 per cent better NPU performance compared to the Galaxy S24 Ultra. It also comes with a Vulkan Engine and improved Ray Tracing for a better gaming experience.Better vapour chamber cooling system Samsung claims to have improved heat management by increasing the vapour chamber size by 40 per cent on the S25 Ultra, with smaller but notable improvements of 15 per cent on the S25 and S25+. This is a big claim from Samsung and if it works as it is intended to, then gamers are likely in for a treat. The device not only has a super fast chipset, but also a big battery. Lighter design, better screen durability Samsung has refined its design to offer a better user experience. The Galaxy S15 Ultra features a 6.9-inch screen, up from 6.8 inches in the previous model. The bezels around the display are seemingly slimmer. You will also notice that the device's panel has a more scratch-resistant Corning Gorilla Armor 2 glass coating, which Samsung claims is 29 percent more resistant to scratches and cracks than its predecessor. Additionally, it now has more rounded edges that move away from the sharper Galaxy Note design. Despite this, the Ultra is lighter, weighing just 218 grams, while still housing the same 5,000mAh battery that has powered Ultra models since the Galaxy S20 Ultra.New AI features? The Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra ships with OneUI 7 custom Android skin, which is based on Android 15. It brings several new AI features and even improves animations and offers a smoother experience. This update includes the improved Gemini assistant, also found on the Google Pixel 9 series, along with other features like personalised briefing, improved circle-to-search functionality, Cross, and an audio eraser. If you’re eager to try out these new features right away, the Galaxy S25 Ultra is the way to go. With the S25 Ultra, users can quickly access Gemini by long-pressing the power button, while Samsung apps now come with Gemini extensions. The AI experience has also been upgraded with tools like "Generative Edit," which can remove people and their shadows from photos, and "Now Brief," which delivers personalised daily summaries. The Samsung Gallery app now supports natural language search, making it easier to find photos. Additionally, a new AI Select tool offers relevant suggestions based on screen activity, and voice commands can now trigger specific tasks, like activating a blue light filter when needed. The Live Video feature even provides step-by-step guidance for activities like cooking.New ultrawide camera Samsung has upgraded the rear camera system of the Galaxy S25 Ultra by replacing the old 12-megapixel ultrawide sensor with a new 50-megapixel sensor. While the rest of the setup is similar to the Galaxy S24 Ultra, people are likely to get better results compared to the older version because of its use of the new flagship Snapdragon chipset. Also, its predecessor already offered a good camera experience in its price range. So, the other three sensors in the rear camera setup are - a 200-megapixel primary sensor, a 50-megapixel telephoto lens with 5x optical zoom and a 10-megapixel telephoto camera with 3x optical zoom. The 12-megapixel front-facing camera remains unchanged but it is expected to offer better performance for selfies and video calls.
Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 27, 2025

Headline: Oppo Find N5 aka OnePlus Open 2 to be thinner than iPad Pro M4 modelOppo has confirmed that the upcoming foldable, the Oppo Find N5 will be slimmer than the slimmest iPad Pro. As the device will be released in February in China, it could later be rebranded as the OnePlus Open 2.
Content:
Oppo is set to release its next-gen foldable smartphone -- the Oppo Find N5 in China. The launch is scheduled to take place in February 2025. Previously, the company claimed that this foldable would be the world's thinnest fold and now, it has added further context to the slimness of the upcoming phone. Before we get into the details, it is important to know that Oppo Find N5 is most likely to be rebranded as the OnePlus Open 2. Latest reports suggest that the OnePlus Open 2 will launch by the second half of 2025. 
 


 President of Overseas Marketing at Oppo, Billy Zhang posted on X (formerly Twitter), comparing the upcoming Oppo Find N5 to the iPad Pro M4 model. For perspective, the M4 iPad Pro is the slimmest device in the Apple-verse so far, thanks to 5.1mm thickness. And now Oppo is claiming that it is bringing a fold that is slimmer than 5.1mm. While this seems impressive, you must know that this thickness is when the device unfolded. 
 


 Oppo's Chief Product Officer, Pete Lau also posted on X, sharing a better comparison. However, here the Oppo Find N5 is compared with an iPhone, which looks like iPhone 16 Pro. Hence, we can speculate that when folded, the Find N5 aka OnePlus Open 2 will be equally slim as the iPhone 16 Pro. Oppo Find N5 aka OnePlus Open 2: What to expect Leaks about the Oppo Find N5, also known as the OnePlus Open 2, have sparked interest with reports pointing to significant upgrades over its predecessor. The device is rumoured to feature Qualcomm's latest Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, a notable leap from the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 chip found in the original OnePlus Open.   The device is also expected to include foldable displays with a 2K+ resolution, delivering a premium viewing experience. Camera upgrades are anticipated, with a 50-megapixel triple-lens setup that may incorporate a circular periscope telephoto lens, potentially enhancing the 3x optical zoom capability of its predecessor. Additionally, the Open 2 could introduce 3-stage wireless charging, a practical feature for its large foldable design.   In terms of aesthetics, the foldable is rumoured to feature a slimmer, lighter frame, with material options including plain leather and glass for a more refined and modern look. These enhancements suggest the OnePlus Open 2 is poised to compete strongly in the foldable market.  The company has also confirmed the wireless charging speed on the Oppo Find N5 will max out at 50W. This indicates that even though the phone comes with a slim profile, the battery may not be compromised.
