Headline: WhatsApp for iPhone may soon get this long-time Android featureWhatsApp is testing multi-account support for iPhones, allowing users to switch between two accounts on one device. The feature, already available on Android, could roll out globally soon.
Content:
WhatsApp users on iPhones might finally be able to enjoy a feature that Android users have been using for quite a while now. The Meta-owned messaging app is reportedly testing multi-account support for iOS, which would allow iPhone users to log into two different WhatsApp accounts on the same device. This means you could use one account for personal chats and another for work, all without needing a second phone or relying on workarounds like WhatsApp Business. For Android users, this feature has been a lifesaver since it was rolled out in October 2023. It lets them switch between two accounts seamlessly, without the need for app cloning or carrying multiple devices. Now, it seems WhatsApp is working to bring the same convenience to iPhone users. According to WABetaInfo, the feature is currently in development and was spotted in iOS beta version 25.2.10.70. However, it’s not yet available for testing, so beta users will have to wait a little longer to try it out.

Source: WABetaInfo
 The multi-account feature is expected to work similarly on iPhones as it does on Android. Users will likely be able to add a second account directly through the app settings. There will be two options — setting up a new account from scratch or linking to an existing one by scanning a QR code. This flexibility will make it easier for people to manage multiple numbers, whether for personal, professional, or other purposes. One of the biggest advantages of this feature is that it keeps everything organised in one place. Each account will have its own separate chats, notifications, backups, and settings, so there’s no risk of mixing things up. For those with dual SIM iPhones, this will be especially handy. Instead of juggling between WhatsApp and WhatsApp Business, users will be able to manage both numbers within the main app. While the feature is still under development, it’s clear that WhatsApp is aiming to create a consistent experience across both Android and iOS platforms. Once testing is complete, the multi-account support is expected to roll out to all iPhone users worldwide. However, it might take a few months before it’s officially available. For now, if you’re an Android user and haven’t tried this feature yet, setting up a second account is pretty straightforward. All you need is a second phone number. Even if you have your secondary SIM card (or eSIM) on your primary phone with your main phone number, that also works. Simply head to WhatsApp settings > tap the + icon next to your name > tap Add account, and follow the on-screen prompts.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 27, 2025

Headline: Nothing drops teaser for a new phone, is this Nothing Phone 3 or Phone 3a?Nothing has officially dropped hints of the Nothing Phone 3 launch, which might take place on March 4. But here is the catch.
Content: Nothing is planning to launch its next flagship in March this year. CEO Carl Pei has previously confirmed that the Nothing Phone 3 is to debut by March 2025. Now, the company has recently shared a teaser, which is anticipated to be a hint of its upcoming phone. In the X (formerly Twitter) post, the company shared a glimpse of its traditional LED lights and the rest is left for speculation. Barring the information that its new innovation is coming in on March 4, the company has not shared any details. This takes us to a point: is the teased phone Nothing Phone 3 or Phone 3a?  Is it Nothing Phone 3 or Phone 3a?  Chronologically, Nothing should release the Phone 3 before Nothing Phone 3a. The CEO's statement about launching the flagship in March and the 2-year gap indicates that this is a teaser belongs to the Nothing Phone 3 launch. The company released Nothing Phone 2 in 2023 and has been releasing follow-ups like Phone 2a and Phone 2a Plus in the following years. And now, we think, it is time to revisit the flagship timeline and release Nothing Phone 3 before any of its siblings. However, there is no confirmation yet.  On the other hand, tipster Abhishek Yadav claims that the company will mix up the timeline this time by launching Nothing Phone 3a before the flagship. Another indication of Phone 3a's early launch is that the teaser looks like the Nothing Phone 2a's camera panel.    That said, only Nothing knows what is coming up in March, and we can only predict. Hence, stay tuned for the exact details on March 4 at 3:30PM. Nothing Phone 3: What to expect The Nothing Phone 3 marks a departure from the typical annual upgrade cycle, arriving two years after the Phone 2's launch in July 2023. This extended timeline hints at significant enhancements, particularly in AI-driven capabilities, and has reignited excitement around the brand, thanks to Carl Pei's recent confirmation. Leaked details and a video shared by Pei suggest that the Nothing Phone 3 will serve as a central hub for a personalised, AI-powered experience. AI integration will be deeply woven into Nothing OS, potentially transforming how users interact with their home screens and manage daily tasks. One of the standout features rumoured for the device is an Action Button, reminiscent of the iPhone, which is expected to offer customisable shortcuts for a more tailored user experience. The phone will reportedly feature a 6.5-inch display, maintaining its sleek design. In addition to the standard model, a Pro variant is rumoured to debut alongside it, catering to premium buyers with enhanced specifications, including a larger 6.7-inch display. However, details about the Pro model remain scarce, and this speculation should be taken with a grain of salt. Despite the quiet period following Phone 2, these developments suggest Nothing is gearing up to make a significant impact with its next release.Published By: Unnati GusainPublished On: Jan 27, 2025Also read |  Nothing teases its next flagship, might follow the transparent rear panel trendAlso read |  Nothing Phone 3 rumour round-up: Price, specs and all we know so farMust Watch

Headline: Chinese AI chatbot DeepSeek hit by 'malicious attacks' amid popularity surgeDeepSeek's AI chatbot gained broader exposure earlier this year with its release on Apple and Google app stores. By Monday, it had climbed to the top spot as the most downloaded free app on Apple's iPhone store
Content: Chinese tech startup DeepSeek announced Monday that it had been targeted by a cyberattack, disrupting new user registrations on its platform. The company, known for its artificial intelligence chatbot that has captivated the tech industry, described the incident as “large-scale malicious attacks.” Despite the disruption, DeepSeek confirmed that registered users could still log in and access the platform as usual. DeepSeek has drawn significant attention in the AI sector since launching a new AI model last month, which it claimed rivaled those developed by US companies like OpenAI, the creator of ChatGPT. The startup emphasised its model’s cost efficiency, particularly in its use of Nvidia chips to train systems on massive datasets. The company’s chatbot gained broader exposure earlier this year with its release on Apple and Google app stores. By Monday, it had climbed to the top spot as the most downloaded free app on Apple’s iPhone store, underscoring its rapid rise in popularity. The success of DeepSeek’s AI assistant has reignited debates over the competition between China and the United States in the race to develop cutting-edge AI technologies. While US tech analysts have noted the startup’s swift progress, some have raised concerns about the implications of a Chinese firm achieving such advancements at a fraction of the cost incurred by American competitors. Founded in Hangzhou in 2023, DeepSeek released its first large language model later that year, quickly establishing itself as a formidable player in the AI landscape.advertisementPublished By: Devika BhattacharyaPublished On: Jan 28, 2025

Headline: DeepSeek limits new user sign-ups after surge in cyberattacksDeepSeek's chatbot recently became the most downloaded free app on Apple's App Store, briefly surpassing OpenAI's ChatGPT in popularity. However, the company's systems faced major disruptions, with its status page reporting "major outages" for both its API and web chat services on Monday.
Content: Chinese AI startup DeepSeek has temporarily limited new user sign-ups for its chatbot to users with China-based phone numbers following what it described as large-scale cyberattacks on its online services. The decision comes amidst widespread outages and a surge in demand for its flagship AI model, DeepSeek-R1, which has generated quite a buzz globally. DeepSeek’s chatbot had recently become the most downloaded free app on Apple’s App Store, briefly surpassing OpenAI’s ChatGPT in popularity. However, the company’s systems faced major disruptions, with its status page reporting “major outages” for both its API and web chat services on Monday. While the API was operating with degraded performance by mid-morning, the web chat remained partially unavailable for hours. To address the ongoing issues, DeepSeek temporarily restricted sign-ups to users with +86 phone numbers, citing this measure as a way to ensure continued service. DeepSeek announced on its status page, “Due to large-scale malicious attacks on DeepSeek's services, we are temporarily limiting registrations to ensure continued service. Existing users can log in as usual. Thanks for your understanding and support.” Existing users, however, were unaffected and could continue to log in as usual. The restriction, though not officially called temporary, seems to be a way to manage the cyberattacks that happened as the chatbot’s global popularity grew quickly.  DeepSeek, founded in 2023 by hedge fund manager Liang Wenfeng, has quickly emerged as a serious competitor in the AI race. Its latest model, DeepSeek-R1, released just last week, has gained attention for its advanced capabilities in tasks such as mathematics, coding, and reasoning. What sets DeepSeek apart is its claim of developing models at a fraction of the cost compared to Silicon Valley giants like OpenAI and Google. This achievement comes despite US restrictions on China’s access to high-end AI chips, further fuelling speculation about the efficiency of its training methods. The rise of DeepSeek has not only intensified competition in the generative AI space but also impacted the stock market. On Monday, Nvidia, a key supplier of AI chips, saw its shares tumble by over 14 per cent, wiping out more than $500 billion in market value. Other tech companies in the US and Europe also saw drops as investors reacted to DeepSeek's low-cost approach to AI. The temporary outage and registration restrictions, however, haven’t brought down the enthusiasm among tech analysts. Many are watching closely to see how DeepSeek navigates this challenging period while scaling its operations. With global leaders such as OpenAI and Anthropic racing to maintain dominance in the AI space, the sudden emergence of cost-effective alternatives like the DeepSeek-R1 underscores China’s growing influence in the field. As of now, we'll have to wait and see how long these restrictions last.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 28, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  Poco M7 Pro 5G review: Strong on the fundamentals

Headline: Meta AI will now remember details shared with chatbot on Facebook and WhatsAppMeta is rolling out a new Memory feature that can record certain details shared with Meta AI chatbot on Facebook, Messenger and WhatsApp.
Content:
As the AI world is rising rapidly, Meta is working to improve its AI chatbot day after day. Recently, aiming to enhance personalisation, Meta is rolling out a new Memory feature. It will record “certain details, like how they love to travel and learn new languages” shared with Meta AI chatbot on Facebook, Messenger and WhatsApp. The company shared that the feature is live for both iOS and Android users but only in US and Canada. 
 


advertisementWhat is the Meta AI’s Memory feature? Similar to Google or OpenAI, Meta’s AI memory feature allows the system to remember important details from previous interactions. For example, if a user has mentioned being vegan in a past chat, Meta AI will consider that when offering suggestions, like breakfast ideas, to ensure they align with the user's preferences.Meta confirms that Meta AI will only remember certain things you tell it in 1:1 conversations (not group chats), and you can delete its memories at any time.
 


 Similar to Google or OpenAI, Meta’s AI memory feature allows the system to remember important details from previous interactions. For example, if a user has mentioned being vegan in a past chat, Meta AI will consider that when offering suggestions, like breakfast ideas, to ensure they align with the user's preferences. Meta confirms that Meta AI will only remember certain things you tell it in 1:1 conversations (not group chats), and you can delete its memories at any time.
 


 Such tools have always been controversial. It raises questions about security and privacy of the application for its users. But wait for another update, which is another step ahead. Meta AI new personalised features Meta says the chatbot will now draw on account information from across its apps to offer personalised recommendations. This could include details like a user's home location from their Facebook profile or recently viewed videos on Instagram. 
 


 In an example, Meta explains, “Let’s say you’re looking for something fun to do with your family this weekend, and you ask Meta AI to suggest something. Based on the home location you’ve listed as part of your Facebook profile, recent views of reels featuring live performances by various country artists and the memory that you have a partner and two young kids, Meta AI might suggest tickets for that weekend’s country music show at your local arena and reservations at a local brunch spot.” This feature is also available for US and Canada on all three platforms: Facebook, Messenger and Instagram. Headline: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman calls rival DeepSeek impressive, promises to deliver AGIOpenAI CEO Sam Altman has praised its rival company, DeepSeek. He calls its R1 model "impressive".
Content:
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman recently took to X (formerly Twitter) praising the debut of its rival, a Chinese AI startup called DeepSeek. Currently, DeepSeek has released the R1 and R1 zero, but Altman is quite impressed with the first one. In the post, he said that given the price the company is charging for its services, DeepSeek's R1 model is "an impressive model". For perspective, according to a post on DeepSeek's official WeChat account, the recently launched DeepSeek-R1 is 20 to 50 times more cost-effective than OpenAI's o1 model, depending on the specific task.
 


 That said, Altman has also released that to compete with this low-cost Chinese AI model, OpenAI has to pull up new releases. While he was thrilled with the competition, he said, "we will obviosuly deliver much better models." This comes after DeepSeek's free app has also taken over ChatGPT on Apple's App Store in several regions, including the US, UK, Australia, Canada, China and Singapore. What is OpenAI's next step?  Sam Altman stated that OpenAI will continue to execute on its research roadmap. Looking at the competition, he added, "more compute is more important now than ever before to succeed at our mission." He also said that in this era of AI, the world will ask for a lot of AI. But OpenAI is ready to amaze its audience with its next-gen models. 
 advertisement


 Giving a hint about its upcoming AI models, he also stated that OpenAI is "looking forward to bringing up all AGI and beyond." This is not the first time that Altman has teased AGI. A few weeks ago, via his blogpost, he stated that OpenAI is confident about creating AGI. This statement fuelled rumours around the launches in January.  Before any such announcement, Altman threw water on expectations. Not AGI, but OpenAI has recently launched its first AI-agent, the Operator, which can perform tasks on your behalf. The Operator can be tasked with a wide range of repetitive browser activities, such as completing forms, ordering groceries, or even creating memes. By leveraging the same interfaces and tools that people use every day, AI expands its practical applications, helping individuals save time on routine tasks. Currently, it is in a research preview, which means it has limitations and is open to feedback.  But soon after the launch of the Operator, DeepSeek came into the picture and stole the limelight. This pumped up Altman to bring back the magical word: AGI. Artificial General Intelligence or AGI is defined as an AI system that can tackle any task just like a human would. After AGI, we get to artificial superintelligence (ASI), which is AI that exceeds the capabilities of the human mind. What is DeepSeek, and why is it getting all the attention?  DeepSeek currently offers two models: the R1 and the R1 Zero. At present, only the R1 is accessible to users, though the distinctions between the two models remain somewhat ambiguous. On paper, the R1 is a general-purpose AI system, while the R1 Zero relies exclusively on Reinforcement Learning, meaning it is entirely self-taught. However, these technical details are unlikely to impact everyday users significantly. What truly sets DeepSeek apart and has generated significant buzz is its pricing—or lack thereof. The R1 model is completely free for users, making it the first highly advanced AI system to be offered at no cost. By contrast, other systems like OpenAI's o1 and Claude Sonnet require paid subscriptions and impose usage limits even for paying users. While Google’s Gemini also offers a free version, it is restricted to older models and comes with usage caps. DeepSeek, however, breaks the mold by being entirely free to use, without any apparent limits.Published By: Unnati GusainPublished On: Jan 28, 2025Also read |  DeepSeek limits new user sign-ups after surge in cyberattacksAlso read |  What is DeepSeek R1 AI and why is everyone talking about it: Story in 5 pointsAlso read |  DeepSeek's 'Sputnik Moment' sends Nvidia and AI giants reeling amid cost revolutionMust Watch

Headline: DeepSeek says its Janus Pro 7B image generation AI model is better than rivalsDeepSeek's new AI model, Janus-Pro-7B, claims to outperform rivals like OpenAI's DALL-E 3, and Stability AI's Stable Diffusion in key image generation benchmarks, delivering sharper and more stable image outputs.
Content: DeepSeek — a Chinese AI startup company founded by Liang Wenfang — has now introduced its latest image-generation model, Janus-Pro-7B, claiming it outperforms major rivals in the field. In a report released on Monday, the company revealed that its new model had surpassed OpenAI’s DALL-E 3 and Stability AI’s Stable Diffusion in key image generation benchmarks. This is another big achievement for the startup, which is quickly gaining attention in the AI space. Janus-Pro-7B is an upgraded version of DeepSeek’s previous model, Janus, which was launched late last year. The new model has been fine-tuned to offer better performance, stability, and image quality. It achieves this by utilising 72 million high-quality synthetic images alongside real-world data, helping it create more visually appealing and stable outputs. The model’s larger architecture, with up to 7 billion parameters, has also improved its training speed and overall accuracy. In terms of technical improvements, Janus-Pro-7B offers more refined image generation by balancing a wide range of data inputs. This has led to an increase in the richness of the details within the generated images, addressing some of the common limitations seen in previous models.  The launch of Janus-Pro-7B comes amid a wave of attention for DeepSeek’s other developments, notably its DeepSeek-V3 AI model, which recently became the top-rated free application on Apple’s App Store in the United States. The success of these models has had a notable impact on the stock market, with stocks like Nvidia and Oracle seeing declines as investors reconsider the sustainability of AI chip spending. What makes the Janus-Pro-7B stand out is that it can both understand and create images in a way that many other models cannot. It uses a smart and new approach called an autoregressive framework, which helps it process information step by step. What makes it even more unique is how it handles visual information. Instead of treating all visual data the same way, it splits the process of understanding images into different pathways. This separation makes the model more flexible, meaning it can handle a variety of tasks involving images, whether it’s understanding them or generating new ones. By doing this, Janus-Pro-7B avoids the problems that earlier models faced, where trying to do everything in one unified system often led to limitations. As a result, Janus-Pro-7B performs exceptionally well across many tasks without losing its efficiency or quality. While much of the focus has been on DeepSeek’s other model, the DeepSeek-R1, which is positioned as a challenger to OpenAI’s o1 model, Janus-Pro-7B has made a strong case for itself as a top contender in the field of image generation. Built on DeepSeek’s LLM architecture, the model incorporates a powerful vision encoder and a specialised tokeniser to generate images with impressive detail and accuracy.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 28, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  Poco M7 Pro 5G review: Strong on the fundamentalssharper

Headline: Google Pixel 9a rumoured to get a price hike, but only for this variantGoogle Pixel 9a is expected to launch in March this year. Ahead of the launch, the recent price leak suggests that the higher variant might witness a price hike over its predecessor, the Google Pixel 8a.
Content: After releasing the Google Pixel 9 series in India (in August 2024), the company is looking forward to introduce its younger sibling -- the Google Pixel 9a. While there is no official notification yet, the Pixel 9a might hit the market in March 2025. Ahead of the launch, a leak hints at a hike in prices for the upcoming phone, but here is the catch. The leak suggests that the base model (128GB) will be priced similar to its predecessor, Google Pixel 8a, but the high-end model (256GB) could witness a price hike.  In the US, the Google Pixel 9a will be priced at $499 (approx Rs 43,100) for the 128GB model, and $599 (Rs 51,800) for the 256GB model, according to a report published by Android Headline. The starting price of the upcoming Google smartphone is similar to the Pixel 8a's price. However, the 256GB model is $40 (approx Rs 3,400) more expensive. In India, the Google Pixel 8a was launched at a starting price of Rs 52,999 for the base variant and Rs 59,999 for 256GB. This means that the upcoming Pixel 9a price will begin at Rs 52,999 in India, but the 256GB variant could cost up to Rs 64,000. If this holds to be true, the difference between the two variants range over Rs 10,000. Google Pixel 9a to debut in March: What do we know In December 2024, the Google Pixel 9a was in the headlines for its leaked design pattern. The leaked image indicates that Google is doing away with its traditional camera bump, which was also seen in its flagship series, Google Pixel 9 series. Instead of the traditional camera bump, Google might integrate the camera directly into the body, giving it a sleeker appearance. The device is also expected to sport a sturdy build with rounded edges for a comfortable grip.  The Google Pixel 9a is rumoured to feature a 6.3-inch Actua display with a 120Hz refresh rate, matching the screen size of the Pixel 9 and Pixel 9 Pro. In terms of performance, the Pixel 9a is said to be powered by the Tensor G4 chipset, paired with 8GB of RAM and storage options of either 128GB or 256GB. Battery life is another highlight, with leaks pointing to a 5,000mAh capacity, an 11 per cent increase over the Pixel 8a. It supports 18W charging, and the larger battery size aligns with the slightly bigger physical dimensions of the phone, making this claim credible. On the connectivity front, the Pixel 9a is rumoured to include the Exynos Modem 5300, a reliable but older modem also used in the Pixel 8 series. While it may lack some of the efficiency and advanced 5G features of the newer Exynos Modem 5400 found in the Pixel 9 series, the 5300 should still deliver stable and reliable performance for everyday tasks. Camera enthusiasts can expect a 48-megapixel primary sensor, a 13-megapixel ultra-wide camera, and a 13-megapixel front-facing camera for selfies and video calls, providing a robust photography setup. The Pixel 9a is slightly larger than its predecessor, with dimensions of 154.7 x 73.3 x 8.9mm and a weight of 186g. Interestingly, despite the increase in size, it is marginally lighter than the Pixel 8a, which weighed 188g. With these features, the Pixel 9a appears to strike a balance between modern design, performance, and practicality.Published By: Unnati GusainPublished On: Jan 28, 2025Also read |  Google Pixel 9a leak details: From pricing to specs, everything we know so farAlso read |  Oppo Find N5 aka OnePlus Open 2 to be thinner than iPad Pro M4 modelAlso read |  Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra first India sale next week: List of 5 upgrades

Headline: Donald Trump issues a warning against DeepSeek AI, says it is a wake-up call for the US industryUS President Donald Trump said on Monday that Chinese startup DeepSeek's technology should act as a spur for American companies and said it was good that companies in China have come up with a cheaper, faster method of artificial intelligence.
Content: US President Donald Trump said on Monday that the Chinese startup DeepSeek's technology should act as a spur for American companies and that it was good that companies in China had come up with a cheaper, faster method of artificial intelligence. "The release of DeepSeek, AI from a Chinese company should be a wakeup call for our industries that we need to be laser-focused on competing to win," Trump said in Florida. On Monday, investors sold technology stocks across the globe over concerns that the emergence of a low-cost Chinese artificial intelligence model would threaten the dominance of the current US-based AI leaders. "I've been reading about China and some of the companies in China, one in particular coming up with a faster method of AI and much less expensive method, and that's good because you don't have to spend as much money. I view that as a positive, as an asset," Trump said. "I view that as a positive because you'll be doing that too, so you won't be spending as much, and you'll get the same result, hopefully," he said. Trump said that Chinese leaders had told him that the United States had the most brilliant scientists in the world, and he indicated that if the Chinese industry could come up with cheaper AI technology, U.S. companies would follow. "We always have the ideas. We're always first. So I would say that's a positive that could be very much a positive development. So instead of spending billions and billions, you'll spend less, and you'll come up with, hopefully, the same solution," Trump said.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 28, 2025Tune In

Headline: Nothing Phone 3a likely to launch on March 4, Flipkart hintsFlipkart hints that the teased image could be Nothing Phone 3a. If Phone 3a arrives before Phone 3, this will mark a change in the traditional chronology.
Content:
Nothing has recently posted a glimpse of its next-gen venture, revealing that the announcement will arrive on March 4. While several users were speculating that it could be Nothing Phone 3, there were rumours that it could also be the Nothing Phone 3a. Now, after much anticipation, Flipkart has finally put all the confusion to rest. Nothing has also teased the same image on Flipkart's microsite, and here the URL mentions "Nothing Phone 3a". 

 



Credit: X/ @yAbhishekhd
 This suggests that Nothing will bring the Phone 3a, before unveiling its Phone 3. For context, Nothing Phone 2a was launched in India in March 2023 and Nothing Phone 2 debuted in July 2023. This also means that the company is overlooking the 2-year gap by not bringing the Phone 3. And now it seems like the mid-range Phone 3a will debut first. The recently received BIS certification also indicates the same. The rumour also has it that this time as well, the company will bring Phone 3a along with a potential Phone 3a Plus model. The device, by the model number A059, was also spotted in an IMEI database alongside a variant labeled A059P. In Nothing's naming convention, the "P" likely signifies "Plus," suggesting that the company is gearing up to release both the Phone 3a and a more premium Phone 3a Plus model. However, this remains speculation for now, and we recommend waiting for official updates from the brand on March 4 at 3.30PM. Nothing Phone 3a teaser
 


 Nothing shared a glimpse of its traditional LED lights and the rest is left for speculation. Barring the information that its new innovation is coming in on March 4, the company has not shared any details. It image looks like the rear camera module. We can see two separate islands, which could be hinting at a triple-camera setup. This is a step up from the usual dual cameras on all Nothing phones. Nothing Phone 3a: What to expect Leaks suggest that the Phone 3a will feature the Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 chipset, marking a shift from its predecessor, the Nothing Phone 2a, which was powered by MediaTek's Dimensity 7200 Pro. The Phone 3a Plus is also rumoured to include a more advanced chip, stepping up from the Dimensity 7350 Pro used in the previous generation.   Although detailed specifications remain limited, it's speculated that these devices will launch with Android 15, maintaining Nothing's reputation for offering a clean and optimised software experience.  While the exact camera configurations remain unknown, reports indicate that the Nothing Phone 3a could include a telephoto lens, while the Nothing Phone 3a Plus might feature a more advanced periscope lens. In comparison, previous models were equipped with dual 50-megapixel rear cameras, comprising a main sensor and an ultra-wide lens. Headline: Meta offering Rs 43 lakh per month to TikTok creators for creating content on InstagramMeta is reportedly offering TikTok creators huge payouts, with some deals going up to Rs 43 lakh per month, to create exclusive content for Instagram Reels. This move is part of Meta's strategy to compete with TikTok, especially as questions loom over TikTok's future in the US.
Content: Meta is reportedly offering TikTok creators huge payouts, with some deals going up to $50,000 (around Rs 43 lakh) per month, to create exclusive content for Instagram Reels. This move is part of Meta’s strategy to compete with TikTok, especially as questions loom over TikTok's future in the US. As per a report by Business Insider, Meta has been reaching out to creators who have over a million followers on TikTok, offering them monthly payments ranging from $2,500 to $50,000 (roughly Rs 2 lakh to Rs 43 lakh). The contracts require the creators to produce and share short-form videos exclusively on Instagram for at least three months. The payout tiers vary depending on the size of the creator’s following, and the deals offer hefty sums based on their level of engagement. The creators are expected to post a certain number of Reels each month, with videos lasting between 15 seconds and three minutes. Additionally, they must share their Instagram content on other platforms like TikTok or YouTube, encouraging their followers to join them on Instagram. The report also mentions that Instagram is offering deals worth up to $300,000 (around Rs 2.5 crore) for six months. During this time, creators are required to post at least 10 Reels every month. Essentially, creators have the chance to earn up to $50,000 per month, with the top-tier creators, who have the highest engagement and followers, being eligible for the maximum payout. This would allow them to earn a total of $300,000 over the course of six months. The report highlights that creators are required to "post 25% more to Instagram reels than their next largest short-form video platform. Once a day, engage with fans via comments, shares, or replies." However, despite the attractive payouts, some creators are hesitant. Several have raised concerns over the exclusivity demands and the need to produce more content for Instagram than they do for other platforms. Talent managers handling these creators have said that balancing content creation across platforms, along with Instagram’s specific requirements, has made the deal less appealing for some. Though some creators are taking advantage of the big money, others remain wary. The exclusive nature of the deal and the structured content guidelines have caused frustration among certain creators. But, the latest move shows the challenge Meta faces in trying to get TikTok creators to switch to Instagram, even with the promise of big financial rewards. Meta is clearly trying hard to gain more ground in the competitive short-form video space if we go by the report.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 28, 2025

Headline: iOS 18.3 stable update now rolling out to compatible iPhonesApple has officially released the stable version of iOS 18.3 for compatible iPhones, bringing a mix of new features, bug fixes, and some regional limitations, particularly for users in India.
Content: Apple has officially released the stable version of iOS 18.3 for compatible iPhones, bringing a mix of new features, bug fixes, and some regional limitations, particularly for users in India. The update is now available for download on iPhone XR, iPhone SE (2nd generation), iPhone 11 series and later models. While the latest update introduces a bunch of improvements, it also comes with a notable caveat for Indian users regarding Apple Intelligence, the company’s AI-powered features. One of the standout additions in iOS 18.3 is the return of a familiar feature — repeated operations in the Calculator app. This functionality, which was present in iOS 17 but mysteriously removed in iOS 18, has been reinstated, much to the relief of users who rely on it for quick calculations. Another notable change is the introduction of sleep apnoea notifications in Brazil, a feature aimed at enhancing health monitoring for users in the region. For those with the latest iPhone 16 series, the update brings enhanced camera controls. Users can now enable Auto Exposure and Auto Focus Lock with a simple light press and hold on the Camera Control button. Additionally, the new Visual Intelligence feature allows iPhone 16 users to scan posters with location and date information, prompting them to create calendar events seamlessly. This feature also extends to real-time identification of plants and animals, making it a handy tool for nature enthusiasts. Notification Summaries have also seen a tweak in iOS 18.3. These summaries now appear in italicised text to distinguish them from regular notifications. However, following feedback from users and the media, Apple has temporarily disabled the ability for Apple Intelligence to create summaries for news and entertainment app notifications. The company has also added disclaimers across the iOS interface, noting that Notification Summaries may occasionally contain errors. Another interesting addition is the improved accessibility of Genmoji, which can now be easily created and used in Messages and other supported apps. On the security front, iOS 18.3 addresses 20 bugs and introduces measures to prevent unauthorised access to sensitive audio and visual data on iPhones. For Indian users, however, there’s a catch. Apple Intelligence, the AI-driven feature set, is not yet supported in Indian English. To access these features, users will need to switch their device's language to US English or Canadian English. This workaround will remain in place until Apple officially rolls out support for Indian English. To download iOS 18.3, users should ensure their device is backed up, connected to a stable internet connection, and has sufficient battery and storage. The update can be installed by navigating to Settings > General > Software Update and tapping on Download and Install. Once the update process is finished, the device will reboot, and you will be able to use your iPhone after that.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 28, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  Poco M7 Pro 5G review: Strong on the fundamentals
