Headline: Alibaba releases AI model, claims it surpasses DeepSeek-V3On the first day of Chinese New Year, Alibaba released its latest AI model, Qwen 2.5.
Content:
Chinese tech company Alibaba 9988.HK on Wednesday released a new version of its Qwen 2.5 artificial intelligence model that it claimed surpassed the highly-acclaimed DeepSeek-V3. The unusual timing of the Qwen 2.5-Max's release, on the first day of the Lunar New Year when most Chinese people are off work and with their families, points to the pressure Chinese AI startup DeepSeek's meteoric rise in the past three weeks has placed on not just overseas rivals, but also its domestic competition. "Qwen 2.5-Max outperforms almost across the board GPT-4o, DeepSeek-V3 and Llama-3.1-405B," Alibaba's cloud unit said in an announcement posted on its official WeChat account, referring to OpenAI and Meta's most advanced open-source AI models.
 


 The January 10 release of DeepSeek's AI assistant, powered by the DeepSeek-V3 model, as well as the January 20 release of its R1 model, has shocked Silicon Valley and caused tech shares to plunge, with the Chinese startup's purportedly low development and usage costs prompting investors to question huge spending plans by leading AI firms in the United States. But DeepSeek's success has also led to a scramble among its domestic competitors to upgrade their own AI models. Two days after the release of DeepSeek-R1, TikTok owner ByteDance released an update to its flagship AI model, which it claimed outperformed Microsoft-backed OpenAI's o1 in AIME, a benchmark test that measures how well AI models understand and respond to complex instructions.
 


 This echoed DeepSeek's claim that its R1 model rivalled OpenAI's o1 on several performance benchmarks.DeepSeek VS Domestic Competitors The predecessor of DeepSeek's V3 model, DeepSeek-V2, triggered an AI model price war in China after it was released last May. The fact that DeepSeek-V2 was open-source and unprecedentedly cheap, only 1 yuan ($0.14) per 1 million tokens - or units of data processed by the AI model - led to Alibaba's cloud unit announcing price cuts of up to 97 per cent on a range of models. Other Chinese tech companies followed suit, including Baidu 9888.HK, which released China's first equivalent to ChatGPT in March 2023, and the country's most valuable internet company Tencent 0700.HK. Liang Wenfeng, DeepSeek's enigmatic founder, said in a rare interview with Chinese media outlet Waves in July that the startup "did not care" about price wars and that achieving AGI (artificial general intelligence) was its main goal. OpenAI defines AGI as autonomous systems that surpass humans in most economically valuable tasks. While large Chinese tech companies like Alibaba have hundreds of thousands of employees, DeepSeek operates like a research lab, staffed mainly by young graduates and doctorate students from top Chinese universities. Liang said in his July interview that he believed China's largest tech companies might not be well suited to the future of the AI industry, contrasting their high costs and top-down structures with DeepSeek's lean operation and loose management style. "Large foundational models require continued innovation, tech giants' capabilities have their limits," he said.Published By: Unnati GusainPublished On: Jan 29, 2025Also read |  Microsoft investigating if DeepSeek-linked group improperly obtained OpenAI dataAlso read |  OpenAI introduces ChatGPT Gov for US government: How does it workAlso read |  DeepSeek AI: What is it, how it works and is it better than ChatGPT? Everything to knowMust Watch

Headline: Netflix gets a big update, adds full-season download feature on iPhone and iPadsNetflix has finally introduced a feature that is much-requested for its iOS users. If you have an iPhone or an iPad, you will now be able to download complete seasons of your favourite shows at once. No need to download episodes individually any more.
Content: Netflix has rolled out a new feature for iPhone and iPad users, allowing them to download entire seasons of their favourite shows with just one tap. This feature, previously exclusive to Android devices, is a major timesaver for iOS users who previously had to download episodes individually. The new Season Download option can be found next to the Share button on a show’s display page, making it quicker and easier to download content for offline viewing. Of course, this is particularly useful for people who want to enjoy shows or movies during commutes, flights, or trips where internet access might be unreliable. Offline viewing on Netflix was first introduced in 2016, and since then, the company has added features like Smart Downloads, which automatically replaces watched episodes with the next one in the series. The addition of season downloads for iOS devices is another step in making Netflix more accessible and convenient for its global audience. Alongside this update, Netflix also shared a list of its most downloaded seasons of all time. Topping the list are Squid Game Seasons 1 and 2, followed by Monster: The Jeffrey Dahmer Story, One Piece, and Queen Charlotte: A Bridgerton Story.  However, this new feature comes at a time when Netflix has announced price increases in the US. The premium ad-free plan now costs $24.99 per month, while the standard ad-free plan has risen to $17.99. Even the ad-supported tier has seen a hike, now priced at $7.99 per month. Subscribers on ad-free plans can store up to 100 active downloads per device, but those on ad-supported plans are limited to just 15 downloads per month.  Interestingly, the price hikes do not apply to Indian users — at least for now. Netflix continues to offer its four subscription plans in India: Mobile, Basic, Standard, and Premium. The Mobile plan, priced at Rs 149 per month, allows streaming on one device at a time in 480p resolution. The Basic plan, costing Rs 199, supports 720p resolution and one streaming device. For Rs 499, the Standard plan offers 1080p HD resolution and allows two simultaneous streams. Finally, the Premium plan, priced at Rs 649, provides 4K resolution, spatial audio, and supports up to four streaming devices at once. Additionally, content can be downloaded on up to seven devices, making it a popular choice for families. The Netflix full-season download feature on iOS devices is currently live. If you haven’t seen it for yourself, make sure to update the Netflix app by heading over to the App Store.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 30, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  iQOO 13 is available under Rs 40,000, but is it worth buying?

Headline: WhatsApp releases a new update to fix critical privacy bug on iPhonesWhatsApp has fixed a privacy flaw in its View Once feature for iOS, which allowed users to access supposedly disappearing media.
Content: WhatsApp — claimed to be one of the safest messaging platforms available today — has rolled out a critical update to fix a major privacy vulnerability in its View Once feature for iOS. The flaw allowed users to access photos and videos that were supposed to disappear after a single viewing, undermining the feature’s core purpose. The issue was first uncovered by security researcher Ramshath, who detailed the bug in a post on Medium. According to the researcher, the vulnerability allowed anyone to bypass the View Once privacy protection by navigating to the app’s storage settings. By going to Settings > Storage and Data > Manage Storage, locating the sender’s chat, and sorting media by Newest, users could still access the supposedly fleeting content. This completely defeats the feature’s promise of ensuring sensitive media disappear after being viewed once. This isn’t the first time the View Once feature has faced security challenges. Back in September last year, security researcher Tal Be’ery found a way to view and save View Once media on WhatsApp Web, even though the feature was only intended to work on the platform’s Android and iOS apps. That issue was fixed in early December. Late last week, another flaw was documented, allowing recipients of View Once media to view it indefinitely, even after it had been opened and closed within the chat. Staff at Android Police were able to replicate this internally on Thursday, January 23, but the exploit no longer works as of today, suggesting that Meta rolled out a server-side fix over the weekend. The tech giant has yet to publicly acknowledge the vulnerability. WhatsApp’s parent company, Meta, confirmed that a fix was already in the works when the researcher reported the latest issue. While the discovery didn’t qualify for a bug bounty (as Meta was already aware of the problem), the company thanked the researcher for their efforts. The latest update doesn’t just address the privacy flaw — it also introduces several new features. Users can now make calls without saving phone numbers first, and group calling capabilities have been enhanced. These additions aim to improve the overall user experience while maintaining the app’s focus on privacy and security. For iOS users, updating to the latest version is crucial to ensure that the View Once feature works as intended. The update is available through the App Store, and users are encouraged to install it immediately to protect their privacy.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 30, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  iQOO 13 is available under Rs 40,000, but is it worth buying?

Headline: Sensitive DeepSeek data exposed to open internet: Wiz cyber security firmNew York-based cybersecurity firm Wiz says it has found a trove of sensitive data from the Chinese artificial intelligence startup DeepSeek inadvertently exposed to the open internet.
Content: New York-based cybersecurity firm Wiz says it has found a trove of sensitive data from the Chinese artificial intelligence startup DeepSeek inadvertently exposed to the open internet. In a blog post published Wednesday, Wiz said that scans of DeepSeek's infrastructure showed that the company had accidentally left more than a million lines of data available unsecured. Those included digital software keys and chat logs that appeared to capture prompts being sent from users to the company's free AI assistant.  "The exposure includes over a million lines of log streams containing chat history, secret keys, backend details, and other highly sensitive information. The Wiz Research team immediately and responsibly disclosed the issue to DeepSeek, which promptly secured the exposure," the report stated.  Wiz's chief technology officer said DeepSeek quickly secured the data after his firm alerted them. "They took it down in less than an hour," Ami Luttwak said. "But this was so simple to find we believe we're not the only ones who found it." DeepSeek did not immediately return a message seeking comment. The company's practically overnight success following the launch of its AI assistant has thrilled China and sparked anxiety in America. The Chinese company's apparent ability to match OpenAI's capabilities at a much lower cost has posed questions over the sustainability of the business models and profit margins of US AI giants such as Nvidia and Microsoft. By Monday, it had overtaken US rival ChatGPT in downloads from Apple's App Store, triggering a global selloff in tech shares.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 30, 2025

Headline: Mark Zuckerberg says Meta will continue to spend billions on AI despite panic over DeepSeekMeta's CEO Mark Zuckerberg has confirmed that the company will continue to invest heavily in Artificial Intelligence (AI), even after recent market concerns caused by DeepSeek's advances.
Content: Meta's CEO Mark Zuckerberg has confirmed that the company will continue to invest heavily in Artificial Intelligence (AI), even after recent market concerns caused by DeepSeek’s advances. On Monday, Nvidia’s stock fell by nearly 20 per cent as there were fears that DeepSeek's AI models might reduce the demand for graphics processing units (GPUs). However, during Meta’s earnings call on Wednesday, Zuckerberg reassured investors that Meta's plans to invest billions of dollars into AI over the long term remain unchanged. Meta has already planned to spend more than $60 billion in 2025, mainly on building and upgrading data centers to support its AI infrastructure. This move is seen as key to Meta's long-term strategy. When asked if DeepSeek's progress could affect Meta's AI spending, Zuckerberg said the company would keep investing in AI, seeing it as a major advantage, especially since Meta serves billions of users around the world.DeepSeek is a competitor but it is not an immediate threat Zuckerberg seemingly considers DeepSeek a new competitor in the AI space but said it’s too early to know if this will slow down the demand for GPUs. He believes that GPUs will remain important for running AI tasks like data processing. Meta’s massive user base requires strong AI infrastructure to handle the scale of its operations, and Zuckerberg is confident that investing in this area will give Meta a competitive edge. He explained, "At this point, I would bet that the ability to build out that kind of infrastructure is going to be a major advantage for both the quality of the service and being able to serve the scale that we want to."Llama 4: Meta’s next big AI leap which could reduce human jobs A key part of Meta’s AI strategy is the development of its next AI model, Llama 4. Zuckerberg revealed that this model will be designed to compete with top AI models like OpenAI’s ChatGPT. Llama 4 is expected to have advanced features, such as the ability to work on tasks by itself (agent capabilities) and handle multiple types of inputs (multimodal abilities). "Llama 4 is making great progress in training. Llama 4 mini is done with pre-training and our reasoning models and larger model are looking good too," Zuckerberg said. “Our goal with Llama 3 was to make open-source AI models competitive with closed models, and with Llama 4, we want to lead,” Zuckerberg said. He added that Llama 4 could set new standards in the AI world and help Meta become a leader in open-source AI.  Zuckerberg recently talked about his vision for 2025, calling it a key year for AI development. He stated that by 2025, AI at Meta and other tech companies could effectively replace mid-level engineers who currently write code. This would represent a big shift in how tech companies approach software development. "We will get to a point where all the code in our apps and the AI it generates will also be written by AI engineers instead of people engineers," he said. For context, Business Insider reported that mid-level software engineers at Meta currently earn salaries in the mid-six figures — a cost AI could reduce for the company by a big margin.Mark Zuckerberg aims to reach a billion users with Meta AI In addition to its larger AI goals, Meta is also focused on expanding its AI assistant, Meta AI, which Zuckerberg expects will reach over one billion users by the end of the year. Meta’s approach to AI is focused on personalisation, offering users an experience as per to their individual preferences, interests, and culture. Zuckerberg believes this personal touch is what will set Meta apart from its competitors. "We believe that people don’t all want to use the same AI. People want their AI to be personalised to their context, interests, personality, and culture," he said.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 30, 2025

Headline: Nothing Phone 3a Pro tipped to launch on March 4, rear camera design leaksNothing is expected to unveil two new phones — the Phone 3a and 3a Pro — at an event on March 4. The latest leaks and rumours hint at specs, colours, and more.
Content:
It is official — Nothing has announced a launch event for March 4, where the company is expected to launch a new smartphone. However, a new report from Android Headlines reveals that two new phones are on the way: the Nothing Phone 3a and the Nothing Phone 3a Pro. Interestingly, the Pro model won’t carry the ‘Plus’ tag as previously speculated, marking a slight shift in naming conventions. The Nothing Phone 3a is expected to come in two variants — one with 8GB RAM and 128GB storage, and another with 12GB RAM and 256GB storage. The Phone 3a Pro, on the other hand, will be available in a single configuration with 12GB RAM and 256GB storage. Both devices will be offered in two colour options. While black will be common for both, the Phone 3a will also come in white, and the Pro model will feature a grey variant. Recent leaks have shed more light on the Phone 3a’s specifications. It is expected to feature a Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 chipset, paired with a 6.8-inch FHD+ AMOLED display and a 120Hz refresh rate. The phone will likely run on Nothing OS 2.1 based on Android 15. A 5,000mAh battery with 45W wired charging support is also rumoured, alongside the signature Glyph lights. In terms of cameras, the Phone 3a is tipped to sport a triple-camera setup, including a 50-megapixel primary sensor, an 8-megapixel ultra-wide lens, and a 50-megapixel telephoto camera with 2x optical zoom, a first for any Nothing phone. A 32-megapixel front camera is expected for selfies.  An alleged image of the Nothing Phone 3a has also surfaced online, showcasing a horizontally aligned triple-camera setup with a flash positioned above it. However, since the phone is pictured inside a protective case, the Glyph design remains hidden. As with any leak, the authenticity of the source cannot be verified, so it’s wise to take this information with a healthy grain of salt until official details are revealed.

Credits: Via TechiBoy/ X (formerly Twitter)
 Apart from the Nothing Phone 3a, earlier reports suggested that Nothing might launch the flagship Phone 3 alongside the Phone 3a and 3a Plus (now speculated to be Pro) on March 5. However, according to Yogesh Brar on X, the Phone 3 may not debut at the event after all. Instead, the company is expected to unveil three devices, but the third one remains a mystery. If the Nothing Phone 3 doesn’t arrive on March 5, the question arises — what could the third device be, alongside the Phone 3a and 3a Pro? Headline: Amazon fires more employees, says layoffs will help move faster and bring closer to customersAmazon is firing more employees in a fresh round of layoffs. This time, the tech company is eliminating a "small number of roles" in its communications department, as part of its ongoing efforts to streamline operations and reduce costs.
Content: Amazon is firing more employees in a fresh round of layoffs. This time, the tech company is eliminating a "small number of roles" in its communications department, as part of its ongoing efforts to streamline operations and reduce costs. The move is Amazon's part of a broader strategy to cut bureaucracy and improve the company's efficiency, helping teams move faster and get closer to customers. A spokesperson for Amazon, Brad Glasser, confirmed the decision to Bloomberg and said that the company had conducted a recent review of its Communications and Corporate Responsibility organisation. Based on this, Amazon decided to make changes, including the elimination of some roles.  "These decisions are never easy," Glasser stated, "but they are necessary to help us move faster, increase ownership, and strengthen our culture while bringing our teams closer to customers. We are committed to supporting the employees affected during this transition." The layoffs come as Amazon’s CEO, Andy Jassy, continues his efforts to reshape the company following his appointment as CEO in 2021. Since taking over from founder Jeff Bezos, Jassy has overseen a series of job cuts and has scaled back on several ambitious projects that no longer align with Amazon’s core business. This includes thousands of job cuts across the company as part of a wider effort to tighten operations. Amazon’s largest wave of job cuts occurred in 2022, affecting 27,000 corporate roles across different departments. In the time since, the company has carried out smaller, more focused layoffs, targeting specific teams and areas that require downsizing. The communications department is the latest to be affected as Amazon continues to find ways to cut costs and operate more efficiently. In addition to layoffs, Amazon has implemented a return-to-office mandate for its corporate employees, requiring them to work from the office five days a week. Many saw this as a way to encourage voluntary resignations, although Jassy said the move was about implementing Amazon’s corporate culture.  In September, Jassy also directed executives to reorganise their business units by the end of March, focusing on reducing the number of managers relative to individual contributors. The goal is to simplify the management structure, make decision-making quicker, and ensure that teams are more agile in responding to customer needs. While the latest layoffs may raise concerns among employees, Amazon has maintained that it remains committed to helping affected workers through the transition process. Though the company hasn't specified the exact number of employees impacted, it stressed that support will be available for those losing their jobs.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 30, 2025

Headline: OnePlus Nord 4 available for under Rs 20,000, but there is a catchStarting at just Rs 29,999 for the 8GB RAM + 256GB storage variant, the OnePlus Nord 4 already offers great value for money, but what if we told you there's a way to get it for under Rs 20,000?

This brings the effective price of the 8GB + 128GB variant of the OnePlus Nord 4 down to Rs 25,999, and Rs 28,999 for the 12GB RAM variant.advertisement The mid 8GB RAM + 256GB storage variant of the OnePlus Nord 4 is currently listed on Amazon for Rs 29,999, down from its original price of Rs 32,999. If your trade-in qualifies for the maximum value, you’re in for an excellent deal on one of the best value-for-money phones on the market.OnePlus Nord 4: Is it worth buying? Plus, with 100W fast wired charging support, it only takes about 30 minutes for the phone to go from zero to hero. Beyond the core specs, the OnePlus Nord 4 impresses with its premium build quality. The metal-unibody design gives it a premium feel, unlike any other phone in the market, across price segments. The Nord 4 is also the only phone to feature a metal unibody design in the current day and age. OnePlus has also refined its OxygenOS software, providing a clean and user-friendly experience with minimal bloatware. There’s also support for 4 years of Android OS updates along with 6 years of security patches. With its focus on performance, design, and software, the OnePlus Nord 4 offers a well-rounded package that makes it a strong contender in the competitive mid-range smartphone market. For anyone looking to buy a phone with top-tier performance, a unique look, and a price that doesn’t burn a hole in the pocket — the Nord 4 is worth consideration.

Headline: India to develop its own AI model like ChatGPT in 10 months: Ashwini VaishnawIndia is set to take a major leap in Artificial Intelligence (AI) by developing its own large language model (LLM), similar to ChatGPT and DeepSeek. Union Minister of Electronics and IT, Ashwini Vaishnaw, has announced that the AI model will be ready in 10 months.
Content: India is set to take a major leap in Artificial Intelligence (AI) by developing its own large language model (LLM), similar to ChatGPT and DeepSeek. Union Minister of Electronics and IT, Ashwini Vaishnaw, has announced that the AI model will be ready in 10 months, marking a big milestone in the country’s journey towards being self-reliant on AI.  Speaking at the Utkarsh Odisha Conclave, Vaishnaw asserted that the groundwork for the AI model has already been laid. The framework is now ready, and the government’s focus is on building a system that caters to the unique needs of Indian users.  "Over the last 1.5 years, our teams have been working closely with startups, researchers, professors etc.  Today, we are calling for proposals to develop our own foundational model. The model will take care of the Indian context, languages, and culture, are devoid of biases," Vaishnaw told reporters. India’s AI ambitions are backed by a solid infrastructure. The country has surpassed its initial target of securing 10,000 GPUs, now boasting a total of 18,600 GPUs. This advanced computing power will be critical in training the AI model. Most of the GPUs are high-performance NVIDIA H100 and H200, alongside MI325 models. For comparison, while DeepSeek AI was trained on 2,500 GPUs and ChatGPT on 25,000, India now has over 15,000 high-end GPUs, positioning itself strongly in the AI race. Vaishnaw stressed that this infrastructure will play a key role in the country’s AI mission, helping to develop models that can rival global competitors. The government has also introduced a common computing facility, which will be available to AI startups, developers, and researchers. This facility, equipped with 18,000 GPUs, will provide access to advanced computing resources, helping smaller players contribute to AI development without the heavy costs usually associated with such infrastructure. Already, 10,000 GPUs are operational, with more to come online soon. Vaishnaw noted the importance of this facility in democratising AI development. India’s AI model is currently under development, with six major developers working on it. The government expects the first versions to be ready within 4 to 10 months. The model is being designed to handle India’s vast linguistic and cultural diversity. Vaishnaw expressed confidence in the project, stating that advancements in algorithmic efficiency would enable India to produce a world-class AI model in a shorter timeframe.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 30, 2025

Headline: Your UPI transactions could stop working from February 1 for this reasonUPI transaction won't work from Feb 1: NPCI says, all UPI IDs should only contain alphanumeric characters starting February 1, 2025. Any UPI ID that may contain special characters such as @, !, or # will result in transaction failure.
Content: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has announced that special characters will no longer be allowed in UPI IDs starting from February 1, 2025. This decision is part of an effort to ensure that all UPI transactions comply with technical specifications and to improve the overall safety of the digital payments platform. According to a circular issued by NPCI on January 9, the new rule will require all UPI transaction IDs to be strictly alphanumeric. This means that any transaction ID containing special characters such as @, !, or # will be automatically rejected by the system. The NPCI stated that while most participants in the UPI ecosystem have already complied with the technical standards, a few continue to use non-compliant formats. To address this, the corporation has decided to enforce the rule strictly from February 1, 2025. For the millions of Indians who rely on UPI for daily transactions, this change could have some implications. If a user attempts to make a payment through an app that generates transaction IDs with special characters, the transaction will fail. For example, if your phone number is 1234567890, and you have a UPI ID linked with SBI Bank. In that case, a valid ID might look like 1234567890oksbi, while an invalid one could be 1234567890@ok-sbi. The latter, which includes special characters (@ and -), will no longer be accepted after the new rule comes into effect. To avoid transaction failure, users are advised to take a few simple steps. First, they should ensure that their UPI apps are updated to the latest version. App updates often include compliance features and security improvements, so keeping the app up-to-date is crucial. Additionally, users can check their app’s settings or announcements for any notifications regarding compliance with NPCI’s new rules. If users are unsure whether their app is compliant, they can contact the app’s customer support for clarification. It’s also recommended to stick to UPI applications downloaded from trusted sources such as Apple’s App Store or Google’s Play Store, as third-party apps may not always adhere to NPCI guidelines. The decision to ban special characters in UPI IDs is part of a broader effort to standardise and secure the UPI ecosystem. Headline: HP OmniBook Ultra Flip review: A compact yet powerful laptopThe HP OmniBook Ultra Flip is a good fit for multitasking and general usage. It is stylish, practical, and built to keep up with a busy lifestyle. If you can live with its minor quirks and don't need a powerhouse for gaming or video editing, this laptop is a good investment. Read the full review to know more.
Content:
For a lot of people, HP has been a go-to name in the world of computers for as long as I can remember. They have always been good at keeping up with the times, and their latest offering — the HP OmniBook Ultra Flip — is no exception. It's sleek, it's powerful, and it's built for people who are always on the move. But let’s be real — aren't there enough premium ultrabooks on the market that promise the moon? So, does the OmniBook Ultra Flip actually stand out, or is it just another pretty face in the crowd? In this review, I am going to break it down for you. We will talk about the design, because who doesn’t love a good-looking laptop, how long the battery lasts (no sugarcoating here), and whether it is as fun and easy to use as it looks. Spoiler: there is a lot to like, but let’s dive in and see if it’s worth your hard-earned cash.Compact yet practical design, solid build The HP OmniBook Ultra Flip is a stylish laptop designed for people who need a mix of portability and flexibility. Its touchscreen and 360-degree hinge make it easy for users to transform it between a regular laptop, a tablet, and tent mode for presentations or media viewing. The touchscreen is also smooth and responsive. The design is quite practical. The physical keyboard automatically turns off in tablet mode, so you don’t accidentally press keys while holding it. The digital keyboard pops up when needed, making it convenient for tasks like web browsing or social media scrolling. However, the laptop feels a bit heavy in tablet mode, which sometimes makes extended use cumbersome. Another small issue is the auto screen rotate feature, which is always on by default. While useful at times, it gets a bit annoying when the screen shifts unexpectedly. There is no way to turn it off.
 advertisement


Nevertheless, the machine’s 14-inch screen strikes the perfect balance — neither too large nor too small — making it ideal for both work and travel. The metal finish gives it a premium look, and the sturdy hinge allows the lid to be opened with one hand while the laptop stays stable. HP has also taken care of small details, for example the HP logo is minimal and the tiny rubber pads on the keyboard deck help protect the laptop from scratches when used in tablet mode.One downside of the sleek design is the limited selection of ports. HP has positioned two Type-C ports at the top corners of the keyboard, which is a clever design choice. However, with only three Type-C ports and no USB-A ports, connecting older accessories, like a hard drive, becomes inconvenient means you will need an adapter.  While removing the Ethernet port makes sense to keep the laptop slim, I feel one more USB port would have been nice. On the bright side, there is a 3.5mm headphone jack, which is great for those who prefer wired headphones for better sound quality. Overall, the HP OmniBook Ultra Flip is a well-built laptop.Keyboard experience
 


Typing on the HP OmniBook Ultra Flip is a genuinely pleasant experience. The keyboard features well-spaced keys with a comfortable feel, making it easy to get in the flow during long typing sessions. The key travel is just right — enough to give you that satisfying feedback without feeling mushy — and the soft click noise is subtle but satisfying. As someone who is picky about keyboards, I appreciate that I didn’t have to relearn my hand placement. Everything is where it should be, though, like most laptops, the arrow keys are a bit compact. One trade-off here is the lack of a numpad, so keep that in mind if you rely on one.The trackpad is another win. It’s well-sized and perfectly centred, so I never accidentally brushed it while typing and sent my cursor flying. It is responsive, detects gestures smoothly, and offers decent haptic feedback. My only small gripe is that the click could use a bit more depth, but it’s far from a dealbreaker. Add in the backlit keyboard for low-light environments, and you get a setup that is both practical and enjoyable to use. All in all, HP nailed the basics here.advertisementDisplay: Is it good?
 


The HP OmniBook Ultra Flip features a 14-inch 2.8K OLED display, which provides rich colours with good contrast, making it enjoyable for watching videos, browsing, and content creation. The display has a slightly warm tone, which many users will find easy on the eyes, especially during prolonged use. In addition to this, brightness levels are sufficient for indoor use, with a maximum brightness of 387 nits, but it struggles in outdoor settings where reflections hinder visibility.The minimal bezels around the display make the screen feel quite big, improving the overall viewing experience. Despite its compact form factor, the display allows for a good amount of content to be visible, which is especially useful for media consumption. Interestingly, the display defaults to a 120Hz refresh rate, rather than the typical 60Hz, and even supports 48Hz as an option. The higher refresh rate support makes scrolling and navigation smooth.advertisementSolid performance?
 


The HP OmniBook Ultra Flip is a workhorse when it comes to handling everyday tasks, and it’s all thanks to its solid hardware. With an Intel Core Ultra 7 258V (Lunar Lake) processor, 32GB of speedy LPDDR5X RAM, and a spacious 1TB PCIe Gen4 NVMe M.2 SSD, this laptop doesn’t break a sweat during routine use. Over three weeks of testing, I pushed it with a mix of 50 Chrome tabs, Microsoft Teams, Copilot, and Notepad running simultaneously — and there were no hiccups. That said, while it’s a champ for productivity, it’s not designed for heavy-duty creative work or gaming. The integrated Intel Arc 140V graphics are fine for casual gaming or light content creation, but if you’re into video editing or playing the latest AAA titles, you’ll want something with a dedicated GPU.Where this laptop really shines is battery life. During my testing, which included writing, and lots of that, streaming YouTube, and some light photo editing, it consistently delivered around 9 hours of screen-on time. On lighter days, I even managed to stretch it to almost a day and a half on a single charge. That’s a big win for anyone who’s constantly on the go and doesn’t want to be tethered to an outlet.advertisementBenchmark results tell a similar story. The OmniBook Ultra Flip scored 11,100 in Geekbench 6’s multi-core test and 560 on Cinebench 2024, putting it in the same league as the MacBook Air M3 and Intel-powered HP Spectre x360. For most people, this level of performance is more than enough.Camera and speakers
 


The HP OmniBook Ultra Flip includes a camera cap, which is a thoughtful addition for privacy-conscious users, allowing them to easily cover the camera when not in use. However, the camera quality itself leaves much to be desired. During video calls, the camera struggles with noise. It renders oversaturated colours and average details, particularly in low-light or backlit environments.On a positive note, the speakers on this laptop are quite impressive. They are loud and clear, providing a good sound experience for content consumption. Dialogue delivery is crisp and clear, making it easier to follow conversations in movies or shows. Overall, whether you are watching a movie or listening to a podcast, the speakers offer a satisfying performance.HP OmniBook Ultra Flip review: Is it worth buying?
 


Well, if you are looking for a portable laptop that handles everyday tasks with ease, the answer is a resounding yes. You get a premium design, a vibrant OLED display, and a keyboard that is a joy to type on. The performance is more than enough for multitasking. You can do light photo editing and casual gaming. The battery life is also impressive, easily lasting through a full workday. It is a reliable machine for productivity and this laptop checks most of the boxes in this case.That said, it is not perfect. First of all, it is pricey. In India, its price starts from Rs 1,81,999. That’s expensive for a laptop like this. The lack of USB-A ports might be a hassle if you are still using older peripherals, and the camera quality is underwhelming, especially for video calls. While the touchscreen and 360-degree hinge add versatility, the weight makes it less comfortable to use in tablet mode for long periods. And if you are into pre-level video editing or gaming, the integrated graphics might not cut it — you will want to look elsewhere.But for multitasking and general usage, the HP OmniBook Ultra Flip is a good fit. It is stylish, practical, and built to keep up with a busy lifestyle. If you can live with its minor quirks and don’t need a powerhouse for gaming or video editing, this laptop is a good investment.

However, the camera quality itself leaves much to be desired. During video calls, the camera struggles with noise. It renders oversaturated colours and average details, particularly in low-light or backlit environments. On a positive note, the speakers on this laptop are quite impressive. They are loud and clear, providing a good sound experience for content consumption. Dialogue delivery is crisp and clear, making it easier to follow conversations in movies or shows. Overall, whether you are watching a movie or listening to a podcast, the speakers offer a satisfying performance.HP OmniBook Ultra Flip review: Is it worth buying?
 


 Well, if you are looking for a portable laptop that handles everyday tasks with ease, the answer is a resounding yes. You get a premium design, a vibrant OLED display, and a keyboard that is a joy to type on. The performance is more than enough for multitasking. You can do light photo editing and casual gaming. The battery life is also impressive, easily lasting through a full workday. It is a reliable machine for productivity and this laptop checks most of the boxes in this case. That said, it is not perfect. First of all, it is pricey. In India, its price starts from Rs 1,81,999. That’s expensive for a laptop like this. The lack of USB-A ports might be a hassle if you are still using older peripherals, and the camera quality is underwhelming, especially for video calls. While the touchscreen and 360-degree hinge add versatility, the weight makes it less comfortable to use in tablet mode for long periods. And if you are into pre-level video editing or gaming, the integrated graphics might not cut it — you will want to look elsewhere. But for multitasking and general usage, the HP OmniBook Ultra Flip is a good fit. It is stylish, practical, and built to keep up with a busy lifestyle. If you can live with its minor quirks and don’t need a powerhouse for gaming or video editing, this laptop is a good investment.
Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 30, 2025

Headline: Pixel 9a launch date and price details leaked onlineGoogle Pixel 9a launch date: Google Pixel 9a launchThe exact release date of the Google Pixel 9a has leaked online, and going by the rumours, the phone will be coming earlier than expected. Apart from this, the US pricing details of the phone have also been leaked online.
Content: The Google Pixel 9a has been in the headlines recently, and now, new details about its launch date, pricing, and specifications have surfaced online. According to recent leaks, the device is set to hit the market earlier than expected, with pre-orders starting on March 19 and shipping beginning on March 26. If the rumours are true, then the Pixel 9a will arrive two months earlier than past Pixel A series devices. For context, both the Pixel 7a and 8a launched in May in their respective years. According to a report by Android Headlines, in terms of pricing, the Pixel 9a will start in the US at $499 (roughly Rs 43,200) for the 128GB storage option, while the 256GB storage will cost $599 (roughly Rs 51,900). For those opting for Verizon’s mmWave model, an additional $50 will be added to the aforementioned prices. These prices are in line with the Pixel 8a’s starting price in the USA, though the higher storage option is slightly more expensive this time around.  Of course, the Pixel 9a price should be different once it launches in India. For perspective, the Google Pixel 8a launched in India for Rs 52,999 and Rs 59,999 for the 128GB and 256GB storage variants respectively. Apart from the prices, an earlier report gave us a good idea of what to expect from the Pixel 9a. One of the most talked-about features of the phone is its design. The phone will reportedly ditch the camera bar seen in previous models, opting instead for a flush back design. This change is likely due to the inclusion of a larger 5,100mAh battery, the biggest ever in a Pixel device. Despite the increased battery size, the phone should remain compact, with a 6.28-inch display featuring a peak brightness of 2,700 nits and an HDR brightness of 1,800 nits. The display is also expected to support a 120Hz refresh rate and a 240Hz touch sampling rate. Under the hood, the Pixel 9a is rumoured to be powered by Google’s Tensor G4 chipset, paired with 8GB LPDDR5X RAM. Storage options include 128GB and 256GB, both using UFS 3.1 technology. The phone will also run Android 15 out of the box and will likely come with a promise of seven years of software and security updates, making it a future-proof choice for users. As for the camera, the Pixel 9a is expected to feature a dual-camera setup, with a 48-megapixel primary sensor and a 13-megapixel ultra-wide lens. The front-facing camera will also use the same 13-megapixel sensor. Expect to see Google’s signature camera features, such as Night Sight, Astrophotography, and Super Res Zoom. Despite its impressive specs, the Pixel 9a might have a few limitations, similar to the Pixel 8a. Rumours suggest, for instance, that charging speeds will only support 23W in wired and 7.5W in wireless. The Pixel 9a is expected to launch in four colours: Obsidian, Porcelain, Iris, and Peony.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 30, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  iQOO 13 is available under Rs 40,000, but is it worth buying?

Headline: US lawmakers push for restrictions on Nvidia chips amid China's DeepSeek AI developmentsTwo US lawmakers are urging tighter export controls on Nvidia's AI chips, fearing China's growing AI capabilities. Their concerns stem from reports that a Chinese firm used these chips — currently outside the scope of U.S. export controls — extensively.
Content: Two US lawmakers have called on the government to tighten restrictions on Nvidia’s AI chips, expressing concerns over China’s growing artificial intelligence capabilities. Their request follows reports that Chinese AI firm DeepSeek has relied on Nvidia’s hardware to build its latest AI models. According to a Reuters report, Republican John Moolenaar and Democrat Raja Krishnamoorthi, who lead the House Select Committee on China, sent a letter to National Security Adviser Michael Waltz, urging the Biden administration to consider additional export controls. The lawmakers pointed out that Nvidia’s H20 chip, which is currently not covered by US export restrictions, was allegedly used extensively by DeepSeek. “We ask that as part of this review, you consider the potential national security benefits of placing an export control on Nvidia’s H20 and chips of similar sophistication,” they wrote. The concern in Washington is that China could use AI technology for cyberattacks or military advancements. The US has already imposed strict limits on AI chip exports to China, fearing that advanced computing power could give the country an edge in AI development. The questions were raised after DeepSeek unveiled its AI model, which the company claims was developed using relatively low-cost chips while maintaining strong performance. The model’s efficiency surprised many in the tech industry, raising concerns that China might be finding ways to bypass US-imposed restrictions. Despite existing controls, Nvidia designed certain chips, like the H20, to comply with current regulations while still being exportable to China. The lawmakers argue that these rules may need to be revisited.  Another issue raised in the letter is the concern that AI systems built in China could be subject to state censorship. Users have noted that by redirecting conversations elsewhere, DeepSeek’s model avoids discussing sensitive topics, such as the Tiananmen Square massacre. The lawmakers also flagged concerns over chip shipments to Singapore, suggesting that AI hardware may be getting re-routed to China through third-party countries. They urged the administration to monitor and potentially limit such exports unless stricter enforcement measures are adopted. Nvidia has stated that its products comply with all US government regulations. The company also reaffirmed its willingness to work with the government if further changes are made to AI chip export rules. On Wednesday (January 30), Reuters reported that the Trump administration, which took office on January 20, is considering new restrictions on H20 chips.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 31, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  iQOO 13 is available under Rs 40,000, but is it worth buying?

Headline: Google unveils Ask for Me, a new AI feature that can make calls on your behalfGoogle is currently working on a new AI feature, called Ask for me. It is trained to call local businesses to enquire and collect information, like availability and pricing.
Content:
Google is testing an Ask for Me feature to boost its AI base. This AI-powered feature will help users call businesses on their behalf to enquire about availability and pricing. The feature is designed to help users gather information without the need to directly make phone calls or speak to anyone. This feature is a step-ahead of OpenAI’s Operator.   Google’s Ask for Me feature is available on both desktop and mobile, but only for users who have opted into its Search Lab experiments.  In a post on X, Google product lead Rose Yao explained that the feature is powered by Duplex, an AI tool that enables tasks like making reservations or booking appointments over the phone. Currently, Google is only experimenting with auto shops and nail salons. Yao also said, “You might hit a waitlist, since the capacity is limited during the experiment.” 
 


Google’s Ask for Me: How does it work?  If you're enrolled in Search Labs, you can access the new feature by searching for local services like "oil change" or "nail salons nearby." An "Ask for me" option will appear, along with a "Get started" button. Once clicked, you'll be asked to provide details about the service, such as “tire replacement,” “factory scheduled maintenance,” “french manicure,” “nail art,” and more. You can also specify a preferred time frame. Google's AI will then make calls to local businesses on your behalf and send you a summary of prices and availability. This launch is part of Google’s broader effort to help users save time when reaching out to businesses using AI. Last year, the company introduced the “Talk to a Live Rep” feature, which calls a business, waits on hold, and notifies you when a live representative is available, eliminating the frustrating wait for customer service. Is it a competition for OpenAI’s Operator?  OpenAI has recently rolled out its new AI tool, Operator. It aims to perform tasks on your behalf on the web. The company explains, “using its own browser, it can look at a webpage and interact with it by typing, clicking, and scrolling.” Interestingly, this is OpenAI’s first AI agent that can independently perform tasks.  Now, both OpenAI’s Operator and Google’s Ask for Me work as a middleman and aim to minimise tasks for the users. However, the main difference is that one chats with you and works on the web, while the other calls directly.  Why is OpenAI ahead? Because the Operator is already out to use, whereas the Ask for Me is yet to come out of its experimenting phase. Headline: Apple Intelligence is soon coming to India, CEO Tim Cook confirmsApple CEO Tim Cook announced that Apple Intelligence, the company's AI-powered suite, will launch in India this April. The expansion includes localised English and other languages, marking a big step in Apple's global AI rollout.
Content: Apple CEO Tim Cook has confirmed that the company’s AI-powered suite, Apple Intelligence, will finally make its way to India starting in April, later this year. This is a big move in regard to Apple’s AI capabilities on its devices in the country, which were previously limited to a handful of features like the Clean Up tool. During Apple’s latest earnings call, Cook revealed that the rollout will include support for multiple languages, including localised English tailored for Indian users. This means iPhone, iPad, and Mac users in India will soon have access to AI-driven tools such as Writing Tools, Smart Reply, and ChatGPT integration. Cook also highlighted Apple’s growing focus on India, which has become a key market for the Cupertino-based tech giant. He shared that the company achieved record iPhone sales in the country during the December quarter, with the iPhone emerging as the top-selling model for the period. India’s position as the world’s second-largest smartphone market and third-largest for PCs and tablets makes it a critical region for Apple’s growth. To further strengthen its presence, Apple has announced plans to open four new stores in the country, adding to its existing retail footprint. The introduction of Apple Intelligence in India is part of a broader global expansion. Cook mentioned that the AI suite will also be made available in other languages, including French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, Japanese, Korean, and Simplified Chinese. Localised English versions will also be rolled out in Singapore alongside India.  Apple’s new CFO, Kevan Parekh, also emphasised the company’s strong performance in emerging markets, citing India as a prime example. He pointed to Zomato, a leading food delivery platform in India, which has deployed thousands of Macs across its workforce to drive innovation.  For the unaware, Apple Intelligence is only eligible for the iPhone 16 series and iPhone 15 Pro models. As mentioned above, the company's AI features aren't available for Indian users right now. However, to still access the AI features on your eligible iPhones, you need to change your default regional setting to one of the languages that support Apple Intelligence. To change your settings, go to Settings > General > Language & Region and select English (US) or any language that supports Apple Intelligence as your device’s primary language. This setting configures your device to recognise the language required for Apple Intelligence.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 31, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  iQOO 13 is available under Rs 40,000, but is it worth buying?

Headline: DeepSeek is no longer available to download in Italy: ReportDeepSeek unavailable in Italy: DeepSeek's AI chatbot has been removed from Italy's app stores amid data privacy concerns. Authorities question its data storage practices, while security fears grow over its potential links to Chinese servers.
Content: China-based AI startup DeepSeek is facing scrutiny in Europe after its chatbot app vanished from the App Store and Play Store in Italy. The removal comes just a day after Italy’s data protection authority (DPA) raised concerns over how the company collects and stores user data. The issue began when Euroconsumers, a consumer rights group, filed a complaint against DeepSeek, questioning its handling of personal data. In response, the Italian watchdog asked DeepSeek to provide details about its data storage practices and gave the company 20 days to respond. However, officials say DeepSeek’s initial reply was completely insufficient, prompting them to take immediate action by restricting the company from processing data from Italian users. The core concern is that DeepSeek’s privacy policy states that user data may be stored on servers located in China. While the company claims that it follows all applicable data protection laws, authorities worry about potential risks related to cybersecurity, privacy, and disinformation. The Italian watchdog isn’t alone in its concerns — other privacy regulators across the European Union have reminded companies that they must comply with the region’s strict AI and data protection laws. DeepSeek’s chatbot has been rising quickly in popularity, topping download charts in several countries, including the US. However, the privacy concerns surrounding the app have raised questions about how AI companies handle user data and whether their models are developed ethically. One of the concerns is that DeepSeek’s AI models may have learnt from leading US models like OpenAI’s ChatGPT. This practice, known as distillation, involves a newer AI model learning from an older, more established one. While OpenAI has stated that Chinese companies often try to extract insights from US-developed AI, blocking this process is difficult because it is hard to detect among millions of data requests. Security concerns around DeepSeek have also caught the attention of the US government. The US Navy has already advised its personnel against using the chatbot for work or personal use, citing ethical and security risks. Additionally, US officials have said they are assessing whether the app poses any national security threats. Despite the app’s removal from Italian stores, users who still want to access DeepSeek’s AI model can do so in other ways. Since DeepSeek has made its AI open-source, people can download and run it locally on their computers. Others can access the chatbot through platforms like Perplexity, which hosts the model on servers located outside China. Perplexity’s CEO, Aravind Srinivas, has claimed that their version of DeepSeek’s AI does not have censorship restrictions.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 31, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  iQOO 13 is available under Rs 40,000, but is it worth buying?

Headline: Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge camera specs leaked onlineThe Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge — teased at the Galaxy Unpacked event — is rumoured to feature a 200-megapixel primary rear camera and Gorilla Glass Victus 2 display protection, with a potential April 2025 launch.
Content:
Samsung officially teased its upcoming Galaxy S25 Edge at the Galaxy Unpacked event, hinting at a sleek addition to its flagship Galaxy S25 lineup. While the company has kept most details under wraps, leaks and rumours have started to give us a clear idea of what to expect from this slim phone. One of the most talked-about features — which was also noticeable when the first teaser dropped after the Galaxy Unpacked event — is the dual-rear camera setup, instead of the speculated three-lens rear camera setup on the Galaxy S25 and S25+.  According to an X (formerly Twitter) user, the Galaxy S25 Edge could come with a massive 200-megapixel primary camera, paired with a 12-megapixel ultra-wide lens. This puts it in line with the Galaxy S25 Ultra, which also features a 200-megapixel main sensor, though the Ultra steps up with a new 50-megapixel ultra-wide shooter. In comparison, the standard Galaxy S25 and S25+ feature a 50-megapixel primary camera and a 12-megapixel ultra-wide sensor.

 



Credits: PandaFlash/ X (formerly Twitter)
 Another highlight of the leak is the display protection. The Galaxy S25 Edge is rumoured to sport Gorilla Glass Victus 2 on the front, the same as the vanilla Galaxy S25. So, no Gorilla Glass Armor 2 like the Galaxy S25 Ultra model, which also means no anti-reflective properties for the Galaxy S25 Edge's display.  In terms of specs, the Galaxy S25 Edge is expected to feature a 6.7-inch flat AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. Under the hood, the phone is likely to be powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite for Galaxy chipset, ensuring top-tier performance. Samsung is reportedly aiming for a slim design, with the phone said to be just 6.4mm thick. However, this slim profile might come at the cost of battery capacity, as the S25 Edge is rumoured to pack a 3,900mAh battery. Charging speeds are expected to cap at 25W, which might feel a bit underwhelming compared to some competitors. Speaking of competition, Samsung isn’t the only one working on thin phones. Apple is rumoured to be developing an iPhone 17 Air, which could be about 6mm thick and feature a 48-megapixel primary rear camera.  The Galaxy S25 Edge is expected to launch in April 2025, with availability in 39 countries, including India. Headline: First they took shots at DeepSeek, now big American companies are rushing to use itSeveral American tech companies, which initially criticised the Chinese AI model DeepSeek R1, are now rushing to use it. Here is everything to know.
Content: Several American tech companies, which initially criticised the Chinese AI model DeepSeek R1, are now rushing to use it. This shift has seen major players like Microsoft, Amazon, Perplexity, and Dell integrate the DeepSeek AI into their services as they have now recognised its cost-effectiveness and high-performance output, despite earlier concerns around data privacy and censorship.advertisementDeepSeek AI: From criticism to adoptionWhen DeepSeek R1 first entered the market, it was met with strong criticism from US tech firms and government entities. While some tech companies (like Meta and OpenAI) were shocked to see DeepSeek's potential for offering top-notch performance comparable to OpenAI's ChatGPT without using much of resources and operating at lower costs, concerns were also there about data security and potential misuse by the Chinese government. Some experts drew parallels with the controversy surrounding TikTok, suggesting that DeepSeek might expose user data to the Chinese government. Furthermore, early tests of the AI model showed that it avoided politically sensitive topics, raising suspicions about censorship and control from the Chinese Communist Party. When DeepSeek R1 first entered the market, it was met with strong criticism from US tech firms and government entities. While some tech companies (like Meta and OpenAI) were shocked to see DeepSeek's potential for offering top-notch performance comparable to OpenAI's ChatGPT without using much of resources and operating at lower costs, concerns were also there about data security and potential misuse by the Chinese government.  Some experts drew parallels with the controversy surrounding TikTok, suggesting that DeepSeek might expose user data to the Chinese government. Furthermore, early tests of the AI model showed that it avoided politically sensitive topics, raising suspicions about censorship and control from the Chinese Communist Party. For example, DeepSeek’s chatbot reportedly refused to discuss events like the Tiananmen Square Massacre or the treatment of Uyghur Muslims and even took a pro-China stance on Taiwan’s independence. These issues fueled concerns in the US about adopting Chinese technology that could be influenced by government oversight. The US Navy also banned the use of DeepSeek because of data privacy concerns. Some American tech companies are now rushing to use DeepSeek R1 AI Despite these concerns, the practical advantages of DeepSeek R1 have made it hard to ignore. The model delivers a similar performance to more expensive AI models, such as OpenAI’s GPT-4, but at a fraction of the cost. This has prompted tech giants like Microsoft, Amazon, and Dell to reconsider their stance. Microsoft was one of the first companies to integrate DeepSeek R1, making it available through its Azure AI Foundry and GitHub. The decision came after Microsoft conducted thorough evaluations of the model, ensuring that it met safety and security standards. The company now offers the model as part of its broader AI solutions for enterprise customers. Perplexity, an AI-powered search engine, also integrated the Chinese AI DeepSeek R1 model into its Pro subscription service, alongside other top models like OpenAI’s GPT-4 and Anthropic’s Claude-3.5. Initially, US firms, including Perplexity, raised concerns about DeepSeek's data security and censorship. However, after evaluating its cost-effective performance, Perplexity adopted a customised version of DeepSeek R1 that reduces censorship issues.  Amazon followed suit, announcing that DeepSeek R1 is now supported on Amazon Bedrock and SageMaker AI. Amazon’s CEO, Andy Jassy, confirmed that the model’s affordability and efficiency were key reasons for its inclusion. Jassy noted that integrating DeepSeek allows businesses to build AI-driven solutions with minimal infrastructure, which has become increasingly important in the competitive AI landscape. Dell also joined the ranks, enabling DeepSeek to be used on its platforms in partnership with Hugging Face, further showing how the AI model is becoming a part of the American tech ecosystem.Why DeepSeek is being hailed as a king in the AI world One of the primary reasons for DeepSeek’s growing popularity is its ability to offer high performance while requiring fewer resources than its American counterparts. Reports suggest that DeepSeek was developed with just 2,000 GPUs and a budget of $6 million — much less than the billions often needed to develop US-based AI models. This makes it a cost-effective alternative for companies that want to implement AI without incurring substantial costs. As competition in the AI sector is increasing, US tech companies have found that partnering with or adopting DeepSeek’s AI models helps them stay competitive while keeping costs under control. Its efficiency also enables companies to offer advanced AI solutions to their customers without requiring heavy investments in infrastructure.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 31, 2025

Headline: After Pixel-Android merger, Google offers voluntary exits to employeesGoogle has recently offered a 'voluntary exit' program to its US employees. This program is exclusive to the employees working in the Platform & Devices department.
Content: After Google merged Pixel hardware and Android software teams in April 2024, the company announced a voluntary exit program. According to a 9to5Google report, Google has sent a memo to employees working in the Platforms & Devices department. The memo stated that in the voluntary exit program, whoever wants to step down from their role, can do so with a guaranteed severance. The memo was sent via SVP Rick Osterloh, as per the report.  The memo stated, "This comes after we brought two large organizations together last year." He added, "There’s tremendous momentum in this team and with so much important work ahead, we want everyone to be deeply committed to our mission and focused on building great products, with speed and efficiency.” Voluntary buyouts are sometimes a sign that layoffs could follow if too few employees accept Google's offer to leave. The voluntary exit program also follows a petition signed by over 1,250 Google workers from the US and Canada regions. According to a CNBC report, Google employees have signed an internal petition for job security. The petition highlights employees' growing concerns over job security following multiple rounds of layoffs since 2023. Many are left questioning the justification for these dismissals, particularly given the company's solid financial position. Google has been making headlines for its layoffs world-wide, but this program is not a company-wide offer. This program is available to US employees within the Platforms & Devices division, covering teams working on Android (Auto, TV, Wear OS, XR), Chrome, ChromeOS, Google Photos, Google One, Pixel, Fitbit, and Nest. While Google has a global workforce dedicated to these products, this announcement applies only to employees in the United States.  In December 2024, the company was in the headlines for announcing a 10 per cent job cut as part of its efficiency drive. It was reported that these lay-offs are done to streamline operations and improve efficiency. The voluntary exit program could also be part of the drive. After the merger in April, Alphabet’s Chief Financial Officer, Anat Ashkenazi, emphasised her focus on cost efficiencies across the company. During her first earnings call as CFO, she acknowledged the groundwork laid by Ruth Porat, Sundar Pichai, and the leadership team in restructuring the company’s cost base. However, she noted that there’s always room for further optimisation, stating, “Any organization can always push a little further, and I’ll be looking at additional opportunities.” These cost-cutting efforts are, in part, aimed at balancing the company’s heavy investment in AI. These changes highlight Google's efforts to streamline operations amid increasing competition, particularly from AI-driven companies like OpenAI, which are challenging its dominance in the search market.Published By: Unnati GusainPublished On: Jan 31, 2025Also read |  Google unveils Ask for Me, a new AI feature that can make calls to local businesses on your behalfAlso read |  US lawmakers push for restrictions on Nvidia chips amid China's DeepSeek AI developmentsAlso read |  Amazon fires more employees, says layoffs will help company move fasterMust Watch

Headline: Microsoft starts firing underperformers, employees claim company is not giving compensationMicrosoft has reportedly begun performance-based layoffs, with employees receiving termination notices due to not meeting the company's job performance standards.
Content: Microsoft has reportedly begun performance-based layoffs, with employees receiving termination notices due to not meeting the company’s job performance standards. According to Business Insider, employees affected by these cuts will see their healthcare benefits end immediately. In some cases, there has been no mention of severance pay, raising concerns about the company’s approach. The report mentions that at least three employees have claimed they were informed by the company that they would not receive any compensation. The termination letters state that the employees' access to Microsoft's systems and offices would be revoked immediately, and they would not be allowed to perform any further work. The letters also indicate that if these employees reapply to Microsoft in the future, their previous performance and the reason for termination will be considered. "The reason(s) for the termination of your employment include your job performance has not met minimum performance standards and expectations for your position. You are relieved of all job duties effective immediately and your access to Microsoft systems, accounts, and buildings will be removed effective today. You are not to perform any further work on behalf of Microsoft," the letter stated. Sources close to the situation have revealed that this move is part of Microsoft’s more stringent performance management policy, where even senior employees at high levels are being reviewed. Despite the job cuts, Microsoft has said that many of the roles will likely be filled again, meaning there may not be a big reduction in overall headcount. As of June, Microsoft had about 228,000 full-time employees. A spokesperson for Microsoft said, "At Microsoft, we focus on high-performing talent. We are always working on helping people learn and grow. When people are not performing, we take the appropriate action." Additionally, Microsoft has been implementing layoffs across various departments, including Security, Devices, Sales, and Gaming. These layoffs, however, are separate from the performance-related job cuts.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 31, 2025

Headline: Samsung Galaxy S25 series up for pre-orders in India: Which one should you buy?Galaxy S25 series pre-order India: The Samsung Galaxy S25 series, including the Galaxy S25, S25+, and S25 Ultra are up for pre-orders in India. But, the main question is — which model should you buy? Here's everything you need to know including the pre-order, offers and availability details.
Content: The Samsung Galaxy S25 series, including the Galaxy S25, S25+, and S25 Ultra, was recently launched at Galaxy Unpacked in San Jose, California. While there’s a lot of excitement around these phones, there’s still no solid information about the rumoured Galaxy S25 Edge, except for a brief teaser after the Galaxy Unpacked event. However, the three main models are here, and if you’re planning to buy one, there are some great pre-order deals you can take advantage of.advertisementSamsung Galaxy S25 series: Pre-order details and availabilityThe Samsung Galaxy S25 series is already up for pre-orders across major online and offline retailers, as well as Samsung’s official India website. The phones will go on sale starting February 7, 2025.All three models in the Galaxy S25 series are powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset and come with 12GB of RAM as standard across all variants. The Samsung Galaxy S25 series is already up for pre-orders across major online and offline retailers, as well as Samsung’s official India website. The phones will go on sale starting February 7, 2025. All three models in the Galaxy S25 series are powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset and come with 12GB of RAM as standard across all variants. Samsung Galaxy S25: The vanilla model starts at Rs 80,999 for the 256GB storage option, while the 512GB variant is priced at Rs 92,999. It comes in colours like Icy Blue, Silver Shadow, Navy, and Mint. If you buy it from Samsung’s website, you can also choose from Blue Black, Coral Red, and Pink Gold. Pre-order benefits include a Rs 11,000 upgrade bonus for trading in an older device. HDFC Bank credit card users can get an instant discount of Rs 10,000 on full payment or Rs 7,000 off on EMI payments, along with a 9-month no-cost EMI plan. Samsung Galaxy S25+: This model starts at Rs 99,999 for the 256GB variant, while the 512GB option costs Rs 1,11,999. It’s available in Navy and Silver Shadow, but Samsung’s website offers additional colours like Blue Black, Coral Red, and Pink Gold. Pre-order benefits include an Rs 11,000 upgrade bonus, a Rs 7,000 cashback offer, and a 9-month no-cost EMI plan. There’s also a storage upgrade offer where you can get the 512GB variant for the price of the 256GB model, saving you Rs 12,000 in the process. Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra: The top-tier model is priced at Rs 1,29,999 for the 256GB variant, Rs 1,49,999 for the 512GB option, and Rs 1,65,999 for the 1TB version. It comes in Titanium Silver Blue, Titanium Gray, Titanium White, and Titanium Black. Samsung’s website offers additional colours, like Titanium Jade Green, Titanium Jet Black, and Titanium Pink Gold. Pre-order benefits include a Rs 9,000 upgrade bonus, a Rs 8,000 instant discount for HDFC Bank credit card users, and a Rs 7,000 cashback offer with a 9-month no-cost EMI plan. The storage upgrade offer applies only to the 512GB variant, letting you get it for the price of the 256GB model. However, the 1TB variant doesn’t qualify for this offer. Additionally, both the Galaxy S25 and S25+ are available with 24-month no-cost EMI plans through leading NBFCs.Samsung Galaxy S25 Series: Which one should you buy? Each model in the Galaxy S25 series has its own strengths, so your choice will depend on your preferences for size, features, and budget. Still, let us help you give a clearer picture. Samsung Galaxy S25: This is the best choice if you prefer smaller phones that are easy to use with one hand. It has a 6.2-inch screen, just like the Galaxy S24, but it’s slimmer with thinner bezels. It comes with 12GB RAM, which is a first for the standard Galaxy S model, and starts with 256GB of storage, with an option to upgrade to 512GB. The battery is 4,000mAh, and in my testing, it lasts a full day with moderate use, ending the day with around 10% battery left. It’s protected by Gorilla Glass Victus 2 on both the front and back, with an aluminium frame for durability. Samsung Galaxy S25+: This model is similar to the Galaxy S25 but has a larger 6.7-inch display. It’s a great option if you want a bigger screen but don’t need the Ultra. The battery is 4,900mAh, the same as last year’s model, and it should easily last a full day and into the next morning. It also has 12GB RAM and a choice between 256GB and 512GB of storage. The camera setup is the same as the vanilla S25: a 50-megapixel main camera, a 12-megapixel ultra-wide lens, and a 10-megapixel telephoto lens with 3X optical zoom. There’s also a 12-megapixel selfie camera on the front. Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra: This is the biggest and most advanced model in the series, with a 6.9-inch display. It’s the only model that comes with a built-in S Pen stylus, making it ideal for those who like to draw or sign documents on their phone. The design has been upgraded, and it’s now slimmer and lighter than last year’s S24 Ultra. It features a titanium build and Corning’s Gorilla Armor 2, which is said to be the most scratch-resistant glass yet. The battery is 5,000mAh, and in our ongoing testing, it lasts a full day on a single charge. It has 12GB RAM and starts with 256GB storage, with options to upgrade to 512GB or 1TB. The camera setup includes a new 50-megapixel ultra-wide lens, a 200-megapixel main camera, a 10-megapixel telephoto lens with 3X optical zoom, and a 50-megapixel periscope telephoto lens with 5X optical zoom.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Jan 31, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  iQOO 13 is available under Rs 40,000, but is it worth buying?

Headline: Want to build ChatGPT in India? Govt calls for LLM proposals, reveals 18000-GPU cluster for trainingIndia is taking a big step in the AI sector with the government inviting proposals for the development of large language models (LLMs) and multimodal AI systems under the India AI Mission. This initiative aims to promote homegrown AI solutions to meet India's unique challenges while adhering to global standards.
Content: India is taking a big step in the AI sector with the government inviting proposals for the development of large language models (LLMs) and multimodal AI systems under the India AI Mission. This initiative aims to promote homegrown AI solutions to meet India's unique challenges while adhering to global standards. The government wants to create generative AI models comparable to global systems like ChatGPT. Proposals are being accepted until six months from the call's announcement or until enough submissions have been selected. Evaluations will occur monthly, with reviews carried out by experts from IndiaAI for proposals submitted by the 15th of each month. The government has outlined a specific format for submissions, requiring an executive summary, project plan, team details, use case development, ethical compliance, and a financial assessment. Shortlisted candidates will be invited to present, and successful projects will receive funding. Union Minister for Electronics and IT, Ashwini Vaishnaw, revealed that India has surpassed its goal of 10,000 GPUs by setting up 18,000 GPUs as part of the Common Compute Facility. He revealed that this infrastructure would act as a foundation for developing advanced AI solutions. Speaking at the Odisha Utkarsh summit, Vaishnaw announced that India would soon have its own LLM, supported by the new computing facility. The minister explained that AI holds the potential to address major challenges in sectors like agriculture, learning disabilities, and climate change. As part of the mission, the government will engage with startups, IT companies, academic institutions, and researchers to create foundational AI models. Vaishnaw mentioned that the first round of funding has already been approved for 18 applications, with more expected in the future. This effort positions India to catch up with global developments in AI, especially following China's success with its AI model DeepSeek, which has drawn comparisons to OpenAI's ChatGPT. By launching a domestic AI model, India is likely aiming to establish itself as a key player in the AI space. For your reference, proposals need to be submitted to tenders@indiaai.gov.in and for more details on this IndiaAI mission proposal, one can visit the government's official indiaai.gov.in website.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Jan 31, 2025
