Headline: OpenAI announces o3-mini model, expands free access to ChatGPT usersOpenAI has launched o3-mini, a new reasoning model, making it available to both free and paid ChatGPT users. This move comes in the wake of Microsoft making its O1 model free for all Copilot users and the emergence of DeepSeek, which has disrupted the AI world.
Content: OpenAI has launched o3-mini, a new reasoning model, making it available to both free and paid ChatGPT users. This move comes in the wake of Microsoft making its O1 model free for all Copilot users and the emergence of DeepSeek, which has disrupted the AI world. With o3-mini, OpenAI is allowing free-tier users access to its reasoning models for the first time, though with rate limits similar to those of GPT-4o. This is a big change in OpenAI’s strategy as it has made the advanced AI tools more accessible to a wider audience. The model, first announced during OpenAI’s "12 Days of Ship-mas" event in December, offers performance comparable to its predecessor - o1-mini - in areas like mathematics, coding, and scientific reasoning. However, it brings a 24 per cent increase in response speed and improved step-by-step reasoning capabilities, basically offering an overall accuracy and usability of its outputs. "This powerful and fast model advances the boundaries of what small models can achieve, delivering exceptional STEM capabilities—with particular strength in science, math, and coding—all while maintaining the low cost and reduced latency of OpenAI o1-mini," the company said in its blogpost. Paid users on ChatGPT Plus, Team, and Pro plans will receive additional benefits, with Plus and Team users now able to send up to 150 messages per day — three times the previous limit — while Pro users, who pay $200 per month, will continue to enjoy unlimited access. Developers can integrate o3-mini through OpenAI’s API services, including the Chat Completions API, Assistants API, and Batch API. OpenAI has also introduced o3-mini-high, an advanced version optimised for coding and complex reasoning tasks, which offers greater intelligence at the cost of slightly longer processing times. A key upgrade in o3-mini is its ability to fetch real-time data from the web, providing answers with source links for increased reliability.  o3-mini is also being integrated into Microsoft’s Azure OpenAI Service, GitHub Copilot, and GitHub models, further extending its reach in enterprise applications. Users can access o3-mini for free within ChatGPT by selecting the ‘Reason’ feature in the chat bar, though usage limits apply. Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Feb 1, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Smartphones and TVs to get cheaper? Here are key detailsSmartphones and televisions may become more affordable following the Union Budget 2025-26 announcement, which introduced a reduction in basic customs duty (BCD) on key electronic components.
Content: Smartphones and televisions may become more affordable following the Union Budget 2025-26 announcement, which introduced a reduction in basic customs duty (BCD) on key electronic components. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, while presenting the budget in Parliament, outlined several measures aimed at boosting domestic electronics manufacturing and making imported gadgets more cost-effective.One of the biggest changes includes a reduction in BCD on mobile phones, mobile phone chargers, and mobile printed circuit board assemblies (PCBAs) from 20 per cent to 15 per cent. This move is expected to lower the cost of imported smartphones and accessories, including certain high-end iPhone models that are not yet manufactured in India. The government had previously increased this duty from 15 per cent to 20 per cent in 2018 to encourage local manufacturing. However, the latest reduction is being seen as a step towards making smartphones more accessible to consumers.advertisementIndustry leaders have welcomed the move, highlighting its potential to improve India’s electronics ecosystem. Muralikrishnan B, President of Xiaomi India, stated that reducing the BCD on mobile phones, PCBA, and chargers, along with extending exemptions on inputs and raw materials for smartphone manufacturing, will improve the domestic production environment. Similarly, Arijeet Talapatra, CEO of itel and Tecno, praised the decision, calling it a positive step that would make smartphones more affordable in the rapidly growing Indian market. Smartphones and televisions may become more affordable following the Union Budget 2025-26 announcement, which introduced a reduction in basic customs duty (BCD) on key electronic components. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, while presenting the budget in Parliament, outlined several measures aimed at boosting domestic electronics manufacturing and making imported gadgets more cost-effective. One of the biggest changes includes a reduction in BCD on mobile phones, mobile phone chargers, and mobile printed circuit board assemblies (PCBAs) from 20 per cent to 15 per cent. This move is expected to lower the cost of imported smartphones and accessories, including certain high-end iPhone models that are not yet manufactured in India. The government had previously increased this duty from 15 per cent to 20 per cent in 2018 to encourage local manufacturing. However, the latest reduction is being seen as a step towards making smartphones more accessible to consumers. Industry leaders have welcomed the move, highlighting its potential to improve India’s electronics ecosystem. Muralikrishnan B, President of Xiaomi India, stated that reducing the BCD on mobile phones, PCBA, and chargers, along with extending exemptions on inputs and raw materials for smartphone manufacturing, will improve the domestic production environment. Similarly, Arijeet Talapatra, CEO of itel and Tecno, praised the decision, calling it a positive step that would make smartphones more affordable in the rapidly growing Indian market. While the reduction in customs duty is expected to bring down costs for manufacturers, experts remain cautious about its direct impact on retail prices. Tarun Pathak, Research Director at Counterpoint Research, noted that a big price drop is unlikely. He suggested that the reduction might lead to a marginal decrease of 1-2 per cent in smartphone prices, but the extent of the benefit passed on to consumers will depend on individual manufacturers. Additionally, lower-priced smartphones, which already operate on thin profit margins, may not see any notable reduction in price. The government’s focus on electronics manufacturing extends beyond duty reductions. The budget also highlights initiatives to improve the skill set of the workforce in this sector. Experts believe that investment in upskilling programs will play a crucial role in building a high-skilled labour force, which is essential for improving local production capabilities. In the past, the government has taken similar steps to support the electronics industry. In February 2023, it eliminated the customs duty on camera lenses used in smartphones, which contributed to lowering costs for smartphone manufacturers. Despite the reduction in BCD, consumers may need to wait to see if brands decide to pass on the benefits. While imported devices and components could become cheaper, manufacturers might retain the savings to offset rising production costs. However, the move is expected to incentivise local manufacturing further and contribute to the long-term growth of India’s electronics industry.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Feb 1, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Rs 500 crore for AI in education to boost India AI missionUnion Budget 2025-2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitaraman announced that the government will set up a centre of excellence in AI and outlays Rs 500 crore investment. This comes just a few days after the IT minister confirmed that India will have its own Chat-GPT like LLM model.
Content: During the Union Budget 2025, Financial Minister Nirmala Sitaraman announced a few significant steps that will help India to catch-up with the high-paced AI-world. In the budget, the ministry has allocated Rs 500 crore to set up a new centre for excellence in artificial intelligence for education. Along with that, she also announced key projects such as exploring Deep Tech Funds of Funds and making smartphones affordable.  During her speech in Lok Sabha, she stated, “I had announced three centres of excellence in artificial intelligence for agriculture, health and sustainable cities in 2023. Now, a centre of excellence in artificial intelligence for education will be setup with a total outlay of Rs 500 crore." Nirmala Sitharaman also unveiled plans for the establishment of five National Centres of Excellence for Skilling, aimed at equipping youth with industry-relevant expertise. “These centres will be set up with global partnerships to support Make for India, Make for the World manufacturing,” Sitharaman stated. The initiative will focus on developing comprehensive curriculum, training trainers, implementing a skill certification framework, and conducting regular assessments. This comes just a few days after the IT ministry announced that India will get its own large language model (LLM) this year. Union Minister of Electronics and IT, Ashwini Vaishnaw, has claimed that the nation will witness its first in-house LLM model in 10 months. The model will just be like ChatGPT and DeepSeek models, making a significant step in the world of AI. India’s AI ambitions India’s AI ambitions are underpinned by a robust infrastructure, having exceeded its initial target of 10,000 GPUs, now amassing a total of 18,600. This advanced computing power is crucial for training AI models. The majority of these GPUs are high-performance NVIDIA H100 and H200 models, along with MI325 units. To put it in perspective, DeepSeek AI was trained using 2,500 GPUs, while ChatGPT leveraged 25,000. With over 15,000 top-tier GPUs, India is now firmly positioned in the global AI race. Vaishnaw emphasised that this infrastructure will be pivotal to the country’s AI mission, enabling the development of models that can compete with the best in the world. India’s AI model is currently in the works, with six major developers leading the effort. The government anticipates that the first versions will be ready within 4 to 10 months. The model is being tailored to accommodate the country’s rich linguistic and cultural diversity. Vaishnaw expressed optimism about the project, highlighting that improvements in algorithmic efficiency will allow India to develop a world-class AI model in a reduced timeframe.Deep tech fund of funds In the budget speech today, the FM also announced that the government will also explore the Deep Tech Funds of Funds. This is to catalyse the next-gen startups.Published By: Unnati GusainPublished On: Feb 1, 2025

Headline: WhatsApp says there is new Israeli spyware that can target phones, break into private dataWhatsApp has accused Israeli spyware firm Paragon Solutions of targeting 90 journalists and activists. The alleged zero-click attack exploited vulnerabilities, raising concerns over spyware misuse and accountability.
Content: WhatsApp has accused Israeli spyware company Paragon Solutions of targeting nearly 100 journalists and civil society members in a recent hacking campaign, as per a report by The Guardian. WhatsApp says the attacks were carried out using sophisticated spyware known as Graphite, which is capable of infiltrating devices without requiring any interaction from the victim — a technique known as a zero-click attack. WhatsApp claims it had high confidence that around 90 users, including journalists and activists, were targeted and potentially compromised. While the messaging platform did not disclose the locations of the affected individuals, it confirmed that it had notified them of the possible breach. WhatsApp also stated that it had sent a cease and desist letter to Paragon and was exploring legal options to hold the company accountable. Paragon Solutions, which has an office in Virginia, USA, is known for its Graphite spyware, a tool comparable to the infamous Pegasus software developed by NSO Group. Once installed on a device, Graphite grants the operator complete access, including the ability to read messages sent through encrypted apps like WhatsApp and Signal. The identity of the attackers remains unclear. Like other spyware firms, Paragon sells its software to government clients, but WhatsApp said it could not determine who ordered the alleged attacks. A person close to Paragon claimed the company has 35 government customers, all of which are democratic nations. The cited source also stated that Paragon avoids doing business with countries previously accused of spyware abuse, such as Greece, Poland, Hungary, Mexico, and India. This incident comes amid growing scrutiny of the commercial spyware industry. Natalia Krapiva, a senior tech legal counsel at Access Now, noted that while Paragon has been seen as a better spyware company with fewer abuse allegations, WhatsApp’s revelations suggest otherwise. "This is not just a question of some bad apples — these types of abuses are a feature of the commercial spyware industry,” she said. WhatsApp’s announcement follows a recent legal victory against NSO Group, another Israeli spyware maker. In December, a California judge ruled that NSO was liable for hacking 1,400 WhatsApp users in 2019, violating US hacking laws and the platform’s terms of service. NSO was added to a US commerce department blacklist in 2021 for activities deemed contrary to US national security interests. WhatsApp has not revealed how long the targets may have been under threat but confirmed that the alleged attacks were disrupted in December. The company is now working to support affected users and strengthen its defences against future breaches.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Feb 1, 2025Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  OnePlus 13 effectively available for Rs 64,999: Who should buy it?Also read |  iQOO 13 is available under Rs 40,000, but is it worth buying?

Headline: Deep Research: OpenAI launches new AI agent, Altman says it is like a superpowerOpenAI's Deep Research is an AI agent that works independently and is designed to conduct in-depth research using ChatGPT.
Content:
After launching Operator last week, OpenAI unveils its next AI agent —Deep Research. The agent is designed to perform detailed research using its chatbot, ChatGPT. Powered by OpenAI o3 optimised for web browsing and python analysis, deep research uses reasoning to intelligently and extensively browse text, images, and PDFs across the internet, explains OpenAI.  In the blog post, it states, “Deep research is built for people who do intensive knowledge work in areas like finance, science, policy & engineering and need thorough & reliable research.”
 


 “It's also useful for discerning shoppers looking for hyper-personalised recos on purchases that require careful research,” it adds.  OpenAI VP Engineer Srinivas Narayanan explains that this new model is a "new way of using AI to help us on complex knowledge tasks." He adds that the Deep Research is like asking for an expert's advice. It aims to minimise tasks and save up hours of research if done by a human.  OpenAI’s Deep Research: How to use In ChatGPT, simply select "Deep Research" from the message composer and enter your query. Whether you need a competitive analysis of streaming platforms or a personalised report on the best commuter bike, just let ChatGPT know what you're after. You can even attach files or spreadsheets for added context. Once you submit your request, a sidebar will appear to show the steps being taken and the sources used during the process.
 advertisement


OpenAI confirms that this AI agent can take anywhere from 5 to 30 minutes, depending on the complexity of the enquiry. The user will receive a notification once the research is complete, and until then they are free to do other tasks. The final result will be delivered as a detailed report within the chat. According to the company, while Deep Research excels at providing comprehensive, well-documented answers with verified sources, GPT-4 is better suited for real-time, multimodal conversations. For complex, domain-specific enquiries that require depth and precision, deep research offers the advantage of extensive exploration and citation—perfect for producing reliable, actionable insights.
 


Explaining how this agent works, CEO Sam Altman posted an example on X (formerly Twitter). He posted that while this model is slow, it is the first AI model that can "do such a wide variety of complex, valuable tasks." 
 


Next, OpenAI is also planning to add embedded images, data visualisations, and other analytic features to enhance the clarity and context of the reports soon. How is it different from the Operator? The key differentiation is that while the Operator can be tasked with a wide range of repetitive browser activities, such as completing forms, ordering groceries, or even creating memes, it cannot perform in-depth research like the new AI agent. Deep research builds on the reasoning capabilities to bridge the gap, allowing it to take on the types of problems people face in work and everyday life.However, both the agents are a significant step toward the broader goal of developing AGI, which OpenAI has been pointing out for a long period. This also comes at a time when a Chinese AI model, DeepSeek gained a lot of attention for its advanced tech and cheap cost. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman also praised DeepSeek, but promised a much better models. Published By: Unnati GusainPublished On: Feb 3, 2025

Headline: Government is reportedly thinking about changing its stance on cryptocurrency With Donald Trump sharing his pro-crypto ideas, the government in India is reportedly also reconsidering its stance on cryptocurrency.
Content: India has a rigid cryptocurrency environment, and its stance on the digital currency has been anything but consistent. The laws around it are ever-changing. And people who are brave enough to get past the rules and regulations have to face heavy taxes. However, this is reportedly set to change soon. The government is rethinking its current approach to cryptocurrency trade and investment in India, according to a report by Reuters. Reportedly, this purported change is primarily because of the global shift in the approach toward cryptocurrency –– specifically in the US, where Donald Trump has been making some pro-crypto announcements. In fact, just ahead of his swearing in as the US president, Trump launched his own meme coin in the US, which eventually also led to Bitcoin hitting an all-time high of $100,000. “More than one or two jurisdictions have changed their stance towards cryptocurrency in terms of usage, acceptance, and the importance of crypto assets. In that stride, we are reviewing the discussion paper once again,” Reuters reports Ajay Seth, India’s economic affairs secretary, as saying.  In the US, Trump has recently directed the establishment of a cryptocurrency working group. The proposed group is meant to suggest new digital asset regulations and aid in creating a national cryptocurrency reserve. Meanwhile, in India, regulatory bodies have been quite strict. In December 2023, the Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) in India issued show-cause notices to 9 offshore crypto exchanges, including Binance and Kucoin, for non-compliance with local regulations. The FIU also requested the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology to block these platforms’ URLs within India. In June 2024, Binance, which is the world's largest crypto exchange, faced a hefty fine of Rs 188.2 million in India. This was just a month after Binance registered with the FIU in an attempt to resume its operations in the country. The fine, according to FIU, was due to violations of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002, under which virtual digital asset service providers (VDA SPs) are required to register as 'Reporting Entities' and comply with anti-money laundering protocols. In 2023, former RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das also represented a critical stand against cryptocurrency in India. “Crypto should be banned, given its lack of underlying value. It’s a form of gambling, nothing more than 100 per cent speculation,” Das said at the Business Today Banking and Economy Summit. While there have been calls for a multi-regulatory framework for crypto in India, the report on the shift in the government’s stance regarding the digital currency, brings hope for traders in India. It will be interesting to see how the government now balances the external pressure from global developments and the internal squabble on regulation around cryptocurrency. Let’s hope the delay in the discussion paper on cryptocurrency, which was supposed to be released in September 2024, will only bring good news for crypto traders in the country. Headline: Vivo X200 Pro Mini to debut in India: Launch date, price leaked After the Vivo X200 Pro launch in India, the company is expected to launch a toned-down version -- Vivo X200 Pro Mini. The phone is anticipated to hit the market in April.
Content:
Vivo launched its flagship series, Vivo X200 and X200 Pro in India in December 2024. After a few months, a recent report informs that the company is planning to launch a toned-down version of the Vivo X200 Pro. The Vivo X200 Pro Mini is expected to sport similar, but a little low-key features at a much more affordable price. According to the report by SmartPrix, the device is anticipated to arrive in the country in the second quarter of 2025. The most probable guess, by the tipsters, is that the Vivo X200 Pro Mini will launch in April. But before the launch, we have a bunch of information that gives an idea of how the phone will sail through. advertisementVivo X200 Pro Mini: Specs and features (Expected)While the mini version is a new upcoming entry in India, the Chinese market received it along with the series. The Vivo X200 Pro Mini was launched in China in October 2024. The report suggests that there is a high chance that the Vivo X200 Pro Mini in India will mimic the Chinese variant. The Vivo X200 Pro Mini boasts a 6.31-inch quad-curved AMOLED display with a 1.5K resolution and 120Hz refresh rate, ensuring a fluid and immersive visual experience. It is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 9400 SoC, the same high-performance chipset found in the Vivo X200 and X200 Pro. While the mini version is a new upcoming entry in India, the Chinese market received it along with the series. The Vivo X200 Pro Mini was launched in China in October 2024. The report suggests that there is a high chance that the Vivo X200 Pro Mini in India will mimic the Chinese variant.  The Vivo X200 Pro Mini boasts a 6.31-inch quad-curved AMOLED display with a 1.5K resolution and 120Hz refresh rate, ensuring a fluid and immersive visual experience. It is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 9400 SoC, the same high-performance chipset found in the Vivo X200 and X200 Pro. In India, the device is expected to be available in two memory configurations: 12GB RAM + 256GB storage and 16GB RAM + 512GB storage. Photography enthusiasts will appreciate its triple-camera setup, featuring a 50-megapixel primary sensor, 50-megapixel ultra-wide lens, and 50-megapixel 3x telephoto lens, while a 32-megapixel front camera handles selfies and video calls. That said, it is noteworthy that the Vivo X200 Pro has been applauded for its camera quality (read the review here), and it will be interesting to see if the toned-down version will carry forward the same.  The smartphone runs on the latest Funtouch OS 15 and comes equipped with an in-display fingerprint scanner, IP68 water and dust resistance, and Zeiss optics for superior imaging. A 5,700mAh battery supports 90W fast charging and 30W wireless charging, making it a powerhouse in the premium smartphone segment.Vivo X200 Pro Mini: India price (leaked) The rumour has it that the Vivo X200 Pro Mini will be priced a little above the X200, but lower than the X200 Pro. For perspective, the X200 was launched at a price of Rs 65,999 and the X200 Pro was launched at Rs 94,999. Looking at these figures, we can assume that the Vivo X200 Pro Mini might be priced around Rs 75,000. 
 


 While the Chinese variant of X200 Pro Mini was launched at a starting price of CNY 4,699 (approximately Rs 55,750), the Indian price will be higher. The price gap between China and India is the reason behind it. For instance, the price difference between the X200 in China and in India stood at Rs 14,300, and for the X200 Pro, the Indian variant was priced at Rs 31,199 higher than the Chinese one. Hence, we are sure that the price for Vivo X200 Pro Mini will be above Rs 66k but lower than Rs 94k.  Notably, these are mere assumptions and speculations. Hence, we advise you to take it with a pinch of salt and stay tune for the official notification. Headline: Greater Noida man loses Rs 51 lakh after joining a Telegram groupThe victim received a WhatsApp message from an unknown individual.  The individual promised him a part-time job involving simple tasks for returns. However, the victim was later added to a Telegram group, where he ended up investing more money as he was persuaded by scammers.
Content: In yet another case of online task fraud, a resident of Greater Noida ended up losing Rs 51.63 lakh in just five days. The victim first received a WhatsApp message about an easy job that promised money through simple tasks. Later, he was added to a Telegram group where scammers made him invest money for higher profits. In the end, hoping to earn more money in a short time, the victim ended up losing his own money to the scammers. According to the case reported by Hindustan Times, the case involves a 31-year-old man who lived in Sector 16B, Greater Noida West. The victim, who works at a private firm, began his ordeal on January 18 when he received a WhatsApp message from an unknown number. The sender introduced herself as Pallavi and claimed she could help him earn big profits by simply completing the online tasks she shared. Interested in the offer and hoping to earn some easy money, the victim agreed to participate. After his approval, the scammer added him to a Telegram group where he received more information related to cryptocurrency investments. Initially, the victim was asked to deposit small amounts ranging from Rs 2,000 to Rs 8,000 as part of the tasks. Gradually, the scammers managed to manipulate him into making larger transfers under the pretence of increasing his returns. The scammers even showed the victim a fake online portfolio displaying a profit of Rs 60 lakh, which gave him confidence in the process. However, when he attempted to withdraw the supposed profits, the fraudsters demanded additional payments, citing various charges and fees. This raised the victim’s suspicion, and after discussing the matter with a friend, he realized he had fallen victim to a scam. According to the report, in just five days, the victim made 32 transactions, transferring a total of Rs 51.63 lakh to the scammers. The victim filed a complaint with the cybercrime branch, and a case has been registered under Sections 318 (cheating) and 319 (cheating by personation) of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS), along with relevant sections of the IT Act. Notably, this is not the first case of individual losing money to scammers after falling for fake easy-task and investment promises. In the past few years, many cases have been reported where victims shared how they lost money hoping to earn larger profits by doing online tasks. In these scams, scammers often ask targeted individuals to do tasks like liking YouTube videos, giving reviews, and so on. To gain trust, they even send small amounts of money to the the targeted individuals. However, as individuals start trusting the scammers, they then propose investment ideas like cryptocurrency wallets and ask victims to invest through fake apps they have created. Once the victim adds money and tries to withdraw it, the scammers either cut off access or even threaten the victim, demanding more money under the pretext of avoiding money laundering charges. To stay safe from such scams, it is advisable not to fall for such opportunities. If someone reaches out with offers that seem too good to be true, block and report them. Do not download any app they share, as it could be a malicious app designed to steal your sensitive data and empty your bank accounts.Published By: Divya BhatiPublished On: Feb 3, 2025Also Read |  Indian Railways launches new app, will offer all train services in one placeAlso Read |  iPhone inside your Mac? Headline: Indian Railways launches new app, will offer all train services in one placeIndian Railways introduces a SuperApp, 'SwaRail,' for train travelers. This new app has been developed by the Centre for Railway Information Systems to offer several train-related services-- which were earlier available through different apps-- under one unified platform.
Content:
The Ministry of Railways has introduced a new SuperApp, ‘SwaRail,’ to offer all train services to the public in one place. The new SuperApp from Indian Railways has been developed by the Centre for Railway Information Systems (CRIS) to provide train travelers with all Indian Railways-related services—which are currently available through different apps—on a single platform. The Railway SuperApp offers multiple services for train travel, including reserved and unreserved ticket booking, platform and parcel booking, train and PNR enquiries, and assistance through Rail Madad. The app is currently available for beta testing through the Google Play Store and Apple’s App Store and is expected to roll out soon after public testing is completed. Once rolled out, and currently for beta testers, the SuperApp offers several services, including:
Reserved Ticket Bookings
Unreserved Ticket and Platform Ticket Bookings
Parcel and Freight Enquiries
Train and PNR Status Enquiries
Food Orders on Trains
Rail Madad for Complaint Management
 Indian Railways notes that the new SuperApp also includes travel assistance features like Single Sign-On, Easy Onboarding/Sign-Up, and more to help users with all their Indian Railways travel-related queries. These new features include: Single Sign-On – This feature allows users to access all Indian Railways services using a single set of credentials. Additionally, the same credentials can be used across existing Indian Railways apps like IRCTC RailConnect, UTS Mobile App, etc. All-in-One App – Ministry of Railways notes that currently, different apps are available for reserved and unreserved bookings. Additionally, a separate app is required to check train movements and schedules. However, with the new app, the government is offering all these services under a unified platform. Easy Onboarding/Sign-Up – The new app allows users to log into the SuperApp using their existing RailConnect or UTS App credentials. The sign-up process has been simplified to enhance the user experience and make the app easily accessible. Once logged in, the app can subsequently be accessed using either an m-PIN or biometric authentication.How to download the Railway SuperApp The app is currently available for beta testing. However, the beta testing slots are reportedly full on both the Google Play Store and Apple App Store. The app will soon be available for everyone. Once available, users will be able to download it from the Play Store or App Store. During login, existing users of RailConnect or UTS Mobile App will be able to log in directly with their credentials. New users can register with minimal data entry requirements.

Headline: Elon Musk is making DOGE work 17 hours a dayElon Musk has wasted no time bringing his intense work culture to the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), where he's been in charge for just under two weeks. Musk revealed that his DOGE team works nearly 17 hours a day.
Content: Elon Musk has wasted no time bringing his intense work culture to the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), where he's been in charge for just under two weeks. Musk recently revealed that his team at DOGE is working an exhausting 120 hours a week, which is equivalent to nearly 17 hours a day, including weekends. In a post on X (formerly Twitter), Musk took a jab at the typical government workweek, noting, "DOGE is working 120 hours a week. Our bureaucratic opponents optimistically work 40 hours a week. That is why they are losing so fast." He also criticised the lack of weekend work in the bureaucracy, suggesting it gives his department an edge as his team works around the clock. Musk is known for his aggressive work philosophy. When he took over Twitter in 2022, he imposed 80-hour workweeks, and now he's attempting to apply similar standards in his government role. While his approach has driven success in the tech world, it remains to be seen if the same strategy can yield results within the more rigid government structure. However, experts are divided on Musk's methods. Shannon Copeland, CEO of SIB, a cost-cutting firm, told Business Insider that Musk's focus on efficiency could help shake up the bureaucracy. "While a 120-hour workweek isn't a practical or sustainable solution for most, the principle behind it resonates. Companies that prioritize efficiency, automation, and proactive cost management will always outperform those weighed down by bureaucracy," she said. However, not everyone agrees that Musk’s hard-driving approach is sustainable. Roi Ginat, CEO of Endless AI, cautioned that pushing teams too hard can lead to burnout.  "Driving a team too hard for too long leads to fatigue and burnout. Many people simply won't function well without enough sleep, and as fatigue sets in, errors increase," he told BI. "I believe that Elon's tweet is about an effort, not a new standard at DOGE." "My work is on my mind most of my time, and it's an important part of the deal, but great work ideas often come while I hike with my kids," Ginat, who works for about 85 hours a week, said.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Feb 3, 2025

Headline: OpenAI Operator AI agent will be open to more ChatGPT users in a few months OpenAI's recently launched AI agent, Operator, will be available on ChatGPT in the next few months, but initially it may only be accessible by the Plus subscribers.
Content:
OpenAI recently launched its highly-anticipated AI agent, Operator. It is capable of doing pretty much any task on a users’ behalf that they would do on the web. It can book flight tickets for you, it can make dinner reservations for you, or even write code for an entire website. However, as of now, the AI agent can only be accessed by ChatGPT Pro users, and only in the US. But the availability is set to expand soon.  In a Reddit AMA (Ask Me Anything), which was hosted by OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and several other OpenAI engineers and researchers, Altman confirmed that Operator will soon be available to ChatGPT Plus users as well. Responding to the question: “How far are we from having Operator on the regular Plus plan?”, Altman answered, saying, “months”. Now, this obviously indicates that it will still be a few months before Operator is available to more ChatGPT users –– but considering that the AI agent is currently limited to a really tiny number of users which are the ChatGPT Pro subscriber who are in the US –– this still good news for people who are looking forward to try out OpenAI Operator.  There is still no timeline on when OpenAI Operator will rollout for ChatGPT Plus. The Reddit response also does not clarify if the available, when opened to Plus subscribers, will also be expanded beyond the US.  OpenAI Operator, as per OpenAI, is capable of “using its own browser, it can look at a webpage and interact with it by typing, clicking, and scrolling.” Operator is the first AI agent by OpenAI. It essentially works as an intermediary between the user and the web. It can perform a bunch of repetitive browser activities, and that is what the company is leveraging –– providing users a tool that can do the daily mundane tasks for them, so that they have more time to spend on other tasks and opportunities. ChatGPT Pro subscription is priced at $200, which is around Rs 17,000. The Pro version offers unlimited access to the OpenAI o1 model, GPT 4o model, and Advanced voice mode. The o1 available on the Pro version, also includes some Pro-specific features that are not available to other subscription tiers with access to o1.  ChatGPT Plus, on the other hand, is a much more affordable subscription plan and is priced at $20 or Rs 1,700 (approximately) per month in India. The Plus model also lets users access the o1 model but with a few limitations.

Headline: Trump wants Gulf of Mexico to be renamed to Gulf of America, Google says okUS President Donald Trump says the Gulf of Mexico should be renamed to the Gulf of America. Without any protest, Google makes the change on Google Maps.
Content:
As part of the myriad of executive orders that the new US President Donald Trump signed as he took charge of the office, was an order to rename the Gulf of Mexico, to the Gulf of America. He said last week that the name Gulf of America had a “beautiful ring”.“It’s appropriate. And Mexico has to stop allowing millions of people to pour into our country,” he said. A few days after that, the interior department of the Trump administration announced that the name change has officially been implemented. “As directed by the president, the Gulf of Mexico will now officially be known as the Gulf of America and North America’s highest peak will once again bear the name Mount McKinley,” said the interior department. Just a day later, Google announced –– with zero protest –– that the company will be renaming the gulf in Google Maps in the US.  Basically, Google says that once the change in name reflects in the official records in the US –– Geographic Names Information System (GNIS) –– the company will also rename the Gulf of Mexico, to the Gulf of America, for users in the US. For users in Mexico, however, it will continue to show as the Gulf of Mexico.  Are you thinking if that is the usual protocol? Can a company just change the name of a place in maps that millions of people use? Well, according to Google, the company has a “longstanding practice of applying name changes when they have been updated in official government [records]”.
 


 “When official names vary between countries, Maps users see their official local name. Everyone in the rest of the world sees both names. That applies here too,” the company added in its post on X. 
 


 This is not the first time that Google has agreed to do something like this. Google has applied this area-based geographic naming in Japan and South Korea as well. Outside of Japan and South Korea, the body of water that borders both the countries is listed on Google Maps as the “Sea of Japan (East Sea)”. In 2012, Iran had warned Google of a legal action after the company removed the name "Persian Gulf" from its maps services, leaving the waterway between Iran and the Arabian Peninsula, nameless. In other regions, the water body is currently labeled as "Persian Gulf (Arabian Gulf)" on Google Maps.Published By: Nandini YadavPublished On: Feb 3, 2025Tune InAlso read |  Elon Musk is making DOGE work 17 hours a dayAlso read |  Deep Research: After Operator, OpenAI unveils next-gen AI agent, Sam Altman says it is like a superpowerAlso read |  Want to build ChatGPT in India? Headline: Microsoft fires employees in the fresh round of layoffs: Story in 5 pointsMicrosoft has started laying off employees based on their performance. The affected workers have reportedly been let go for not meeting the company's minimum job performance standards. Here is the full story in 5 points.
Content: It seems that layoff season is not over yet as several tech companies have started fresh rounds of job cuts. Amazon recently sacked some employees to save costs, and now Microsoft has started laying off employees based on their performance. The affected workers have reportedly been let go for not meeting the company’s minimum job performance standards. Here is the full story in five points.advertisementMicrosoft fires employees in fresh round of layoffs: Story in 5 points-According to Business Insider, the impacted employees have been informed that their access to Microsoft's systems and offices would be revoked immediately upon receiving their termination notices, and they would not be permitted to continue any further work.-The employees being terminated under this round of layoffs are facing a range of consequences, with some reportedly indicating that they may not receive severance pay. The cited report suggests that at least three employees confirmed they were told they would not be compensated upon their exit from the company. Additionally, their healthcare benefits were also immediately cut off, raising questions about Microsoft's approach to handling these layoffs, especially in terms of financial and post-employment support. -According to Business Insider, the impacted employees have been informed that their access to Microsoft's systems and offices would be revoked immediately upon receiving their termination notices, and they would not be permitted to continue any further work. -The employees being terminated under this round of layoffs are facing a range of consequences, with some reportedly indicating that they may not receive severance pay. The cited report suggests that at least three employees confirmed they were told they would not be compensated upon their exit from the company. Additionally, their healthcare benefits were also immediately cut off, raising questions about Microsoft's approach to handling these layoffs, especially in terms of financial and post-employment support. -The termination letters handed to the laid-off employees also make it clear that should they choose to reapply for positions at Microsoft in the future, their prior performance and the reasons for their termination will be considered. This policy could potentially hinder their chances of returning to the company. The official letters cite poor performance as the primary reason for termination. -This round of layoffs appears to be part of a more aggressive performance management strategy at Microsoft, which is said to be affecting even senior employees. Reports indicate that workers at high levels within the company are now subject to stringent performance reviews. Despite these terminations, Microsoft has reportedly suggested that many of the roles could eventually be refilled, indicating that this may not result in a big reduction of the company’s overall workforce. As of June 2024, Microsoft employed approximately 228,000 full-time workers. -The performance-based layoffs are occurring alongside a series of other layoffs that Microsoft has been implementing in various departments, including Security, Devices, Sales, and Gaming. A Microsoft spokesperson commented on the situation, stating that the company is committed to nurturing talent and taking necessary actions when employees fail to meet performance expectations. Headline: Huawei Mate XT, triple-fold smartphone may hit the global market soonWorld's first triple-fold smartphone: Huawei Mate XT, currently available in China, is rumoured to launch in the global market. The release date is expected to come by March.
Content: The Huawei Mate XT Ultimate, the world's first triple-fold smartphone, is rumoured to arrive at a global level soon. Launched in September, the device is only available in China currently. But this might change soon. According to the rumours, the Mate XT is expected to launch globally by March 2025. With its three folds and still a slimmer profile, the Mate XT was seen in several headlines during the launch. The Chinese company is the only OEM so far, which has released a triple-fold smartphone. That said, Samsung is also rumoured to bring a triple-fold smartphone with its next-gen foldable series.  advertisementHuawei Mate XT global launchThe Huawei Mate XT smartphone has been spotted on the TDRA certification website, listed under the model number GRL-LX9. While the listing does not provide specific details regarding its launch or availability, it does confirm that the tri-folding device is set for a global release soon. According to a previous report from September 2024, the Mate XT was rumoured to launch in Q1 2025. If this timeline holds, Huawei could unveil the device within the next two months. Since the Mate XT has already debuted in China, the global variant is expected to feature the same specifications as its Chinese counterpart.Huawei Mate XT: What to expect?  The Huawei Mate XT smartphone has been spotted on the TDRA certification website, listed under the model number GRL-LX9. While the listing does not provide specific details regarding its launch or availability, it does confirm that the tri-folding device is set for a global release soon.  According to a previous report from September 2024, the Mate XT was rumoured to launch in Q1 2025. If this timeline holds, Huawei could unveil the device within the next two months. Since the Mate XT has already debuted in China, the global variant is expected to feature the same specifications as its Chinese counterpart.Huawei Mate XT: What to expect?  The world's first dual-hinged, triple-folding smartphone offers a remarkable OLED display experience. When unfolded, it starts with a 6.4-inch screen, but the real innovation lies in its ability to expand. The display can partially unfurl to a 7.9-inch size or fully extend into a tablet-like 10.2-inch panel with a resolution of 2,232 x 3,184 pixels. Despite its large screen, the device remains incredibly slim, measuring just 3.6mm when fully opened, making it one of the thinnest smartphones available.   Powering the device is Huawei’s Kirin 9010 5G chipset, running on HarmonyOS 4.2 for a smooth and optimised experience. A 5,600mAh battery ensures long-lasting performance, with support for 66W wired and 50W wireless charging. According to Huawei, the Mate XT features the world’s thinnest smartphone battery, setting a new industry benchmark.   The camera setup is equally impressive. It includes a 50-megapixel primary sensor, a 12-megapixel ultra-wide-angle lens, and a 12-megapixel telephoto lens with 5.5x optical zoom. For selfies, an 8-megapixel front-facing camera is housed within a punch-hole cutout.   These details are based on the assumption that the global variant of the Huawei Mate XT will mirror its Chinese counterpart. For official specifications and confirmation, stay tuned for Huawei’s announcement. For perspective, the Huawei Mate XT is priced starting at CNY 19,999 (approximately Rs 2.43 lakh) for the base variant with 16GB RAM and 256GB storage, while the highest-end model costs CNY 23,999 (around Rs 2.93 lakh) in China. Headline: Reliance Jio revises Rs 448 prepaid plan and adds new Rs 189 recharge packJio Rs 189 prepaid plan: Reliance Jio has revised its prepaid plan offerings, bringing back the Rs 189 recharge pack and adjusting the price of its existing Rs 448 recharge plan. These changes are aimed at providing more flexibility to users. Here are the details.
Content: Reliance Jio has revised its prepaid plan offerings, bringing back the Rs 189 recharge pack and adjusting the price of its existing Rs 448 recharge plan. These changes are aimed at providing more flexibility to users. Here are the details.Reliance Jio launches Rs 189 prepaid plan After being briefly removed, Jio has reintroduced its Rs 189 prepaid plan. Listed under the ‘affordable packs’ section, this pack offers 28 days of validity, providing users with 2GB of total data (with speeds reduced to 64kbps once the data limit is reached), unlimited voice calls to any network, and 300 SMS. Subscribers will also have access to Jio services such as JioTV, JioCinema (excluding premium content), and JioCloud storage. This plan comes in response to recent regulatory guidelines from TRAI, which require telecom operators to introduce voice and SMS-focused packs. For users who need basic connectivity at an economical price, this plan serves as a suitable option.Rs 448 Jio prepaid recharge plan revised In addition to bringing back the Rs 189 pack, Jio has made a minor price reduction to its Rs 448 data + voice plan, bringing it down to Rs 445. The revised plan offers 28 days of validity, 2GB of data per day, unlimited voice calls, and 100 SMS per day. Subscribers also gain access to a variety of OTT platforms, including Zee5, JioCinema Premium, SonyLIV, Lionsgate Play, and more. This price adjustment appears to clarify distinctions between Jio’s various plans. The Rs 448 voice-only plan, which no longer includes data, was earlier offered at Rs 458 and saw a reduction to Rs 448, likely leading to the price change for the Rs 445 data + voice pack.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Feb 3, 2025

Headline: Donald Trump says Elon Musk is a smart guy and is doing a great job as DOGE head US President Donald Trump says Elon Musk is a "big cost-cutter" and he is "very much into cutting the budget of our federal government".
Content:
It is quite clear that Elon Musk holds an important position in the US President Donald Trump’s inner circle. Musk’s enthusiasm during Donald Trump’s inauguration ceremony was notably pronounced. And right now, both Musk and Trump have been publicly acknowledging their mutual admiration for one another. In an interview with Fox News, the US President said that Elon Musk is a smart guy and is doing a great job as DOGE head.  “I think Elon is doing a good job. He's a big cost-cutter”, he said. “He's doing a great job. He’s a smart guy. He's very much into cutting the budget of our federal government,” he added. Although, Trump did say that for some time the Trump administration did not agree with the budget cuts he suggests, but largely he has been doing a great job. 
 


 Meanwhile, in an X Space on DOGE & Mars, Elon Musk also shared some love for Donald Trump. “The more I’ve gotten to know President Trump, the more I like him. I love the guy, he’s great.”
 advertisement


 At DOGE, in less than two weeks of taking over, Musk has already introduced his trademark intense work culture. DOGE, by the way, stands for the Department of Government Efficiency. Musk in a post on X has disclosed that DOGE team members are working approximately 17 hours a day, including weekends.  In the post, Musk also compared DOGE's workload with that of typical government employees, saying: "DOGE is working 120 hours a week. Our bureaucratic opponents optimistically work 40 hours a week. That is why they are losing so fast."  One of DOGE’s most talked about initiatives is the aim to cut down the cost of minting pennies and nickels. Musk’s team at DOGE has been tasked with looking for an initiative to cut down the cost on that by either choosing a different material for the coins or by changing the production process. 
 


 Additionally, Musk also claims that his team is shutting down payments to federal contractors. Reports suggest this could also hint at possible access to sensitive US Treasury systems.
 


 “The corruption and waste is being rooted out in real-time,” Musk posted on X. He added that his team is “rapidly shutting down these illegal payments”, referring to the Treasury department’s payments to a Lutheran charity. Headline: iPhone SE4 expected to arrive next month? Here is everything we know so farApple is rumoured to launch its new affordable iPhone SE4 next month. The new-gen iPhone SE is speculated to bring notable upgrades in both design and hardware, making this one of the biggest affordable iPhone upgrades.
Content: Apple is likely to launch its fourth-generation iPhone SE as early as next month or by April. While the tech giant has remained tight-lipped about its upcoming budget-friendly iPhone, rumours and speculations have been circulating online for months, hinting at a Spring 2025 launch. And if the reports hold true, the much-anticipated iPhone SE4 will bring notable upgrades in both hardware and software over the iPhone SE3, which Apple launched in 2022. According to several analysts, including Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman, the new iPhone SE4 will have a design overhaul, most likely inspired by the iPhone 14. Gurman even noted that Apple is clearing the inventory of its current iPhone SE to make way for the new-gen iPhone SE4, hinting at the upcoming launch on Apple’s calendar. Let's take a detailed look at everything expected from the new-gen iPhone SE4.iPhone SE4: New design and display According to rumours, one of the most significant changes expected with the iPhone SE4 is its design. Moving away from the dated look of previous SE models—including thick bezels and a home button—the SE4 is rumoured to adopt an all-screen design similar to the iPhone 14. Many leaked images of dummy models circulating online from leakers like Majin Bu suggest the iPhone SE4 will feature a notch in its bigger 6.1-inch OLED display—no Dynamic Island, as speculated by a few reports earlier. Apple is said to keep the Dynamic Island exclusive to its flagship series. Along with a notch, rumours suggest that the new budget iPhone SE4 will also bring some differences that will set it apart from the flagship iPhone 16 series. These differences will include a sharper and more angular frame, unlike the rounded edges of the iPhone 16. Apple is said to have chosen this design to be cost-effective while reusing the iPhone 14 chassis. Additionally, the OLED display in the budget iPhone will allow Apple to offer richer colours, deeper blacks, and better contrast compared to the LCD screens used in previous SE models.iPhone SE4: New chipset Under the hood, the iPhone SE4 is expected to pack Apple’s latest A18 series chip, the same processor currently powering the iPhone 16 series. This will be a big upgrade from the A15 Bionic chip of the iPhone SE3. Apple may further couple the powerful processor with 8GB of RAM, which will boost performance and also allow the device to support Apple Intelligence features. If this comes true, the iPhone SE4 will be the most affordable iPhone to offer Apple’s advanced AI capabilities.iPhone SE4: Bigger and better camera On the camera front, the SE4 is rumoured to feature an upgraded 48-megapixel main sensor—a big upgrade from the 12-megapixel camera on its predecessor. The front-facing camera is also expected to see an upgrade to 12 megapixels, offering users better quality selfies and video calls.iPhone SE4: In-house modem If Apple is really launching the iPhone SE4 next month, it will be one of the first devices to debut in 2025. Not just that, but according to reports, it will also be the first Apple device to come with Apple’s custom 5G modem. If true, this will allow the new iPhone to offer better power efficiency, improved cellular network scanning, and enhanced satellite connectivity. Additionally, the SE4 will feature USB-C for charging and data transfer, in line with Apple’s broader transition away from the Lightning port.iPhone SE4: India pricing As for the price, the iPhone SE4 is rumoured to be slightly more expensive than its predecessor, given the significant upgrades. According to rumours, it is expected to start around $470 to $500. In India, it is expected to be priced around Rs 50,000.Published By: Divya BhatiPublished On: Feb 3, 2025Also Read |  Greater Noida man loses Rs 51 lakh after joining a Telegram groupAlso Read |  Indian Railways launches new app, will offer all train services in one placeAlso Read |  iPhone inside your Mac? Yes, iPhone mirroring gives 2-in-1 access and can change how you work

Headline: Nothing Phone 3a could feature iPhone-like camera button, fresh teaser suggestsThe Nothing Phone 3a is set to launch in India on March 4, and while the company hasn't revealed much about the phone, its teasers have offered hints about what to expect. A fresh teaser hints that the Nothing Phone 3a could sport a camera button, similar to the one found on the iPhone 16 series.
Content: The Nothing Phone 3a is set to launch in India on March 4, and while the company hasn’t revealed much about the phone, its teasers have offered hints about what to expect. One notable rumour is that the company may introduce a new Pro model in this series, replacing the Phone 2a Plus version. Although the company hasn't confirmed this, the teasers have started creating buzz about potential features. A fresh teaser hints that the Nothing Phone 3a could sport a camera button, similar to the one found on the iPhone 16 series. In a cryptic post on X, Nothing shared an image showing one side of the phone with volume buttons and an additional button, which could be a dedicated camera button. The tweet accompanying the image reads, "Your second memory, one click away," suggesting it could be related to quick access to the camera. Brands like Oppo have also incorporated this feature in phones like the Find X8 Pro, and Apple’s designs have often inspired other smartphone makers. For instance, the alert slider on OnePlus phones was borrowed from the iPhone. If Nothing does introduce a camera button or a control feature similar to the iPhone 16 series, it wouldn’t be surprising. However, it’s also possible that this button could function as an Action button, like the one found on the iPhone 15 Pro models. The tweet leans more towards it being a camera button, but for now, Nothing has left the guessing to the audience until the official reveal. Based on previous teasers, the Nothing Phone 3a series is expected to feature a triple camera setup, an upgrade from the dual camera system seen on the Phone 2a and 2a Plus models. It’s likely that the triple camera system could be reserved for the Pro model, while the standard Phone 3a might retain a dual camera setup. Though none of this is confirmed yet, one feature we can expect is a redesigned glyph light interface on the back panel, an evolution of the LED light system seen on earlier Nothing phones.  In terms of display, the Nothing Phone 3a is tipped to come with a 6.8-inch FHD+ AMOLED screen with a 120Hz refresh rate, up from the 6.7-inch display seen on the Phone 2a. Under the hood, it could pack a Qualcomm Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 chipset. For your reference, the Phone 2a is powered by a Dimensity 7200 Pro. On the camera front, the triple camera setup might include a 50MP primary sensor, a 50MP 2x telephoto lens, and an 8MP ultra-wide camera. The front camera could remain a 32MP shooter, similar to the previous model. The phone is also expected to pack a 5,000mAh battery with support for 45W fast charging. As of now, the specs for the Phone 3a are speculative, but if the Pro version includes a telephoto sensor while the standard model doesn’t, we might see a price increase for the Pro model compared to the Phone 2a Plus. However, this remains unconfirmed until the official launch. While we will learn more about its pricing and availability details at the launch event, we know that the devices will be sold through Flipkart. For your reference, the Nothing Phone 2a was announced at Rs 23,999, while the Nothing Phone 2a Plus was made available at Rs 27,999. While there haven’t been any price leaks, the new models are expected to be priced in the range of the Phone 2a series, considering Nothing’s history of competitive pricing.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Feb 3, 2025

Headline: Trump orders creation of sovereign wealth fund that could help in TikTok US saleUS President Donald Trump has signed an executive order for the creation of a sovereign wealth fund over the next year, which he says will help buy TikTok.
Content:
US President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Monday ordering the creation of a sovereign wealth fund within the next year, saying it could potentially buy the short video app TikTok. If created, the sovereign wealth fund could place the US alongside numerous other countries, particularly in the Middle East and Asia, that have launched similar funds as a way to make direct investments with government dollars. The text of the executive order was sparse on details, and simply directed the Treasury and Commerce Departments to submit a plan for such a fund within 90 days, including recommendations on "funding mechanisms, investment strategies, fund structure, and a governance model." Typically, such funds rely on a country's budget surplus to make investments, but the US operates at a deficit. Its creation also would likely require approval from Congress. "We're going to create a lot of wealth for the fund," Trump told reporters. "And I think it's about time that this country had a sovereign wealth fund." Trump had previously floated such a government investment vehicle as a presidential candidate, saying it could fund "great national endeavors" like infrastructure projects such as highways and airports, manufacturing, and medical research. Administration officials did not say how the fund would operate or be financed, but Trump has previously said it could be funded by "tariffs and other intelligent things." Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told reporters the fund would be set up within the next 12 months. "We're going to monetise the asset side of the US balance sheet for the American people," Bessent said. "There'll be a combination of liquid assets, assets that we have in this country as we work to bring them out for the American people." One approach would be to convert the US International Development Finance Corp (DFC) to function similar to a sovereign wealth fund, which the Trump administration reportedly considered in recent months, Bloomberg News reported. The DFC is a government agency that currently partners with private parties to finance projects in the developing world. Trump announced Friday he was nominating Benjamin Black to head that development agency. Black, a managing partner at investment firm Fortinbras Enterprises, is the son of Leon Black, the co-founder of asset management firm Apollo Global Management. The Biden administration also was considering establishing such a fund prior to Trump's election in November, according to The New York Times and Financial Times. But precisely how such a fund would be structured, and funded, remains unclear. Several experts said Congress would likely need to authorise new funding given the lack of an existing surplus to tap. The order directed officials to review any need for legislation. Clemence Landers, a former Treasury official who is now with the Center for Global Development, said there has been talk of repurposing the DFC but setting up such a fund would require Congress. “Obviously, you can't establish an institution by executive order and, more to the point is, you can't fund an institution by executive order,” she said.
Investors said the news came as a surprise. "Creating a sovereign wealth fund suggests that a country has savings that will go up and can be allocated to this," said Colin Graham, head of multi-asset strategies at Robeco in London. "The economic rules of thumb don't add up." There are over 90 such funds across the world managing over $8 trillion in assets, according to the International Forum of Sovereign Wealth Funds. Numerous US states, including Alaska, Texas and New Mexico also have their own wealth funds, which help fund various priorities, including education and tax relief. They frequently rely on revenue raised by natural resources, like oil or land. In another surprise twist, Trump suggested the wealth fund could buy TikTok, whose fate has been up in the air since a law requiring its Chinese owner ByteDance to either sell it on national security grounds or face a ban that took effect on January 19. Trump, after taking office on January 20, signed an executive order seeking to delay by 75 days the enforcement of the law. Trump has said that he was in talks with multiple people over TikTok's purchase and would likely have a decision on the app's future in February. The popular app has about 170 million American users. "We're going to be doing something, perhaps with TikTok, and perhaps not," Trump said. "If we make the right deal, we'll do it. Otherwise, we won't...we might put that in the sovereign wealth fund."Published By: Nandini YadavPublished On: Feb 4, 2025Tune InAlso read |  Donald Trump wants Gulf of Mexico to be renamed to Gulf of America, Google quickly agrees to make the changeAlso read |  Elon Musk is making DOGE work 17 hours a dayAlso read |  Deep Research: After Operator, OpenAI unveils next-gen AI agent, Sam Altman says it is like a superpower

Headline: iPhones are getting their first-ever native porn appHot Tub, the first and only porn app for iPhones, has been launched in the EU market. While Apple has opposed the decision, an alternative app store has approved it.
Content:
Altstore, an alternative app store for iOS, has approved listing a native porn app on iPhones and iPads.  The app, Hot Tub, has been launched in the European market. According to Altstore, the app has completed all approval hurdles, including Europe’s Digital Markets Act (DMA). On the other hand, Apple is not happy, and neither supports this decision, saying this will hamper safety and security among users, especially kids. The Hot Tub is only available for the European market and is currently free for use. advertisementWhat is a Hot Tub app for iPhones? The Hot Tub is an aggregator that offers iOS users a way to search and play videos from a variety of adult websites, including Pornhub, Xvideos, XNXX, and XHamster. That said, these websites have always been available on the internet. Still, according to the reports, DMA has allowed the app to be listed for iPhones and iPads through alternative marketplaces in the EU. 
 


Hence, currently, only the users in Europe can use this app, but it is in the beta phase for now.  The Hot Tub is an aggregator that offers iOS users a way to search and play videos from a variety of adult websites, including Pornhub, Xvideos, XNXX, and XHamster. That said, these websites have always been available on the internet. Still, according to the reports, DMA has allowed the app to be listed for iPhones and iPads through alternative marketplaces in the EU. 
 


 Hence, currently, only the users in Europe can use this app, but it is in the beta phase for now.  The app description states, “The app promises a private and secure way to browse adult content, without ads or tracking. An elegant, native porn app. Thoughtfully designed, ethically made, and free to use", according to the TechCrunch report. The app promotes itself as a native alternative to adult websites, offering a seamless experience free from ads, trackers, and intrusive pop-ups. It includes built-in search, gesture controls, and customisable settings, along with exclusive subscriber perks such as advanced search options, filtering, and access to categorised content across multiple platforms.But, what is an alternative app store, and why is Apple’s approval not needed?  Last year, the European Union took away Apple's right to be the only app store for iPhones and iPads, citing its monopoly and high commissions.  Alternative app store publishers now have the power to decide which types of apps they want to allow, including those that would typically violate Apple’s App Store Guidelines. According to Apple’s support documentation, apps on these alternative stores must still undergo a notarisation process to meet basic platform integrity standards. However, Apple cautions that these alternative stores can choose to distribute apps that include controversial content, such as pornography, drugs, alcohol, weapons, and hate speech. AltStore claims that the Hot Tub app is the first to successfully pass the notarisation process for distribution on iPhones. Despite the app’s explicit content, AltStore states they encountered no issues with getting it approved. This is likely because Apple has often cited pornography as an example of the types of apps they are now required to permit under the Digital Markets Act (DMA).Apple is against AltStore's Hot Tub porn app Apple has always been very careful with the safety and security of its users. But now, thanks to the EU’s Digital Markets Act, iPhone users have other ways to install other apps. AltStore Pal is among the first alternative markets for iPhone users. It went live in April 2024 and has grown to include utilities and apps, which were once banned by Apple, like game emulators.  And now with a porn app, Hot Tub, Apple said that it is deeply concerned about the safety risks. In a statement, reported by TechCrunch, Apple said that such apps undermine consumers' trust and confidence in its ecosystem. It said, “Contrary to the false statements made by the marketplace developer, we certainly do not approve of this app and would never offer it in our App Store. The truth is that we are required by the European Commission to allow it to be distributed by marketplace operators like AltStore and Epic who may not share our concerns for user safety.” Apple also highlighted that AltStore is backed by Epic Games, the Fortnite maker that sued Apple over antitrust issues.Published By: Unnati GusainPublished On: Feb 4, 2025Also read |  Donald Trump signs order to create sovereign wealth fund, says it could help facilitate TikTok US saleAlso read |  Donald Trump says Elon Musk is a smart guy and is doing a great job as DOGE headAlso read |  Donald Trump wants Gulf of Mexico to be renamed to Gulf of America, Google quickly agrees to make the changeMust Watch

Headline: Samsung Galaxy S26 Ulta tipped to get under-display selfie cameraThe dust hasn't even settled on the recently launched Galaxy S25 series and we have already started hearing rumours about Samsung's next-generation Ultra flagship.
Content:
Samsung recently launched the Galaxy S25 series, but rumours about the next-generation flagship, the Galaxy S26 Ultra, are already making the rounds. According to a tipster on X (formerly Twitter), early prototypes of the Galaxy S26 Ultra are missing a visible selfie camera cutout on the display. This suggests that Samsung might be planning to introduce an under-display camera for its next flagship smartphone.

Source: @kro_roe/ X (formerly Twitter)
 If the rumour about the under-display selfie camera is true, this would be a big shift in Samsung’s design approach for its slab phones. The company has already experimented with under-display cameras in its foldable Galaxy Z Fold lineup, but the technology has often been criticised for compromising photo quality. For the Galaxy S26 Ultra, Samsung will need to improve the camera’s performance to avoid disappointing users, especially those who prioritise selfies and video calls. However, it’s important to note that these are very early prototypes, and a lot can change before the phone’s official launch. While the rumour is interesting, it’s worth taking it with a pinch of salt for now. If Samsung does move forward with this design, it would join brands like Nubia, which have already released smartphones with under-display cameras outside the Indian market. In addition to the potential under-display camera, previous rumours suggested that the S26 Ultra might actually be rebranded as the Galaxy S26 Note, reviving the beloved Note series name. The device is also expected to feature a brighter and more power-efficient display compared to its predecessor, along with a 200-megapixel periscope telephoto camera.  Meanwhile, the recently launched Galaxy S25 Ultra is already up for pre-orders in India and worldwide. Priced starting at Rs 1,29,999 for the 256GB storage variant, the Galaxy S25 Ultra is the top-of-the-line model in the S25 series. It features a 6.9-inch AMOLED display, a titanium build, and Corning’s Gorilla Armor 2, which is touted as the most scratch-resistant glass yet. The phone is also slimmer and lighter than last year’s S24 Ultra. One of the standout features of the Galaxy S25 Ultra is its built-in S Pen. However, for what it’s worth, Bluetooth connectivity for the S Pen is no longer there, as Samsung believes that only a small percentage of its users actually use the air gestures and wireless features. Apart from this, the Galaxy S25 Ultra features an impressive camera setup. Headline: Salesforce set to cut 1000 roles due to AI, impacted employees may have option to reapply internallySalesforce is likely laying off 1,000 employees as part of ongoing restructuring. The company is currently expanding its employee count in AI-driven product sales and is expected to cut jobs in other departments before the start of fiscal year 2025.
Content: Salesforce is once again preparing for job cuts as part of its restructuring plans ahead of the new fiscal year. Bloomberg reports that the upcoming job cuts at the American cloud-based software company will impact more than 1,000 employees. However, the affected employees will be allowed to apply for other positions internally. The report of more layoffs at Salesforce comes amid the company’s ongoing hiring efforts to bring in employees to boost the sales of its AI-driven products. Although Salesforce has not yet released an official statement regarding the new job cuts, these layoffs are likely to occur before the company starts its new fiscal year. Salesforce is likely to report its quarterly earnings on February 26, 2025. Notably, Salesforce has been announcing job cuts since the tech industry was hit by mass layoffs in 2023. Following large-scale layoffs by tech giants such as Google, Microsoft, and others, Salesforce also reportedly laid off 10 percent of its total workforce—approximately 8,000 employees—in 2023. These job cuts were part of the company’s restructuring efforts to streamline operations and address a slowdown in sales. The job cuts at Salesforce continue in 2024. In January 2024, The Wall Street Journal reported that the company was laying off about 700 employees. Before entering fiscal year 2024, the company reportedly had nearly 73,000 employees. Later, in July 2024, Bloomberg News reported that Salesforce had cut around 300 additional positions. Amid these phased job cuts, the company has been actively hiring employees to support its AI division. In December 2024, Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff announced that the company had closed more than 1,000 paid deals for its AI-powered virtual representative platform, AgentForce. However, Salesforce is not the only company continuing to shake the tech world with layoffs. In January 2025, Meta announced plans to cut around 5 percent of its workforce. These job cuts are said to target the lowest-performing employees, with plans to backfill their roles later this year. In a memo sent to employees, Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said: "I’ve decided to raise the bar on performance management and move out low performers faster. We typically manage people who aren’t meeting expectations over the course of a year, but now we’re going to do more extensive performance-based cuts during this cycle." According to the memo, Meta plans to reduce its workforce by 10 percent by the end of the current performance cycle, including 5 percent in 2024. This will affect employees who have been with the company long enough to receive a performance rating. Zuckerberg added that the company will offer generous severance packages to those impacted.Published By: Divya BhatiPublished On: Feb 4, 2025Also Read |  iPhone SE4 expected to arrive next month?
