Headline: Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge full specs leak, will it be better than standard Galaxy S25?The key specifications of the Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge have leaked online, giving us a glimpse of what to expect and some idea of whether this model could be superior to the standard Galaxy S25.
Content: Samsung has already unveiled its Galaxy S25 series, and while the flagship lineup has grabbed attention for delivering an impressive smartphone experience, excitement is now building for the upcoming Galaxy S25 Edge. While Samsung has teased the design of the device, it has kept the feature details under wraps. However, thanks to tipster Yogesh Brar, key specifications of the Galaxy S25 Edge have surfaced, giving us a glimpse of what to expect and some idea of whether this model could be superior to the standard Galaxy S25.advertisementSamsung Galaxy S25 Edge specs leakedBrar's leaked information aligns with earlier reports, suggesting that the Galaxy S25 Edge will sport a 6.6-inch OLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. It could be powered by Qualcomm's latest Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset. The device is tipped to house a 3,900mAh battery with 25W fast charging and a dual rear camera system featuring a 200-megapixel primary camera and a 50-megapixel ultra-wide sensor. These specs indicate a strong performance profile, but can it top the standard Galaxy S25?Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge: Will it be better than standard Galaxy S25?The upcoming Galaxy S25 Edge could be positioned between the standard S25 and the S25+ models, or possibly even surpass the S25+. The camera setup, which closely resembles the S25 Ultra’s system with its 200-megapixel main sensor and 50-megapixel ultra-wide lens, suggests that the Edge model might offer a superior camera experience compared to both the standard S25 and S25+. However, it may lack the telephoto lens found on the S25 Ultra, positioning the Edge as a middle ground between affordability and premium features.advertisement Brar's leaked information aligns with earlier reports, suggesting that the Galaxy S25 Edge will sport a 6.6-inch OLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. It could be powered by Qualcomm's latest Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset. The device is tipped to house a 3,900mAh battery with 25W fast charging and a dual rear camera system featuring a 200-megapixel primary camera and a 50-megapixel ultra-wide sensor. These specs indicate a strong performance profile, but can it top the standard Galaxy S25?Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge: Will it be better than standard Galaxy S25? The upcoming Galaxy S25 Edge could be positioned between the standard S25 and the S25+ models, or possibly even surpass the S25+. The camera setup, which closely resembles the S25 Ultra’s system with its 200-megapixel main sensor and 50-megapixel ultra-wide lens, suggests that the Edge model might offer a superior camera experience compared to both the standard S25 and S25+. However, it may lack the telephoto lens found on the S25 Ultra, positioning the Edge as a middle ground between affordability and premium features. One of the key factors setting the Edge apart is its potential use of tandem OLED display technology. This tech, previously seen on Apple's iPad Pro, eliminates the need for a backlight, allowing for a thinner profile while still offering a bright, expansive display. With Samsung incorporating this innovation into the Edge, it is reportedly able to achieve a slim 6.4mm profile, making it the thinnest smartphone on the market. However, the company is not expected to price it lower than the standard Galaxy S25 model. The leaks also suggest that the Galaxy S25 Edge will share the same Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset as the other S25 models, so you can expect gaming and performance benchmarks to remain similar across the series. However, the Edge’s slimmer form factor, large tandem OLED display tech, and S25 Ultra-like rear camera setup might give it an edge over the S25+ model.  The Galaxy S25 Edge is rumoured to have a smaller 3,900 battery than its counterparts, which might affect its longevity compared to the standard and Plus models. However, whether Samsung will use advanced silicon-carbon battery tech for better power retention is still unknown. For your reference, the S25 has a 4,000mAh battery, the S25+ features a 4,900mAh unit and S25 Ultra offers a 5,000mAh battery.Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge: How much it may cost in India? Samsung could place the Galaxy S25 Edge as a potential bridge between the S25+ and S25 Ultra, offering consumers a premium option without the Ultra’s higher price tag. With the standard Galaxy S25 priced at Rs 80,999, the Plus model at Rs 99,999, and the Ultra starting at Rs 1,29,999, the Edge might fit comfortably in this lineup. While these leaks paint an exciting picture, nothing has been officially confirmed. Hence, users are advised to take the details with a pinch of salt. You can stay tuned to India Today tech for the latest updates.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Feb 10, 2025

Headline: iPad 11 said to receive minor upgradesAfter a gap of nearly two and a half years, Apple is finally expected to unveil its successor, the iPad 11, in the coming months. However, despite the long wait, rumours suggest, the upgrade might be minimal.
Content: Apple’s entry-level iPad hasn’t seen an update since October 2022, when the company introduced the 10th-generation model. After a gap of nearly two and a half years, Apple is finally expected to unveil its successor, the iPad 11, in the coming months. However, despite the long wait, rumours suggest, the upgrade might be minimal, with the biggest change being an internal chip refresh. The biggest upgrade for the iPad 11 will likely be its processor. Reports suggest Apple will move from the A14 Bionic chip, which powered the iPad 10, to the A17 Pro chip. This is the same chip found in the iPhone 15 Pro and should provide a noticeable performance boost. The A17 Pro is expected to be about 40 per cent faster in terms of CPU performance compared to the A14, which should result in smoother multitasking, gaming, and overall responsiveness. Additionally, Apple is said to be doubling the RAM from 4GB to 8GB. This upgrade should improve app performance, allowing more applications to remain open in the background. With this hardware improvement, the iPad 11 is also expected to support Apple Intelligence, Apple’s suite of AI-driven features that includes Genmoji, Image Playground, and an improved Siri. While some reports claim the A17 Pro chip is a certainty for the iPad 11, a conflicting leak suggests otherwise. An anonymous source on X (formerly Twitter) had earlier claimed the iPad 11 may instead feature an A16 chip with 6GB RAM. If true, this would mean the new model wouldn't meet Apple’s minimum requirements for Apple Intelligence, as Apple currently restricts AI features to devices running at least an A17 Pro chip with 8GB of RAM. It is possible that Apple could offer two different models at different price points — one with an A16 chip for budget-conscious buyers and another with an A17 Pro chip for those who want AI capabilities. Apple has yet to confirm any details, so this remains speculation for now. Beyond the processor, there aren’t many expected changes. Apple may update connectivity by adding Wi-Fi 6E and Bluetooth 5.3, but otherwise, the design is likely to remain the same. The base storage could also be increased from 64GB to 128GB, which would be a welcome change given the growing size of apps and media files. Another wildcard feature could be Stage Manager, which Apple introduced in iPadOS 16 but has so far only been available on iPads with M1 chips or newer. If the iPad 11 gets an A17 Pro with 8GB RAM, it might finally be able to support this feature, but there’s no confirmation yet. The iPad 10 launched at $449 (Rs 44,900 in India) but received a price cut to $349 (Rs 34,900 in India) in mid-2024. If Apple sticks to the same pricing structure, the iPad 11 could offer good value for those looking for a reliable tablet without spending too much. Apple is expected to announce the iPad 11 in March or April 2025, but official details are still under wraps.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Feb 10, 2025Also read |  Poco X7, X7 Pro review: Which is best for you?Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  Can't see notifications on your Samsung phone anymore? Headline: Nothing confirms Phone 3a series is being manufactured in IndiaAhead of the Phone 3a series launch, Nothing has announced that the series is being manufactured in India. The launch is scheduled for March 4.
Content:
Nothing has revealed that the Phone 3a series is being purely Made-in-India. In a press note, the company has announced that the Phone 3a series is being manufactured in India. The note states, "This aligns with the company’s commitment to harnessing India’s rich manufacturing ecosystem, investing in the local economy, and fostering technological innovation." It also highlights that Nothing has significantly contributed to job creation, with over 500 employees in their factory in Chennai, where the Phone 3a series is being manufactured, with 95 per cent of the employees being women. This facility plays a key role in producing the Nothing Phone 3a series, highlighting the brand’s dedication to local manufacturing. As Nothing grows in India, it is also expanding its local workforce, reinforcing its support for the ‘Make in India’ initiative, adds the note.

 



Credit: Nothing
Nothing Phone 3a series: India launch  After much anticipation, the company has officially announced that the Nothing Phone 3a and Phone 3a Pro will launch on March 4. Additionally, Flipkart has confirmed that the devices will be available on its platform. The launch event is scheduled for 3:30 PM IST.
 advertisement


Nothing Phone 3a series: What to expect  Nothing Phone 3a: The Nothing Phone 3a is expected to bring major upgrades, featuring a 6.8-inch OLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate—the largest screen on a Nothing phone so far. It will reportedly be powered by the Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 chipset, moving away from the MediaTek Dimensity processor used in the Phone 2a, and will run Nothing OS 3.1, based on Android 15.   A recent design leak suggests that the Phone 3a might introduce a new pill-shaped triple-camera system. The leaked image shows the device covered in a hard case, likely to keep its design under wraps until the official launch. However, it still reveals Nothing’s first triple-camera setup, arranged horizontally with an LED flash placed above. Interestingly, a recent teaser from Nothing shows a similar camera module but in a vertical layout instead.  

 



Nothing Phone 3a design leak (Credit: X/ @techiboy96)
 According to Android Headlines, both the Phone 3a and Phone 3a Pro will be available in two colours. Both models will come in Black, though it’s unclear if they’ll have the exact same shade. Additionally, the Nothing Phone 3a 5G will be offered in White, while the Pro variant will come in Gray.   Leaks suggest a big camera upgrade, with the Phone 3a expected to feature a 50-megapixel primary sensor and a 50-megapixel telephoto camera with 2x optical zoom—the first time Nothing has included a telephoto lens. However, this might come at the cost of the ultra-wide sensor, which is rumoured to be downgraded to 8-megapixel. For selfies, a 32-megapixel front camera will be placed in a hole-punch cutout, similar to previous models.   The battery is expected to remain at 5,000mAh with 45W wired charging, just like the Phone 2a. Other features include NFC support and Nothing’s signature Glyph lighting.   Nothing Phone 3a Pro: Instead of a "Plus" model, Nothing is reportedly introducing a "Pro" variant in the Phone 3a series. However, details about the Pro version remain limited. Leaks suggest it will be available in a single 12GB RAM + 256GB storage option.   Since this information is based on leaks and rumours, it’s best to take it with caution. Headline: Poco X7 Pro 5G gets Rs 3,000 discount but it is only for select usersThe Poco X7 Pro 5G, which was launched at Rs 27,999, is currently selling at Rs 24,999, and it is an offer worth considering.
Content: Poco launched the Poco X7 and Poco X7 Pro smartphones in India in January this year. Just a month later, the Poco X7 Pro is getting a temporary price cut, and it’s a pretty good deal that is worth considering. At the time of launch, the Poco X7 Pro 5G was priced starting at Rs 27,999 in India. However, for Valentine’s, Poco has announced a limited time offer on the smartphone under which the Poco X7 Pro is selling at a discount of Rs 3,000, bringing its price down to Rs 24,999. We did a long-term review of the phone and found it to be a “proper powerhouse”. “If you’re looking for a phone that punches way above its weight, the Poco X7 Pro is the one to go for,” we wrote in our review of the Poco X7 Pro 5G. “From its top-tier performance and gorgeous flat display to that massive 6,550mAh battery and 90W charging, it’s a phone that feels like it should cost way more than it does,” we had noted at the time of launch when the device was priced at Rs 27,999. The deal, while sweet, is available only for a limited time. This offer is part of the Valentine week sale on Flipkart, which started on February 7 and will go on till February 14. Also, this discount will only be available on purchase made via SBI and ICICI Bank credit and debit card. Poco X7 Pro 5G: Specifications The Poco X7 Pro features a 6.87-inch 1.5K AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. The device is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 8400 Ultra chipset and comes in two RAM variants, 8GB and 12GB. Both RAM variants offer 256GB storage. Headline: Xiaomi 15 Ultra may launch this month: Release date, India price, specs and moreXiaomi 15 Ultra is expected to release this month. Pre-reservation for the smartphone is already live in China.
Content: Xiaomi launched the Xiaomi 15 and Xiaomi 15 Pro smartphones in China in October 2024. They were the first smartphones in the world to feature the new Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset. And now, the company is getting ready to launch its most premium phone in the series –– the Xiaomi 15 Ultra. Just like its predecessor, the phone’s camera will be its primary focus. We tested the Xiaomi 14 Ultra last year, and we found it to be the best Android flagship phone of 2024.  Xiaomi 15 Ultra is rumoured to launch as early as the end of February. A big reason to believe so is because pre-reservations for the smartphone in China have begun. Another hint at a possible sooner launch of the Xiaomi 15 Ultra comes from GSMArena, which has shared a leaked promotional poster of the phone, according to which, it could launch on February 26. As is the tradition, if the release date is right, on February 26, Xiaomi will first launch the Xiaomi 15 Ultra in China, and then it will eventually bring it to the global and Indian market in the following month.  Earlier, there were reports that the phone would launch in March 2025. Last year, the Xiaomi 14 Ultra was launched in India in March. Which means, if the phone is launched in China this month, we can expect it to launch in India in March this year too.  The Xiaomi 15 Ultra is expected to feature some significant upgrades over its predecessor. For instance, leaks suggest that it will sport a quad-camera setup, including a 50-megapixel primary sensor, a 50-megapixel telephoto lens with 3x optical zoom, a 200-megapixel periscope telephoto sensor — possibly similar to what we’ve seen on the Vivo X200 Pro — and a 50-megapixel ultra-wide lens. Additionally, the main sensor is rumoured to be a 1-inch unit with an f/1.63 aperture, promising improved low-light performance. Besides that, the Xiaomi 15 Ultra, just like the Xiaomi 15 and Xiaomi 15 Pro, is pretty much confirmed to feature the new Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset. The smartphone is expected to feature up to 16GB RAM and 1TB storage. Further, reports suggest that the Xiaomi 15 Ultra will likely feature a 2K quad-curved panel. The phone is rumoured to support 90W wired and wireless charging, and will sport a battery capacity of 5,000mAh, the same as the Xiaomi 14 Ultra. The Xiaomi 15 Ultra is also believed to come with an ultrasonic fingerprint sensor and improved durability, with potential IP68 and IP69 certifications for water and dust resistance.Xiaomi 15 Ultra: Expected price in India  Xiaomi has yet to disclose anything about the Xiaomi 15 Ultra’s launch yet, so of course nothing about the pricing is official. However, if we look at the price of the Xiaomi 14 Ultra, which was launched in India at Rs 99,999 for the 16GB RAM and 512GB storage variant, we get a good hint at how the 15 Ultra could possibly be priced. Assuming the device is going to feature improvements in terms of storage, display, and camera, we believe a slight increase in price should be expected. Headline: OnePlus Watch 3 is coming, company confirms launch date and battery detailsThe OnePlus Watch 3 will be introduced soon. Headline: Elon Musk offers $97 billion to buy OpenAI, Sam Altman rejectsElon Musk with a few more investors proposed a buyout offer of $97 billion to OpenAI CEO Sam Altman. But, Altman rejected the proposal, saying "no thank you".
Content:
Elon Musk, after previously suing OpenAI, has now made an attempt to purchase the company. Recent reports reveal that Musk, along with a group of investors, approached CEO Sam Altman with an offer to buy out OpenAI for $97 billion. However, Altman declined the offer, responding with a firm, "no thank you.” According to the Wall Street Journal report, Musk and his investment group have officially proposed to OpenAI’s board to take control of the company and return it to its nonprofit origins.  Marc Toberoff, Musk’s lawyer, stated, "If Sam Altman and the current board want OpenAI to become a fully for-profit company, it’s important that the charity is fairly compensated for losing control of such groundbreaking technology." In response, Altman rejected the offer in a post on Musk’s social media platform, X, saying, "No thanks, but we’d be willing to buy Twitter for $9.74 billion if you’re interested." This was a playful reference to Musk's $44 billion purchase of Twitter, now X, in 2022.
 


 Musk proposed this offer after suing OpenAI two times in 2024. The first time, in July 2024, he accused the company of acting in a way that diverged from its founding principles, particularly its shift toward a more commercialised, profit-driven structure. Musk felt this shift put OpenAI's work at risk of being controlled by corporate interests rather than focusing on the broader benefits for humanity. This legal battle highlighted tensions between Musk’s vision for AI as an open, nonprofit endeavour and OpenAI’s pursuit of growth and profitability. In August 2024, Musk again filed a new lawsuit and accused OpenAI of racing to develop powerful “artificial general intelligence” technology to “maximize profits.” Musk also accused the company of engaging in racketeering. Elon Musk's lawsuit against OpenAI stems from a growing conflict between him and the company he helped found. Musk was one of the initial backers of OpenAI, a nonprofit organisation focused on artificial intelligence. However, over time, he became increasingly unhappy with the direction the company was taking, especially after it shifted to a "capped-profit" model, which he felt compromised its original mission. Musk has also expressed concerns about OpenAI's leadership and its potential influence over AI technology.mbedded entity widgetPublished By: Unnati GusainPublished On: Feb 11, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Oppo Find N5 official images out, reveal what OnePlus Open 2 will look likeOppo Find N5 is confirmed to launch on February 20. Ahead of the launch, a bunch of official images of the phone have surfaced on social media giving us a good idea about what the OnePlus Open 2 would look like.
Content:
Oppo has confirmed that the Oppo Find N5 foldable smartphone will be launched globally on February 20 in Singapore. Ahead of the launch, a lot of reviewers are sharing images of the Find N5 they have been testing, along with official teasers that Oppo has put out. But Oppo never brings the Find N-series to India, so why should you care about this? Well, there is a very good reason why. The next-generation OnePlus foldable phone, which will likely be called the OnePlus Open 2, is expected to closely resemble the Oppo Find N5. Go back and compare the OnePlus Open and the Oppo Find N3, if you will.  For the uninitiated, OnePlus and Oppo have shared design and engineering efforts, as they both operate under BBK Electronics. The primary difference you see between the two is in the software and branding.  
 


 Coming back to the images. Oppo has been teasing the Oppo Find N5 as the thinnest foldable smartphone in the world, and the images are proof enough to believe that. The current title of the slimmest foldable is held by the Honor Magic V3, which measures 4.35mm when unfolded and 9.2mm when folded. Reports suggest that the Find N5 could measure 4mm when unfolded. We have been seeing all the teasers and images of the phone, and it looks a lot like last year’s Oppo Find N3 aka the OnePlus Open. It has the same round camera module, and the device continues to feature Hasselblad cameras. The design seems to be largely unchanged over the last generation foldable. 
 advertisement


Additionally, official images also reveal that the Oppo Find N5 will continue to feature those slightly thicker bezels that we also saw on the OnePlus Open. The selfie camera's positioning on the phone will also remain unchanged –– it will be placed on top-right corner on the inner display.Meanwhile, there have also been reports speculating about the specifications of the phone. The Oppo Find N5 and the OnePlus Open 2 are believed to feature the new Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset. The new foldables are expected to get a big upgrade in terms of battery though. From the OnePlus Open’s 4,800mAh battery, the OnePlus Open 2 may sport a massive 6,000mAh battery. If true, that is especially impressive considering it’s a foldable phone, and at that it carries claims of being the slimmest foldable in the world. The Oppo Find N5 aka OnePlus Open 2 will also support satellite communication. The new foldable will also fix one big hiccup of the OnePlus Open –– the lack of wireless charging support. Headline: Samsung Galaxy S26 battery details tipped, might launch with monster capacitySamsung Galaxy S26 is rumoured to sport a big battery, which might go up to 7000mAh. This is a significant improvement over its predecessor, Galaxy S25, with 4000mAh.
Content:
After the launch of the Galaxy S25 series, Samsung is planning major upgrades for the upcoming flagship series. The Galaxy S26 series is expected to be announced next year, but the rumours and leaks are making the rounds. For instance, based on the rumours, S26 is anticipated to feature an under-display camera for its next flagship smartphone and a 200-megapixel periscope telephoto camera. Now, the latest leak indicates that the next-gen phones are to bring a "monster battery". It states that the Galaxy S26 could pack 6000mAh to 7000mAh battery. advertisementSamsung Galaxy S26 battery specsA new report from FNNews suggests that Samsung plans to use silicon carbon batteries in the Galaxy S26. This new technology could allow for a much larger battery—around 6,000 mAh to 7,000 mAh—without increasing the phone’s size. Several well-known leakers support the idea that future Galaxy S models will have higher battery capacities.  Silicon carbon batteries store more energy in the same space compared to traditional lithium-ion batteries. By adjusting the graphite-to-silicon ratio, they offer greater capacity. We’ve already seen this technology in phones like the Honor Magic 7 Pro, which successfully incorporated a silicon carbon battery. If implemented correctly, this upgrade could be a major improvement.

If this holds true then Samsung Galaxy S26 is up for major improvement, especially for its battery. Currently, the company has launched its Galaxy S25 series with battery specs ranging from 4000mAh to 5000mAh. The Galaxy S25 (base variant) packs a 4000mAh battery, S25+ has 4900mAh and S25 Ultra has 5000mAh. But a jump in this segment would be a much appreciated and welcome move. Samsung Galaxy S26 specs leak  The Samsung Galaxy S25 series just launched less than a month ago, and yet the next-gen models are already making headlines. The Galaxy S26 series has seen several leaks and rumours. Apart from the latest battery leak, the display and camera specs has also been speculated.  A tipster on X (formerly Twitter) claims that early prototypes of the Galaxy S26 Ultra don’t have a visible selfie camera cutout. This hints that Samsung may be planning to introduce an under-display camera for its next flagship.   If true, this would mark a major design shift for Samsung’s standard smartphones. The company has tested under-display cameras in its foldable Galaxy Z Fold series, but the technology has faced criticism for reduced photo quality. To make this work on the Galaxy S26 Ultra, Samsung will need to improve image performance to meet the expectations of users who rely on selfies and video calls. Another rumour claims that the upcoming phones will use a 200-megapixel periscope telephoto camera with a 1/1.5-inch sensor.  For comparison, the Vivo X200 Pro (read the review here) already boasts a 200-megapixel periscope telephoto camera with a slightly larger 1/1.4-inch sensor. If Samsung moves forward with this plan, the Galaxy S26 Ultra—possibly rebranded as the S26 Note—could see a major boost in zoom capabilities.   The Samsung Galaxy S25 features a 50-megapixel f/1.8 main sensor, a 12-megapixel f/2.2 ultra-wide camera with a 120-degree field of view, and a 10-megapixel f/2.4 telephoto lens with 3x optical zoom. On the front, it has a 12-megapixel f/2.2 selfie camera.  
These specs remain unchanged from last year, but while Samsung hasn’t upgraded the camera hardware, it has enhanced the editing tools and AI-powered features to improve the overall photography experience. But, as rumoured, if the upcoming phones enhance the camera specs as well, it might be up for a significant improvement. Headline: OpenAI said to be making its own AI chip: What does this mean?OpenAI is reportedly in the final stages of designing its first in-house AI processor and is expected to send it for fabrication in the coming months.
Content: OpenAI is reportedly developing its own AI chip to reduce its reliance on Nvidia. The company is in the final stages of designing its first in-house AI processor and is expected to send it for fabrication in the coming months. TSMC has been named as the manufacturing partner, with mass production planned for 2026. Currently, Nvidia is the undisputed leader in this field, whose chips currently hold about 80 per cent market share in AI computing. While Nvidia remains the go-to supplier for AI processors, tech giants like Microsoft, Meta, and Google have been investing heavily in alternatives to lessen dependence on a single supplier.advertisementWhy is OpenAI making its own chip?Building a custom AI chip could give OpenAI better control over its hardware and software integration, ultimately optimising performance for its own AI models. Right now, Nvidia’s chips are the backbone of many AI projects, including OpenAI’s ChatGPT, but securing these chips has become increasingly expensive and competitive.By designing its own processor, OpenAI can fine-tune its hardware to match its needs while also having better negotiating power with Nvidia and other suppliers. However, this isn’t a small undertaking. Industry estimates suggest that a single version of a new chip can cost around $500 million, with additional costs for software and infrastructure doubling that figure. Building a custom AI chip could give OpenAI better control over its hardware and software integration, ultimately optimising performance for its own AI models. Right now, Nvidia’s chips are the backbone of many AI projects, including OpenAI’s ChatGPT, but securing these chips has become increasingly expensive and competitive. By designing its own processor, OpenAI can fine-tune its hardware to match its needs while also having better negotiating power with Nvidia and other suppliers. However, this isn’t a small undertaking. Industry estimates suggest that a single version of a new chip can cost around $500 million, with additional costs for software and infrastructure doubling that figure. Although OpenAI is pushing forward with its custom chip plans, there’s no guarantee of success. The first batch of chips, known as tape-out, could face issues, requiring redesigns and additional time before a fully functional chip is ready for large-scale use. Typically, the process from design finalisation to manufacturing takes about six months, but OpenAI could pay extra to speed up production. OpenAI’s chip will initially have a limited role, primarily focused on running AI models rather than training them. The company, however, has ambitions to develop more advanced processors in the future. TSMC is said to be using its 3-nanometre process technology to manufacture OpenAI’s chip. The design will reportedly include high-bandwidth memory (HBM) and a systolic array architecture, similar to what Nvidia uses in its chips.What does this mean? If OpenAI successfully creates its own chip, it will have more control over how it processes data for AI training and won’t have to rely as much on Nvidia. Apple, for example, currently uses Amazon chips to train its Apple Intelligence models but is also said to be working with Broadcom to develop its own AI chip. Other big companies like Meta and Microsoft are investing billions in AI technology. Meanwhile, a Chinese startup called DeepSeek has recently shown that powerful AI models can be built using fewer computer chips.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Feb 11, 2025Also read |  Poco X7, X7 Pro review: Which is best for you?Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  Can't see notifications on your Samsung phone anymore? Headline: AI will be the most profound shift of our lifetimes, says Sundar Pichai at Paris AI SummitAt the ongoing AI Action Summit in Paris, Google CEO Sundar Pichai talked about the importance of AI and how it can improve the quality of life.
Content: At the AI Action Summit in Paris, global leaders, policy makers, and tech executives have come together to discuss the future of AI and its far-reaching implications. Prime minister Narendra Modi is co-chair at the event, and it is being hosted by French president Emmanuel Macron. The event will also be attended by OpenAI CEO Sam Altman. Google CEO Sundar Pichai also spoke on day 1 of the event, talking about how “AI will be the most profound shift of our lifetime”. Speaking at the event, Pichai said that AI has surpassed even the transition to personal computing or mobile. “AI will do more to democratise access to information than the internet itself,” he said. Pichai also highlighted the rapid progress in AI development. He gave an example of how the cost of processing AI tokens has dropped by 97 per cent in just 18 months making AI tools more accessible.  Pichai had to discuss Gemini, of course. But before that, he spoke about the Transformer architecture, which is believed to be a breakthrough from Google, and Pichai says it serves as the foundation for today’s generative AI models.  The Google CEO also spoke in detail about Gemini 2.0 and its ability to think and process text, images, video, audio, and code all at once. And with these tools is how Pichai thinks AI is able to create new experiences for users. He mentioned tools like NotebookLM, which allow users to transform dense documents into engaging audio overviews. Pichai also mentioned how AI is helping humans beyond just productivity tools. He talked about using AI for research discoveries, referencing AlphaFold, a project that helped Google DeepMind achieve breakthrough in predicting protein structures, that has in turn helped in cancer research, vaccine development, and enzyme engineering. He also spoke about quantum computing, which a Google engineer recently said would get real-world applications in the next five years. However, despite all the benefits that Pichai counted, he warns that AI needs to be dealt with caution. He urged global leaders to invest in AI education, infrastructure, and regulation while ensuring the technology remains ethical and accessible.  Pichai’s speech at the Paris AI Summit comes on the heels of a recent announcement by the company that ended its pledge to never use AI technology for weapons and surveillance. This was part of an update in the Responsible AI 2024 report. The new policy is a drastic shift from the company’s earlier commitment to not use AI for applications that are “likely to cause overall harm”.Published By: Nandini YadavPublished On: Feb 11, 2025Also read |  Elon Musk offers $97 billion to buy OpenAI, Sam Altman rejects it and mocks him saying we will buy X for $9BAlso read |  OpenAI said to be making its own AI chip: What does this mean?

Headline: Elon Musk calls OpenAI CEO Sam Altman a scammer over an old video clipElon Musk has reignited his feud with OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, calling him "Scam Altman" in response to an old video clip where Altman claims he has no equity in OpenAI. Musk openly calling him a scammer isn't surprising because the latest comment comes amid his ongoing criticism of the AI company he helped co-found.
Content: Elon Musk has reignited his feud with OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, calling him "Scam Altman" in response to an old video clip where Altman claims he has no equity in OpenAI. Musk openly calling him a scammer isn't surprising because the latest comment comes amid his ongoing criticism of the AI company he helped co-found. The controversy began after Musk shared a video from Altman’s testimony at a US Senate hearing in May 2023. In the clip, Altman states that he holds no equity in OpenAI and is committed to its mission out of goodwill, not personal financial gain. Musk, however, took issue with this, posting the clip on X (formerly Twitter) with the caption “Scam Altman,” suggesting that Altman was not being truthful about his role and interests in the company. This public jab is the latest in a series of attacks Musk has aimed at OpenAI and its leadership. Recently, Musk made headlines by leading a group of investors in a $97.4 billion bid to take over OpenAI’s nonprofit arm, according to The Wall Street Journal. Musk has been critical of OpenAI’s shift from its original nonprofit structure, accusing the company of prioritising profits and aligning too closely with corporate interests, particularly Microsoft. Altman, however, showed little interest in Musk’s takeover attempt and even reportedly mocked Musk by suggesting he could buy X for $9.74 billion instead. This sarcastic response seemed to trigger Musk's latest outburst on social media, where the tech mogul has frequently voiced his frustrations. The tension between Musk and Altman dates back to when Musk left OpenAI in 2018 after disagreements over the company’s direction. Under Altman’s leadership, OpenAI transitioned to a hybrid structure, allowing for-profit investments that enabled breakthroughs like the development of AI models such as ChatGPT. While this strategy attracted big funding, including from Microsoft, it has drawn Musk’s ire, with the billionaire accusing OpenAI of straying from its founding mission of ethical AI development. In response to Musk's latest attack, Altman has reportedly reassured OpenAI employees that the company’s structure protects it from external takeovers and that OpenAI’s growing success likely drives Musk’s actions.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Feb 11, 2025

Headline: What is Paris AI Summit that Modi, Sam Altman and Sundar Pichai are attendingParis is hosting an AI Action Summit, which ends today on February 11. The event is being co-chaired by PM Narendra Modi and will be attended by the likes of Sundar Pichai and Sam Altman.
Content: Paris is hosting an AI Action Summit, which kicked off on February 10 and will end on Tuesday, February 11. The summit is being attended by world leaders, top tech executives and law lawmakers, who will come together to talk about AI, its future and its implications, both good and bad. The AI Action Summit was inaugurated by the French president Emmanuel Macron, and is being co-chaired by prime minister Narendra Modi. On Monday, Google CEO Sundar Pichai also spoke at length at the event discussing the benefits of AI, and the simultaneous need for caution, regulations, and education around the technology.  Pichai said that “AI will be the most profound shift of our lifetime”. He spoke about AI being used in healthcare research, in development of quantum computing, and just making daily productivity tasks simpler with tools like NotebookLM. Meanwhile, he also urged global leaders to invest in AI education, infrastructure, and regulation while ensuring the tech remains ethical and accessible.  Later today, PM Narendra Modi and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman are also expected to speak at the event. Modi arrived in Paris this morning and received a warm welcome from French president Emmanuel Macron.  The AI Action Summit is happening against the backdrop of the recent popularity of Chinese startup DeepSeek as it launched its latest model called R1 that competes with OpenAI’s ChatGPT. The DeepSeek R1 model gained popularity for using a fraction of the cost of ChatGPT’s development while being able to be just as capable.  At the event, Modi will also be addressing the India-France CEO Forum alongside French President Emmanuel Macron. The AI Action Summit is a global conference and it is currently in its third edition. The summit was held at Bletchley Park in the United Kingdom for the first time in November 2023 which focused on the foundational aspects of AI governance and ethics. The second edition was held in May 2024 in Seoul, South Korea.Published By: Nandini YadavPublished On: Feb 11, 2025Also read |  Ahead of AI Summit, PM meets 'friend' Macron, greets JD Vance at Paris dinnerAlso read |  Google is suddenly fine with using AI for weapons and surveillanceAlso read |  AI will be the most profound shift of our lifetimes, says Sundar Pichai at Paris AI Summit

Headline: Google has officially renamed Gulf of Mexico to Gulf of AmericaGoogle Maps has updated the name of the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America for US users, following an official government change.
Content: Google Maps has officially changed the name of the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America for users in the United States, following a government decision to rename the large body of water. This update comes after an executive order signed by former US President Donald Trump, which led to the formal change by the Geographic Names Information System (GNIS), a US government database responsible for place names. Users in the United States now see the Gulf of America on Google Maps, while users in Mexico continue to see the Gulf of Mexico. For the rest of the world, both names appear side by side. Google says this follows its long-standing practice of displaying location names based on official government data, which varies by region.  The decision has drawn mixed reactions, with many questioning the need for the name change. The Gulf has historically been shared by the United States, Mexico, and Cuba, and is a critical hub for economic activities such as shipping, fishing, and energy production. Despite this, the US administration at the time argued that renaming the Gulf would better reflect America's influence over the waters. Google Maps' naming updates are determined by users' locations, based on factors such as their device settings, SIM card information, and network. On the desktop, the displayed name is tied to search settings or device location. While Google has swiftly implemented the change, other mapping services, such as Apple Maps and MapQuest, have yet to follow suit. Apple Maps, for instance, still redirects searches for the Gulf of America to the Gulf of Mexico. Google-owned Waze, meanwhile, displays both names but does not recognise Gulf of America as a standalone search term. The renaming also came with an unexpected addition: an official Gulf of America Day, designated as February 9 — the same day Donald Trump signed the executive order initiating the change. Supporters of the move see it as a patriotic rebranding, while critics argue it is unnecessary and politically motivated. While the renaming remains a US government decision, Google Maps’ update is what has made it immediately visible to millions of users.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Feb 11, 2025Also read |  Poco X7, X7 Pro review: Which is best for you?Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  Can't see notifications on your Samsung phone anymore? Headline: Woman loses over Rs 2 lakh after clicking job interview link in SMSThe victim clicked on a link she received on the SMS. However, the link was malicious and allowed hackers to take control of her phone.
Content: In yet another case of cyber fraud, a 38-year-old woman from Mangaluru ended up losing more than Rs 2 lakh to scammers. While it is a case of online fraud, it is not the usual fake parcel, digital arrest, or work-from-home scams that we have been seeing a lot lately. Instead, in this case, the scammers employed a new tactic and lured the victim with a malicious link sent through SMS. According to the case reported by Deccan Herald, the victim, Vasudha Gopalakrishna Shenoy, works as a manager at a bank branch in Belthangady. Her ordeal started when she received a text message on her mobile phone containing a link to a website named "interviewshine.co.in." Thinking it to be an advertisement for a legitimate job opportunity, she clicked on the link, unaware that it was malicious. Shortly after clicking, the victim noticed that her Gmail account and Amazon app were compromised. Through these apps, the scammers also gained access to other sensitive information, including her credit card details, and began making unauthorised transactions. Over the next few hours of her apps being compromised, the victim received multiple messages on her phone notifying her of transactions totalling Rs 2,19,500. The amount was deducted from her bank cards, Amazon cards, and credit cards. Realising she had been scammed, she immediately filed a complaint with the authorities. A case has been registered at the CEN Station under Section 66(D) of the IT Act and Sections 318(2) and 318(4) of the BNS Act. While online scams are becoming rampant in India, this particular incident highlights how scammers are using new and more sophisticated ways to trick people. In this particular case, the link attached to the SMS was likely linked to malware, and as soon as the victim clicked on it, the malware infected her phone and allowed the scammers to gain unauthorised access to her apps and bank accounts.How to stay safe To stay safe from such scams: — Never click on unknown links from unknown individuals. — If a message seems legitimate or you are interested, always verify its authenticity before clicking on any links. — Particularly, if you receive a job offer or interview link from an unknown source, cross-check with the company’s official website or contact them directly. — Be cautious of unsolicited messages containing links, especially those claiming to offer jobs, prizes, or urgent actions. You can also hover over the link to see the actual URL, and avoid clicking if it looks suspicious. — Add two-factor authentication on apps whenever possible. This may include a regular password along with Face ID or another security method. This adds an extra layer of security, making it harder for scammers to gain access. – If you think you have clicked on such links, keep a close eye on your bank and credit card statements for any unauthorized transactions. Report any suspicious activity to your bank immediately.Published By: Divya BhatiPublished On: Feb 11, 2025Also Read |  Elon Musk offers $97 billion to buy OpenAI, Sam Altman rejects it and mocks him saying we will buy X for $9BAlso Read |  Samsung Galaxy S26 battery details tipped, might launch with monster capacityAlso Read |  AI will be the most profound shift of our lifetimes, says Sundar Pichai at Paris AI Summit

Headline: Oppo Find N5 aka OnePlus Open 2 to officially debut on February 20 with DeepSeek-R1 AI assistantOppo is set to unveil the Find N5 foldable on February 20, featuring the Snapdragon 8 Elite chip, a massive 5,600mAh battery, and a possible DeepSeek-R1 AI integration.
Content: The Oppo Find N5 will be officially unveiled in Singapore on February 20. The foldable smartphone is expected to be rebranded as the OnePlus Open 2 globally, although there are no official details on this yet. Ahead of the launch, the company has confirmed some key details, including the design, chipset, battery, and a possible DeepSeek-R1 AI integration for the Find N5. Going by the official press materials shared by Oppo on the Chinese social media platform Weibo, the Find N5 will be the world’s first foldable phone powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset. Unlike the standard version, Oppo is using a special 7-core edition of the chip, internally known as SM8750-3-AB. This version features a 2+5 core setup, with two high-performance cores running at 4.32GHz and five efficiency cores at 3.53GHz.  Another major upgrade comes in the form of battery capacity. The Find N5 packs a 5,600mAh battery, making it the largest battery in an Oppo foldable yet. This is a 17 per cent increase in battery capacity from the 4,800mAh unit in its predecessor, the Find N3. However, despite the bigger battery, Oppo has managed to keep the phone’s design slim, measuring around 9.2mm when folded. The phone’s official teaser page also confirms a titanium build, unlike the Find N3’s aluminium frame. So, along with being the slimmest foldable ever, there’s a big chance it might be the lightest foldable ever too. According to lab tests, the Oppo Find N5 can record 1080p videos in extreme cold (-15°C) for up to 4.2 hours, while other foldables typically last 3.2 hours under the same conditions. In real-world use, Oppo claims it can provide up to 24 hours of video streaming and nearly 18.5 hours of online meetings. Probably the biggest addition to the Oppo Find N5 — again, as per the official press material — could be the integration of the DeepSeek-R1 AI model. This AI, introduced in early 2025, could power the Xiaobu assistant, allowing users to perform various tasks with a single phrase. For global markets, Oppo could take a different approach. The Find N5’s international version, aka the OnePlus Open 2, will reportedly integrate Google Gemini instead of DeepSeek-R1. Reports also suggest that the OnePlus Open 2 will be sold in international markets like India, the US, and Europe. That said, just like in the case of the Oppo Find N3 and OnePlus Open, the Find N5 and the Open 2 will share the same core specifications, including the chipset, battery, and AI capabilities.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Feb 11, 2025Also read |  Poco X7, X7 Pro review: Which is best for you?Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  Can't see notifications on your Samsung phone anymore? Headline: iPhone SE 4 may launch today: India price, big design overhaul and moreApple's new affordable iPhone is expected to launch on Tuesday, February 11. Although, Apple has yet to confirm the date of launch.
Content:
The launch of the iPhone SE 4 is currently the most anticipated by both Apple fans and tech journalists like us. And there are reasons to be this amped up about the launch. The SE-series by Apple is known for its affordable price tag. So that’s the first big reason. And what makes it one of the most anticipated launches of 2025 are the upgrades that are rumoured, including an iPhone 14-like design, an OLED panel, Face ID and the fact that it is tipped to be the most affordable iPhone to offer Apple Intelligence. Now, while there is no official information yet, recent reports indicate that the iPhone SE 4 could launch as soon as today.  Without giving out the exact date, last week, Bloomberg's Mark Gurman reported that the iPhone SE 4 could launch this week, along with the PowerBeats Pro 2. He also highlighted that Apple might not be interested in hosting an event and will launch the iPhone SE 4 with just a press release, as it does for its iPads. 

 



Credit: X/@MajinBu
iPhone SE 4: Expected specs and features  Before we deep dive into the details, the previous narrative around the phone was that Apple might get away with "SE" altogether. Instead, it might rebrand it as the iPhone 16e. Now, the iPhone SE 4 or iPhone 16e is set for a major makeover, moving away from its classic small design with thick bezels and a Touch ID home button. This time, it’s expected to look more like the iPhone 14, swapping Touch ID for Face ID.  

 



Credit: X/@MajinBu
advertisement Another exciting upgrade is the display. Instead of the older LCD screen, the iPhone SE 4 is rumoured to feature a larger 6.1-inch OLED display with a 60Hz refresh rate, a big step up from the 4.7-inch screen on its predecessor.   Leaked images suggest the phone will keep the SE series’ signature single-camera setup, but with a big upgrade. The rear camera is rumoured to jump from 12-megapixel to 48-megapixel, while the front camera could get a boost to 24-megapixel.  

 



Credit: X/@MajinBu
 Apple is also making changes to the body, ditching the rounded edges for a boxier design similar to recent iPhones. The power button will likely remain on the right side, just like on the iPhone 14.   There’s some debate about whether it will include the Dynamic Island feature, but it could be possible since the iPhone SE 4 is expected to run on Apple’s A18 chip, the same processor found in the iPhone 16 series. The phone is also said to come with 8GB of RAM and support Apple Intelligence, making it the most affordable iPhone with AI-powered features.iPhone SE 4: India price (Speculation) Pricing is a key factor in the iPhone SE 4’s appeal. Reports suggest it could start at $499 (around Rs 44,000), similar to the launch price of the iPhone SE 3 in India, which was Rs 43,900. However, the SE 3 later saw a price increase to Rs 49,900 due to higher taxes, so the final pricing of the SE 4 could also be affected by market conditions. Headline: Siri saves life of Apple user after he was left immobile in bathroom for 2 daysApple's voice assistant, Siri, saved the life of a 70-year-old Florida man who was stranded in his bathroom for 2 days after suffering a stroke. Siri called his daughter, who then helped him call emergency services.
Content: Once again, Apple has managed to save a life with its products and services, and this time the hero is Siri. An elderly man from Florida is extremely grateful for Apple’s voice assistant, which saved his life as he was fighting for survival alone in his house for around two days after experiencing a stroke. Siri helped him connect with his daughter, who then called 911 and ensured emergency services reached his location during those critical hours. Siri assisted 70-year-old Daniel Vallaire from Ft. Lauderdale, Florida, in connecting with his daughter via a voice prompt. According to local news outlet WSVN, Vallaire experienced a stroke and fell onto the bathroom floor. He was unable to move and tried to crawl to another room. Reportedly, he spent 48 hours lying on the bathroom floor. However, after mustering the courage to crawl into the living room, Vallaire reached near his phone and prompted Siri to call his daughter, who then contacted emergency services. “I said, ‘Siri, call Victoria Vallaire,’ and she did. If I [only] had a landline, there’s no way I would have been able to get to it,” Vallaire told WSVN. “If this had happened without [Siri], I wouldn’t be here,” he added. Apple has integrated Siri across all its products, allowing users to activate the voice assistant with a simple command: “Hey Siri.” The company recently also updated the command, enabling users to activate Siri by simply saying “Hey.” Users can also change the settings by going to Settings > Siri or Settings > Apple Intelligence & Siri, then tapping Siri or Hey Siri. To make Siri more conversational, Apple has also introduced a revamped version of Siri. The new Siri was announced with the launch of iOS 18 and the introduction of Apple Intelligence. This new Siri includes a fresh look, improved conversational capabilities, and even the ability to use ChatGPT to access information based on the user’s prompts. According to Apple, the new Siri has better conversational capabilities and can maintain the context of the user’s previous requests. Additionally, conversations with Siri are said to be more natural and personal. Meanwhile, apart from Siri, Apple has dedicated health and emergency tools like fall detection and AFib detection to help users in emergencies. With the fall detection feature on the Apple Watch, the device sends emergency notifications and connects with emergency services via the Emergency SOS via satellite system as soon as it detects fall of the users.  On the other hand, the irregular rhythm notification feature on the Apple Watch alerts users whenever the device detects a heartbeat irregularity that might suggest atrial fibrillation (AFib).Published By: Divya BhatiPublished On: Feb 11, 2025Also Read |  Woman loses over Rs 2 lakh after clicking job interview link in SMSAlso Read |  Elon Musk offers $97 billion to buy OpenAI, Sam Altman rejects it and mocks him saying we will buy X for $9BAlso Read |  Samsung Galaxy S26 battery details tipped, might launch with monster capacity

Headline: Meta fires employees who received good performance reviewsMeta has carried out another round of job cuts, letting go of almost 4,000 employees this week, including several who claim to have received positive performance reviews last year. The layoffs, part of the company's latest restructuring efforts, have sparked confusion and frustration among the affected employees.
Content: Meta has carried out another round of job cuts, letting go of almost 4,000 employees this week, including several who claim to have received positive performance reviews last year. The layoffs, part of the company's latest restructuring efforts, have sparked confusion and frustration among the affected employees. According to a report by Business Insider, a number of employees revealed that despite receiving mid-year ratings of "At or Above Expectations" in 2024, they found themselves included in the layoffs. These employees, who wished to remain anonymous, said their ratings had unexpectedly been downgraded to "Meets Most" in the year-end reviews, putting them at risk of termination. Meta had previously informed its managers to cut around 5 per cent of the company’s lowest-performing workers. However, internal documents showed that the directive allowed managers to include higher-rated employees if they couldn’t meet their targets by only laying off lower-rated staff. This information, which was not shared with the broader set of employees, left many blindsided. "When I received the email I was surprised by it mostly because I have a very solid performance history and no indicators of the last six months of performance problems," one affected employee told BI. Another employee echoed this sentiment, saying they had been given no indication from their manager that their job was in jeopardy because the worker got good performance feedback. "The hardest part is Meta publicly stating they're cutting low performers, so it feels like we have the scarlet letter on our backs," another employee told BI. "People need to know we're not underperformers." "I would certainly challenge Meta's narrative about cutting only low performers," another employee said. "I have a really, really difficult time believing I was a low performer based on past feedback I was given by my manager." A laid-off employee who got "Exceed Expectations" rating asserted that he was surprised to see his performance review feedback was changed to "Meets Most" rating.  Meta’s review process for 2024 began in December, but many employees have yet to learn their final ratings. Some workers who had consistently received strong feedback over the years suddenly found themselves downgraded, which made them eligible for the cuts. One worker expressed frustration, saying they had been meeting expectations for years, only to be marked down without explanation during this recent review cycle. The layoffs are part of CEO Mark Zuckerberg's efforts to streamline Meta's workforce as the company focuses on its investments in artificial intelligence and virtual reality. While Meta aims to hire more machine learning engineers, it plans to continue trimming what it considers its lowest performers. Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Feb 11, 2025

Headline: OnePlus 13 available at Rs 5,000 discount but the offer is for a limited timeOnePlus is hosting a Red Rush sale, which kicked off on February 11 and will go on till February 16. The sale is live on both online and offline platforms.
Content:
OnePlus is hosting a Red Rush sale, which the company says is in “initiative for the Indian community”. The sales began on February 11, and will go on till February 16. The sale offers are available both online and offline, including on the OnePlus India website, OnePlus Store App, OnePlus experience stores, Amazon India and the company’s mainline partners such as Reliance Digital, Croma, Vijay Sales, Bajaj Electronics, and others. The sale is interesting because the company is offering discounts, deals and bank offers on fairly new devices, including the OnePlus 13, OnePlus 13R, OnePlus Pad 2, and the OnePlus Watch 2R, among others. Of these, we find the deal on the OnePlus 13 particularly good.  OnePlus says that during the Red Rush sale, customers will be able to get an instant bank discount of Rs 5,000 on the purchase of the OnePlus 13. This is valid only on select bank cards including ICICI Bank, OneCard, RBL Bank, and HDFC Bank. With the bank discount, the price of the OnePlus 13 comes down to Rs 64,999 from 69,999 for the base 12GB RAM and 256GB storage variant. The same discount also applied to the 16GB RAM and 512GB storage model, bringing its price down from Rs 76,999 to Rs 71,999.  In addition to that, if you have an old smartphone that you are willing to exchange, you will be eligible for up to Rs 7,000 discount, on top of the bank offer. For instance, if you have a OnePlus 10 Pro, you can get up to Rs 20,810 at the time of exchange. Which means, the price of the OnePlus 13 after exchange would come down to Rs 44,189. You can exchange smartphones of any brand, it does not necessarily have to be a OnePlus phone.  You can also read our detailed review of the OnePlus 13. The OnePlus 13 features a 6.82-inch 120Hz QHD+ display with Dolby Vision support, 1,600nits local brightness, and 4,500nits of peak brightness. It is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, built on a 3nm process, which is paired with LPDDR5X RAM, and UFS 4.0 storage. Running the phone is OxygenOS 15 based on Android 15. The OnePlus 13 comes with a promise of four years of major Android updates and five years of security patches.
Fuelling the OnePlus 13 is a 6,000mAh battery with support for 100W wired charging and 50W wireless charging. For photography, the OnePlus 13 uses a 50-megapixel LYT-808 main camera, along with a 50-megapixel telephoto and ultrawide sensors. It features a 32-megapixel front camera. Headline: AI will not lead to job loss but work will change, PM Modi says at Paris AI SummitAt the AI Action Summit in Paris, prime minister Narendra Modi, who is a co-chair at the event, talked about AI and job loss.
Content: At the AI Action Summit in Paris, prime minister Narendra Modi –– who is co-chair at the event with French president Emmanuel Macron –– spoke about AI, its development, governance, and the need for skilling and reskilling people. The prime minister addressed AI’s “most feared disruption”, which is job loss. However, he believes that AI will not lead to loss of jobs. “History has shown that work does not disappear due to technology, it’s nature changes. New types of jobs are created,” said Modi at the Paris AI Summit. “We need to invest in skilling and reskilling our people for an AI-driven future,” he adds. Modi also addressed the many biases that AI carries due to the dataset it is trained on. “While the positive potential of AI is absolutely amazing, there are many biases that we need to think carefully about,” he said. “We must build quality datasets free from biases. We must democratise technology and create people-centric applications,” he suggests. Talking about the transformative potential that AI has, Modi said "AI is already reshaping our polity, economy, security, and society. AI is writing the code for humanity in this century, but it is very different from other technology milestones in human history." He mentioned the scale and speed at which AI is advancing and the need for global effort to govern the technology. "There is also a deep interdependence across borders. Therefore, there is a need for collective global effort to establish governance and standards that uphold our shared values, address risks, and build trust," he said. The prime minister also underlined the positive impact of AI including that in healthcare, education, and agriculture. "AI can help transform millions of lives by improving health, education, agriculture, and so much more. It can help create a world in which the journey to sustainable development goals becomes easier and faster," he said. To achieve this, he suggests a people-centric approach, saying, "We must pull together resources and talent. We must develop an open-source system that enhances trust and transparency. We must democratise technology and create people-centric applications." Modi also addressed the issue of cybersecurity, disinformation, and the threat of deepfakes due to AI. "We must address concerns related to cybersecurity, disinformation, and deepfakes," he said, reiterating the need for better security measures and ethical AI deployment. The PM also addressed the environmental impact of AI, acknowledging its high energy consumption and the need for sustainable solutions. "There is no doubt that the high energy intensity of AI needs to be looked into. This will require green power to fuel its future," he said. He pointed out the International Solar Alliance between India and France, as an example of how nations can work together to integrate AI with renewable energy sources. "As we advance our partnership to AI, it is a natural progression from sustainability to innovation to shape a smarter and responsible future." Modi concluded his address by talking about India's success in building digital public infrastructure at scale. "India has successfully built a digital public infrastructure for over 1.4 billion people at a very low cost. It is built around an open and accessible network." Headline: Apple releases emergency update to fix major security flaw in iOSApple has released an urgent iOS and iPadOS update to protect iPhones and iPads from a critical zero-day vulnerability. Users are advised to download iOS 18.3.1, iPadOS 18.3.1, or iPadOS 17.7.5 immediately to protect their devices.
Content:
Apple has issued an emergency security update for iOS and iPadOS – iOS 18.3.1 and iPadOS 18.3.1. The updates are now available to download and Apple has urged users to download it immediately to protect their devices from a serious zero-day vulnerability. The company in its security note revealed that this vulnerability has already been exploited in "extremely sophisticated" targeted attacks, and hence it is urgent for iPhone and iPad users to install the update without delay. The vulnerability in the Apple devices tracked as CVE-2025-24200, was initially discovered and reported by Bill Marczak of Citizen Lab. Now with the new update Apple has highlighted that the flaw is an authorization issue that could allow attackers to bypass critical security features, including USB Restricted Mode, a safeguard designed to prevent unauthorized access to locked devices.
“Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited in an extremely sophisticated attack against specific targeted individuals,” says Apple. What does the new update from Apple fix According to Apple the flagged zero-day vulnerability specifically impacts USB Restricted Mode, a security feature which was introduced in iOS 11.4.1 nearly seven years ago. This feature when turned on blocks USB accessories from establishing a data connection if the device has been locked for more than an hour. Now this discovered flaw could allow attackers to disable this feature, potentially exposing sensitive data. Apple has also highlighted that this vulnerability could be exploited in physical attacks, where hackers can gain direct access to the targeted device.Affected devices  The vulnerability impacts a wide range of Apple devices, including:
iPhone XS and later models
iPad Pro 12.9-inch (3rd generation and later)
iPad Pro 11-inch (1st generation and later)
iPad Air (3rd generation and later)
iPad (7th generation and later)
iPad mini (5th generation and later)
Older models like the iPad Pro 12.9-inch (2nd generation), iPad Pro 10.5-inch, and iPad (6th generation)
Update is now available  While the risk is high, Apple has made the fix available in iOS 18.3.1, iPadOS 18.3.1, and iPadOS 17.7.5. How to install the update To update your iPhone or iPad:  – Connect to Wi-FiMake sure the connection is stable for no interruptions.  – Now go to  the "Settings" app on your iPhone or iPad. – Next tap on "General" and then select "Software Update." – If the update – iOS 18.3.1, iPadOS 18.3.1, or iPadOS 17.7.5–  is available, tap "Download and Install."  – Now follow the on-screen instructions to complete the process. – Once the update is installed, your device will restart automatically.Published By: Divya BhatiPublished On: Feb 11, 2025Also Read |  Siri saves life of Apple user after he was left immobile in bathroom for 2 daysAlso Read |  Woman loses over Rs 2 lakh after clicking job interview link in SMSAlso Read |  Elon Musk offers $97 billion to buy OpenAI, Sam Altman rejects it and mocks him saying we will buy X for $9B

Headline: Amazon is using 7 lakh robots to do variety of tasks alongside human employeesAmazon has ramped up its robotics operations, now using over 7.50 lakh robots in its fulfilment centers globally. These robots are integrated with human workers to perform various tasks such as moving packages and more.
Content: Amazon has ramped up its robotics operations, now using over 7.50 lakh robots in its fulfilment centers globally, Business Insider reports. These robots are integrated with human workers to perform various tasks such as moving packages, sorting items, and creating customised packaging. Here is everything you need to know.When did Amazon start using robots for tasks? The journey of Amazon’s robotics division began in 2012 with the acquisition of Kiva Systems for $775 million. The early robots, designed by Kiva, primarily followed barcode markers on the warehouse floor to navigate and transport items. However, over a decade later, Amazon’s robotics have evolved with technologies such as artificial intelligence and machine learning, resulting in more advanced robots like Proteus, a fully autonomous system that moves seamlessly alongside workers. Proteus, which was introduced in 2022 at the Nashville fulfillment center, is reportedly capable of navigating obstacles and transporting packages without needing to be confined to specific areas of the warehouse.advertisementWhy is Amazon using 7 lakh robots to perform tasks?The report says that this expansion in robotics has been done to help Amazon increase delivery speeds while reducing operational costs. Tye Brady, Amazon’s Chief Technologist for Robotics, stated that the company’s advancements in robotics contribute to faster deliveries and potentially save the company billions annually. By 2030, the company could be saving as much as $10 billion per year, according to estimates from Morgan Stanley.Amazon claims to have generated more jobs in AI after opting for robotics The report says that this expansion in robotics has been done to help Amazon increase delivery speeds while reducing operational costs. Tye Brady, Amazon’s Chief Technologist for Robotics, stated that the company’s advancements in robotics contribute to faster deliveries and potentially save the company billions annually. By 2030, the company could be saving as much as $10 billion per year, according to estimates from Morgan Stanley.Amazon claims to have generated more jobs in AI after opting for robotics In addition to improving operational efficiency, the integration of robotics has led Amazon to create more jobs in fields like AI and machine learning. The company has also taken steps to improve its robotics capabilities by investing in startups. For instance, Amazon brought on board three founders from the robotics startup Covariant and licensed some of its foundation models. Additionally, the company launched the Amazon Industrial Innovation Fund in 2022, which reportedly provides investments to companies involved in emerging technologies. This has led to partnerships with firms like Agility Robotics, whose two-legged robot Digit is now being tested in Amazon’s fulfilment centers.Amazon's premium robots can manage over 200 million items Among Amazon’s more premium robots is Sparrow, a robotic arm introduced in 2023 at the Texas fulfilment center. Unlike earlier models that were limited to handling large packages, Sparrow can pick individual items from containers using AI and computer vision. This advanced system is capable of recognising and managing over 200 million unique items, boosting efficiency in sorting and storing products. Other robots, such as Hercules and Titan, are designed to lift heavy pods of items in Amazon’s warehouses. Hercules, introduced in 2017, can carry pods weighing up to 1,250 pounds, while Titan, which debuted the same year, can handle loads twice as heavy. Robots like Pegasus and Xanthus play a crucial role in sorting packages, with Xanthus being noted for its versatility and reduced production costs.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Feb 11, 2025

Headline: Meta brings Instagram Teen Accounts in India with supervision tools for parentsMeta is expanding Instagram Teen Accounts to India, bringing new safety measures, privacy protection, and parental supervision tools for users under 16. Some features will also extend to users under 18.
Content:
Meta is expanding Instagram Teen Accounts to India. This new service of Instagram will be offering more built-in safety measures, privacy protections, and even parental supervision tools to create a safer experience for teenagers online. The features will be available for users under the age of 16. However, some features will also extend to users under 18, depending on the region and specific features. According to Meta, the new Instagram for Teens addresses several concerns about the digital interaction of teens on the internet, including threats like bullying, harmful content, and so on. “Instagram’s new Teen Accounts address these concerns by automatically placing all teens in the highest safety settings, empowering them with better tools to navigate the digital world securely,” says Meta.Features of Instagram Teen Accounts Instagram Teen Accounts will offer the following features to protect teens online. Additionally, it will also restrict teen users from making changes to settings and will require parental approval. Private Accounts: When an Instagram account is under a Teen account, Meta will keep the account private by default for users under 16. This will require users to approve any new follow request and view who is requesting to connect and who can view their content. Messaging Restrictions: Instagram for Teens accounts will only receive messages from individuals they follow or are already connected with. This is further aimed at reducing the risk of unsolicited or potentially harmful messages or DMs online. Sensitive Content Control: Instagram will automatically place teens in the most restrictive setting concerning sensitive content. This will limit the exposure of content to teens and shield them from explicit content, depictions of physical altercations, or promotions of cosmetic procedures in areas like Explore and Reels. Limited Interactions: Additionally, Teen accounts will only be tagged or mentioned by people they follow. The Teen accounts will also have an anti-bullying feature, under which Hidden Words is enabled by default to filter out offensive language in comments and direct message requests. Time Management Tools: The Teen account will also alert users about their internet usage. It will prompt notifications and remind them to exit the app after 60 minutes of daily usage. Additionally,  Teen accounts will also have a Sleep Mode enabled from 10 PM to 7 AM, muting notifications and automatically replying to direct messages during these hours.Supervision tools for parents While there will be privacy restrictions for teens, Instagram for Teens, especially for those under 16 years, will require parental approval to make settings less restrictive. Parents can also enable supervision for older teens (16+) at any time. Soon, parents will also have the ability to directly adjust these settings for more protection. Additionally, more parental supervision features will include: Monitoring recent conversations – Parents will be able to see a list of people their teen has messaged in the past seven days—but without reading message content, maintaining the privacy of the teen. Setting daily time limits – Parents will also be able to set limits. Once the set time limit is reached, the teen will no longer be able to access Instagram. Blocking Instagram during specific hours – Parents will also be allowed to restrict Instagram access at night or during designated times with a simple toggle.
