Headline: Beats Powerbeats Pro 2 launched in India, brings heart rate monitoring through ears to usersBeats has launched the Powerbeats Pro 2, its earbuds aimed at athletes and those with active lifestyles, in India. The Pro 2 is a pair of premium earbuds with features like active heart-rate tracking through ears and a price tag of Rs 29,900.
Content: Among the athletes, those with active lifestyle and fitness enthusiasts, Powerbeats is a familiar name. Now, Beats is launching the PowerBeats Pro 2 in India. The Pro 2, which will go on open sale in India from February 13, are premium earbuds aimed at fitness enthusiasts. But unlike other premium earbuds, the Pro 2 comes with a truly unique feature — a heart rate sensor which allows each bud to monitor and report heart rate during a workout. Apart from the new feature-set, the Pro 2 buds also come with a redesigned ear hook and significant upgrades to sound, battery life, and call performance. Another noteworthy improvement is Active Noise Cancellation (ANC), complete with the Transparency mode.  Beats, which is an Apple company, is in a way marrying the Apple AirPods Pro 2 with the specific requirements that athletes or fitness enthusiasts have from their earbuds. It also, in some ways, feels like the next-generation AirPods Pro 3.  Beats said that the Powerbeats Pro 2 can be ordered today from Apple India website. It will go on open sale in a couple of days in four colours — Jet Black, Quick Sand, Hyper Purple, and Electric Orange. In India, the Powerbeats Pro 2 has been priced at Rs 29,900.  “Powerbeats Pro 2 is the most impressive product in Beats’ history — developed to withstand intense training sessions and equipped with our most innovative technology and powerful sound,” said Oliver Schusser, Apple’s vice president of Music, Sports, and Beats. “Now with Heart Rate Monitoring for workouts, Active Noise Cancellation, and Transparency mode, Powerbeats Pro 2 sets a new standard in audio for fitness.” To offer its heart-rate monitoring the Pro 2 uses LED optical sensors, which are housed in each bud. These sensors pulse over 100 times per second to measure blood flow, and the data is fine-tuned into heartbeats and then is shared with a compatible app. Like other Apple products, the Powerbeats Pro 2 also works best when paired with an iPhone or other Apple products. Inside it uses the Apple-designed H2 and it offers up to 45 hours of battery life with the charging case. Talking of case, it too has received some significant upgrades. It can now charge the buds faster — 5 minutes of charging equals roughly 90 minute of playback time —  despite the case being 35 per cent smaller. The Powerbeats Pro 2 case is also the first Beats case to support wireless charging.  Beats on Tuesday also launched the “Listen to Your Heart” campaign to coincide with the arrival of the Powerbeats Pro 2. The campaign brings together LeBron James, Lionel Messi, and Shohei Ohtani as each of them incorporates the Powerbeats Pro 2 in their fitness routine.Published By: Ankita GargPublished On: Feb 11, 2025

Headline: Google announces dates for I/O 2025 event: What to expectGoogle's next big event has finally been announced. The I/O developer conference 2025 is set to take place starting May 20, 2025.
Content:
Mark your calendars for the next big event by Google – the I/O developer conference 2025. The company has recently announced that the event will be a 2-day show, starting May 20 to May 21, 2025. Announcing the dates, Google stated, in this event “you’ll learn more about Google’s newest products, technologies and innovations in AI.” The event will be “open to everyone online” and will feature “livestreamed keynotes and sessions,” as stated in the FAQ. Similar to previous years, there will also be an in-person part held at the Shoreline Amphitheatre in Mountain View, California. 
 


 The announcement note highlights that the I/O 2025 will begin with a main keynote by CEO Sundar Pichai at 10 AM PT (10.30 PM IST). After that, there will be a developer keynote and on-demand technical sessions. This year, Google will be “streaming developer product keynotes live from Shoreline across both days.” It states, “We’ll start day one with keynotes, followed by breakout sessions, workshops, demos, networking opportunities and more continuing on day two.” Google I/O developer conference 2025: What to expect  There will be plenty of announcements about Gemini, other AI updates, and more details on Android 16. The I/O homepage features a “Start building today” section highlighting the Gemini open model, Google AI Studio, and NotebookLM. In a developer-focused announcement, Google specifically mentions “Android, AI, web, cloud, and more.”  Google will make the official agenda and session list available closer to I/O 2025. Online registration begins today and is free. It states, “Registration for Google I/O 2025 enables you to stay up to date with the schedule and content along with relevant developer news via email. As a registrant, you can also build a profile in the Google Developer Program to get the most out of the digital experience by viewing content that’s relevant to you.”  The last Google I/O started on May 14, 2024, and was filled with numerous announcements, including new Gemini AI features and models, the Project Astra AI assistant, the Veo generative AI video model, and a major AI-driven update for Google Search. While the 2023 I/O also featured plenty of AI news, it was also the event where Google introduced the Pixel Fold, Pixel Tablet, and Pixel 7A.  Now, in 2025, it will be fun to watch what Google has in its bag of innovations. It is also noteworthy that the Google event will overlap with the Microsoft’s Built conference, starting May 19 to May 20. While Microsoft could reveal Copilot Plus updates, Google is expected to showcase much more. Published By: Unnati GusainPublished On: Feb 12, 2025Must Watch

Headline: iPhone SE 4 now expected next week, M4 MacBook Air launch within weeksThe iPhone SE 4, initially expected to launch this week, is now anticipated to be unveiled next week. Additionally, the M4 MacBook Air is expected to launch in the coming weeks.
Content:
The long-anticipated iPhone SE 4 was expected to launch this week. However, the estimates have proved to be a bit off and it looks like there is a little delay in the launch. Mark Gurman, a popular Apple analyst, who had initially predicted that the iPhone SE 4 will launch this week, has revised his prediction and says the launch may now take place next week. Although, he does say, “new iPhone SE is still imminent”. The iPhone SE 4 “should be announced by next week, when the company is holding product briefings,” he says.  Interestingly, as per the latest update from the Apple analyst, the next few days will be quite busy for Apple. According to Gurman, there is going to be a “small announcement” tomorrow. He has not mentioned what the announcement will be about. Gurman also predicts that there is going to be some Apple Vision Pro-related announcement this Friday. “For Friday, Apple Vision Pro reps are reaching out to press about an announcement to come,” he writes.  Additionally, he also claims that the M4 MacBook Air, which is another Apple device with a lot of anticipation around it, will launch in the next few weeks. “M4 MacBook Air within weeks,” Gurman predicts. 
 advertisement


 If Gurman’s predictions are true, there is a lot to expect from Apple in the coming few weeks. Apple kicked off the purported series of launches with the launch of Beats Powerbeats Pro 2 on Tuesday. The earbuds are aimed at athletes and have a standout feature, which is a heart rate sensor that allows each of the buds to monitor and report heart rate during a workout. The earbuds also feature Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) with the Transparency mode. The Powerbeats Pro 2 is priced at Rs 29,900.Apple iPhone SE 4: What to expect The upcoming iPhone SE 4 is set to get a major design overhaul –– it is expected to move away from its traditional small form factor and adopt an iPhone 14-like design. The affordable iPhone is also believed to replace the Touch ID home button with FaceID, and get a bigger 6.1-inch OLED display with a 60Hz refresh rate instead of the previous 4.7-inch LCD screen. The iPhone SE 2025 is also believed to bring some big camera improvements with an upgrade to a 48-megapixel rear camera from the 12-megapixel one in iPhone SE 3. The front camera could see a boost to a 24-megapixel sensor.   The general design of the iPhone is expected to resemble the recent iPhones, instead of the rounded edge-design that felt like an iPod. The jury is still out on whether the phone will feature a Dynamic Island but many rumours suggest that the phone will run on Apple A18 chip with 8GB RAM and support Apple Intelligence.Published By: Nandini YadavPublished On: Feb 12, 2025Also read |  Elon Musk offers $97 billion to buy OpenAI, Sam Altman rejects it and mocks him saying we will buy X for $9BAlso read |  Google announces dates for I/O 2025 event: What to expectAlso read |  36 previously banned Chinese apps make a comeback in IndiaMust Watch

Headline: 36 previously banned Chinese apps make a comeback in IndiaSeveral Chinese apps that were banned in India in 2020 have quietly returned, either under new names or with slight modifications. Some have changed ownership, while others remain largely the same.
Content: Back in 2020, India banned about 267 Chinese apps, citing security risks and concerns over data privacy. This move came in response to the rising border tensions between India and China following the Galwan Valley clash. Fast-forward to 2025 and many of these apps have made a comeback, either in their original form or disguised under different names. Currently, at least 36 of the previously banned apps are now available for download on the Google Play Store and Apple’s App Store. Some of these have retained their original identity, while others have undergone minor tweaks in branding, logo, or ownership details. These apps belong to various categories, including gaming, shopping, entertainment, file sharing, and content creation. As reported by India Today, among the returning apps to Indian app stores, file-sharing service Xender, streaming platforms MangoTV and Youku, shopping app Taobao, and dating app Tantan stand out. While MangoTV remains unchanged, the others have undergone minor modifications. For instance, Xender is now listed on Apple’s App Store as Xender: File Share, Share Music, though it is still unavailable on the Google Play Store. Similarly, Taobao now appears as Mobile Taobao, while Tantan has been rebranded as TanTan - Asian Dating App. Interestingly, while some of these apps continue to be run by their original Chinese developers, others have taken different routes to re-enter the Indian market. Shein, the popular fashion retailer, made a return via a licensing deal with Reliance. The Indian government has confirmed that all user data related to Shein will now be stored within India, ensuring its Chinese parent company has no access. Despite the bans, clone versions of many apps continue to surface. In some cases, the original developers have simply rebranded their apps with minor changes, keeping the core functionality intact. PUBG Mobile, for example, was banned in 2020 but returned in 2021 as Battlegrounds Mobile India (BGMI) under South Korea's Krafton. However, even this version faced another ban in 2022, only to be reinstated in 2023 after meeting security and compliance standards. The presence of these apps highlights how difficult it is to enforce an absolute ban. While the government can restrict access to certain applications, alternative versions, clones, and similar services often reappear under different names. Some of the returning apps now list ownership from India, Singapore, Vietnam, South Korea, Seychelles, Japan, and Bangladesh, making it even harder to track their origins.Published By: Aman rashidPublished On: Feb 12, 2025Also read |  Poco X7, X7 Pro review: Which is best for you?Also read |  Snapdragon 8 Elite for just Rs 55,000: Is iQOO 13 too good to be true?Also read |  Can't see notifications on your Samsung phone anymore? Headline: Pixel 9a renders leaked: Colours, design, specs and moreIn the latest leak, alleged official renders of the Pixel 9a in all its expected colours have surfaced online. These shades are very much in line with what we have already seen in the Pixel 9 series.
Content:
In the latest update, alleged renders of the Google Pixel 9a have leaked online, showcasing the phone’s design in all its expected colours. For those unfamiliar, the Pixel 9a is expected to be announced on March 19, followed by a release on March 26. Interestingly, if Google sticks to the rumoured March 19 release date, the Pixel 9a will arrive two months earlier than previous Pixel A-series devices. For context, both the Pixel 7a and 8a were launched in May during their respective years at Google I/O. We are still a month away from the rumoured launch, and if it doesn’t happen then, it is expected to take place during Google I/O 2025, scheduled for May 20-21. As mentioned in previous reports by Android Headlines, the Google Pixel 9a is expected to be released in four colours: Obsidian, Porcelain, Iris, and Peony. In the latest leak, alleged official renders of all the colours have surfaced online. These shades are very much in line with what we have already seen in the Pixel 9 series. Additionally, the renders suggest that Google may finally move away from the bar-style camera island on Pixel phones, opting instead for a flush design.Google Pixel 9a: Expected price, specs and features According to various reports, in terms of pricing, the Pixel 9a will start in the US at $499 (roughly Rs 43,300) for the 128GB storage option, while the 256GB storage will cost $599 (roughly Rs 52,000). For those choosing Verizon’s mmWave version, an extra $50 will be added to these prices. These figures align with the Pixel 8a’s starting price in the US, though the higher storage option is slightly more expensive this time around. Of course, the Pixel 9a’s price will likely differ when it launches in India. For context, the Google Pixel 8a was launched in India at Rs 52,999 and Rs 59,999 for the 128GB and 256GB storage variants, respectively.

 As seen in the leaked renders, the Pixel 9a is rumoured to move away from the bar-style camera island seen in previous models, instead adopting a flush back design. This change is likely due to the inclusion of a larger 5,100mAh battery, the biggest ever in a Pixel device. Despite the increased battery size, the phone is expected to remain compact, featuring a 6.28-inch display with a peak brightness of 2,700 nits and an HDR brightness of 1,800 nits. The display is also tipped to support a 120Hz refresh rate and a 240Hz touch sampling rate. Under the hood, the Pixel 9a is rumoured to be powered by Google’s Tensor G4 chipset, paired with 8GB of LPDDR5X RAM. Storage options will include 128GB and 256GB, both utilising UFS 3.1 technology. The phone will run Android 15 out of the box and is expected to come with a promise of seven years of software and security updates. On the camera front, the Pixel 9a is expected to feature a dual-camera setup, including a 48-megapixel primary sensor and a 13-megapixel ultra-wide lens. The front-facing camera will also use the same 13-megapixel sensor. Google’s signature camera features, such as Night Sight, Astrophotography, and Super Res Zoom, are expected to make an appearance. Despite its impressive specs, the Pixel 9a might have a few limitations, similar to the Pixel 8a. Headline: After Google, Apple Maps renames Gulf of Mexico to Gulf of AmericaA day after Google, Apple has also renamed the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America.  This comes after the US President Donald Trump signed an exclusive order on his first day in office.
Content:
Following the US President's orders, Apple has also changed the name of the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America. This comes a day after Google followed orders and renamed the large water body. For perspective, the name "The Gulf of Mexico" has been in use for centuries, dating back to the 16th century. But not any more, as the newly appointed US President Donald thinks, "The Gulf of America has a nice ring to it". He liked this idea so much that he signed an exclusive order to rename the water body on his first day at the office. After the official order, the US government updated its official map to reflect the new name. While Google followed suit by making the change in its Google Maps app earlier this week, Apple Maps has also done the same.  So far, Apple and Google have revised the names, but Microsoft's Bing is yet to do so. According to a report, published by CNET, Microsoft is planning for this change soon. It states that Microsoft is updating Bing Maps to align with the Geographic Names Information System's nomenclature in the United States, which includes renaming the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America within US territory. While this nomenclature update is limited to the US, Google Maps shows the new name side by side for the rest of the world. If you search for the Gulf of Mexico, Google Maps will show you the water body named as is but has the Gulf of America written in bracket with it. Meanwhile, Apple Maps has only applied this change in the US and shows the old name in other countries. 

 



Google Maps and Apple Maps in India (Left to right)
advertisement The decision has sparked mixed reactions, with many questioning the necessity of the name change. Historically, the Gulf has been shared by the United States, Mexico, and Cuba, serving as a vital hub for shipping, fishing, and energy production. However, the US administration at the time defended the renaming, stating that it better reflects America’s influence over the waters. Mexico has also condemned the move, asserting that the US cannot unilaterally rename a body of water shared by both nations.  Republican lawmakers have praised Google for complying with Trump’s order while criticising Apple for not immediately following suit. US Representative Greg Steube even took to Facebook on Tuesday, stating that Apple is “still lost at sea.”  But now that Apple has changed the name, the focus will be on the Microsoft.
